story:
My Father’s Arrows, Inc. is a local, faith based, community driven, public charity with federal tax exempt status under section 501 (c) (3) of the Internal Revenue Code. Our desire is to help children in foster care. We work to educate the community on the children’s needs, recruit foster/adoptive parents and mentors, and procure child specific resources to help these children achieve their maximum potential while filling their lives with hope and promise for the future. We are currently developing a children’s home, so we will be able to provide more safe homes for our children in Northwest FL.

Mission: Our Mission is to provide needing children with safe, permanent, loving Christian homes where they will develop into lifelong servants for our Lord Jesus Christ and live as responsible, educated, law abiding citizens with great promise and hope for the future.

.                            

Our Target Population: We serve special needs children in foster care, defined as:

  • Over 10 years of age
  • Sibling groups
  • Minority groups
  • Mental handicaps
  • Physical handicaps

Vision: To faciliate, encourage, and publicize the need for foster/adoption/mentoring of special needs children in foster care as being defined as: Children over 10 years of age, minority groups, sibling groups, and children with mental and/or physical handicaps. We intend to inspire and educate community members that otherwise would not have considered serving these children in such capacity. We are coordinating resources for special needs foster children that will enhance their quality of life and assist them in maximizing their potential for independence while meeting their unique challenges.

Our Values

Dignity- We believe that every person is valuable and deserves to be treated with dignity, courtesy, respect, and consideration for their individuality.

Integrity- We will adhere to high Christian moral and ethical principles in our choices and our relationships.

Objectivity- We will use unbiased, creative thinking to guide our actions and reactions to best promote our organizational goals.

Service- We will treat our children and peers with compassion and demonstrate a servant heart with kindness and diligence.

Accountability- We will promote an atmosphere of transparency that will produce corporate accountability and yield a high level of trust in our organization.

In order to establish the vision we need to raise funds for a storefront. This will allow us to sell items to generate an ongoing source of income to provide for this much needed program. We currently operate out of a building that allows us to collect and sort donations, hold classes, and have a fellowship hall where we serve the local orphans through meals, on site food pantry, and special events. The funds raised will allow us to rent a much needed storefront building for the day to day operation where people can shop, continue to donate or volunteer. If funds raised exceed expections we could move to a rent free by building what we need and move quicker to the next phase.
You're welcome to visit our web site at www.myfathersarrows.org to learn more about us, volunteer and meet our board.
Lo, children are an heritage of the LORD: and the fruit of the womb is his reward. As arrows are in the hand of a mighty man; so are children of the youth. Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them: they shall not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemies in the gate.
Psalm 127:3-5

story:
We present here an outline of Rimrock Gardens, a senior living facility to be located in Nucla at the site of the old unused Elementary School. The school is located on Main Street in Nucla, which is in the center of the west end of Montrose County in Western Colorado. Please contact Lead Developer Reed Mitchell with questions and comments about the project by phone: (970) 428-2770.

The plan includes building an indoor senior park in the old gymnasium. This indoor park facility will have warm, safe walkways in a lush garden type environment that will give our local seniors a place to relax, walk and safely enjoy socialization in a pleasant environment. 

Rimrock Gardens will also feature a healthy full meal service for residents and locals from the extensive kitchen facilities the school had. The kitchen will also be completely upgraded and remodeled to today’s strict health standards and be staffed with professional staff creating healthful meals for our residents and guests

Management of Rimrock Gardens will be operated by a company that specializes in senior living and has yet to be identified. Several potential management companies have been contacted and selection of the most qualified will be made prior to breaking ground.

The property has excellent potential for expansion with its 5 acre footprint and 25,000 sq. ft. of existing building area. Other uses might include a skilled nursing facility, senior patio homes or perhaps an urgent care facility. Phase one will use only half the existing building space so there is plenty of room to expand as the operation grows. The plan is for a complete facelift with modern brick and stucco finishes, paved parking and attractive landscaping.

A comprehensive feasibility study is presently being completed by the Highland Group and will be utilized to secure both management and financing as we move forward. The west end community is 100 miles from town in any direction and there are no facilities for seniors in the area so the need will be easy to define. The Highland Group is considered the foremost provider of these needs assessments and feasibility studies in Colorado and their work is highly regarded by the industry.

The Montrose Housing Authority has expressed interest in working with the developer to make this vital project a reality and a financial guarantee for the lender is in the works from the USDA. The Mitchell’s have successfully financed other projects with the USDA in the recent past. The financing of the project estimated at 1.5 million dollars should not be particularly difficult and not take more than a few months to complete, so construction will begin in mid-2015 with occupancy slated for this fall.

Ownership of the facility will be in a non-profit 501c/3 corporation presently being formed so donations to the project will be tax deductible. A website is also in the works to aid in the financing and development of the project. A Letter of Intent was recently signed with the school district to secure the purchase of the property so the clock is ticking toward opening day.

This presentation has been assembled to answer questions about the plans for this vital project, generate community support and attract interest by potential donors. Your interest is greatly appreciated..

Your donation will be giving the elderly people of the West End a facility that they desperately need not only to accommodate them on an individual level, but their families as well.

Thank you.

story:
Avec Weddings & Events is a full-service, boutique event planning and design company. With Paris as our home base, our events have that certain "je ne sais quoi"! We specialize in creating chic, elegant and unforgettable events not only in the country of wine, gastronomy and romance but also in destinations worldwide.

Now it's time to introduce myself! My name is Jennifer Fox, owner and founder of Avec Weddings & Events. I am an American wedding and event planner based in Paris - my second home for the past 5 years.

My love affair with France began when I studied and gained my diploma in Sommellerie from Le Cordon Bleu Paris and has continued even after I graduated with an MBA in International Hospitality and Restaurant Management from Paris' Académie Internationale de Management.

Having a strong hospitality background, I was able to expand my portfolio while working for a Paris based wedding planning company. Combining my party planning experience and my knowledge of French wine, gastronomy and culture, I decided to create Avec Weddings & Events!

Having said all that, starting a company in another country (as an American) presents many roadblocks! There are French visa fees, foreign business permit fees and high financial requirements not to mention the usual business requirements such as registration fees, banking account fees and insurance.

In order to realize my dream, obtain my French business visa and get to work, I need to reach my financial goal. Please contribute what you can to help me do what I do best... host, entertain and plan weddings and events in the city that I love. Merci beaucoup!

*To get more fun info about Avec Weddings & Events, check out the website and blog!

http://www.avecweddingsandevents.com/

https://avecyou.wordpress.com/

story:
Maison d'Art is a not-for-profit, social enterprise that gives skilled volunteers opportunities to create, collaborate & pass on a wealth of knowledge & experience to young and disadvantaged adults through a variety of fun workshops, working holidays, events, excursions, therapies, respite and rehabilitation.

Every spare resource is reinvested.
  • Firstly in funding workshops & projects by giving volunteers the materials, tools & expertise they wouldn't otherwise have access to;
  • secondly in improving our accommodation and onsite facilities;
  • and finally in the advancement of flexible "creator spaces" so that we can increase capacity and help more people find the creative outlet and support they need to succeed.
VISIT OUR WEBSITE

PROJECT GOAL  

  • Keep operating one of few hotels in the area and ensure further development of its touristic infrastructure. ISEO lake is less know versus its northern italy «rivals»  (Como, Garda, Maggiore)
  • Enter into hospitality business (my favorite one) and add various services such as bikes/ boats rent and tours, cultural programs, mountains trips etc.
  • Familiarize people with little known beautiful Northern Italian lake and surroundings.

 

WHAT?

  • Family hotel and restaurant currently run by nice people who have to exit business due to health issues.
  • Stand alone 3 floors building on the lake shore with 11 rooms, cozy restaurant and enormous sunny terrace – all with lake view.
  • Boats pier, private beach, large parking area.
  • Premise was rinnovated a few years ago and can host visitors all year long.

 

WHERE?

  • Situated right between Milan and Verona in a small village on ISEO lake.
  • 1-1,5 hours drive from Milano, Bergamo and Verona international airports
  • Right next to famous Franciacorta area with 200+ vineyards  

 

WHAT TO DO THERE?

  • Combination of clear water, rocky mountains and developed transport infrastructure makes this place a convinient base for travelers who like active leasure and relaxed stay
  • The area is great for biking, trekking, climbing, canoying, fishing and many, many others
  • Boat trip and 11th century abbey visit on Monteisola island where no cars were never allowed
  • Mountain skiing area in 35 km

  • Shopping at designers outlet village

 

We want to rise half of initial budget required to enter the business – for other half we are backed by own savings and family

story:
Hello, my name is Denise and I am the founder of CAT Running (Covering All Terrain Running). In 2013, I figured out a way to bring my two passions in life together - running and animals! As a Pet Parent myself, I have adopted my furry family members from rescue groups and found I wanted to help these groups further - thus CAT Running was born! I created this company to bring people together, for the love of the run and the love of animals, to help local animal rescue groups. These groups provide a wonderful service in finding forever homes for our furry friends, education on the importance of spaying and neutering, and providing love for animals in need. Often, these small organizations do not receive funding other than donations. As my Charity Partner, I can help provide further funds to these organizations, bring awareness to their efforts and ultimately help pets find their forever homes. 

By way of introduction, I spent over 25 successful years in the Hospitality and Media fields doing Sales and Revenue Management. In 2010, I started running local races and my passion grew - this is what inspired me! In my spare time throughout 2013 I researched local running events and venues. By March of 2014 I partnered with a local animal rescue group as my Charity Partner and launched the Inaugural CAT Running 5K in Redmond, Washington. This year we will celebrate the 5th Annual CAT Running 5K with the same fabulous local animal rescue group! In late 2017, I decided I needed to move my career full time to do what I love - produce and hold 5K run/walk events to help animals! As further commitment to pursuing my dream to expand, I recently became an RRCA Certified Race Director (Road Runners Club of America). This will allow me to work with municipalities across the Nation as I work to take CAT Running nationwide. 

CAT Running is dedicated to holding the best running/walking events whether you are a first-time walker or a veteran runner. Even now, we have a strong percentage of runners who return each year. They thank us for the opportunity to be able to help their local animal rescue organizations and enjoy the fun and organized events. It is exciting to see some of the participants bring more fun to the event by dressing up in cat related items/costumes, bringing their dogs to run with them and who knows, one day we will have a cat run along, too!

People love their pets and/or simply love animals, so they come out to lend their support! Research from the American Pet Product Association, shows that people spent $66.75 billion on their pets in the U.S. in 2016 and were targeted to spend $69.36 billion in 2017. According to Running in the USA, “In 2016, the 5K maintained the #1 position of all race distances with 8.2 million finishers." Bringing these two segments together shows great possibilities for CAT Running and helping animals! 

This campaign is extremely important to me because in order to reach more cities and help more animals, I need funding for further marketing and event supplies. I truly believe in the importance of this venue and the impact it has on communities and local animal rescue groups. While there are wonderful running events out there supporting other charity partners, no one nationwide is doing events to support the local animal rescues. There is an absolute need to raise awareness of these organizations, as they survive by way of donations and volunteers. CAT Running is committed to taking our events nationwide and helping animals across the country! 

I am seeking funding to increase my marketing budget, purchase more event supplies, and expand the reach. Marketing funds would be used to further market with social media, advertise with running event websites, radio jingles in new cities and a trailer with logo. Examples of event supplies include traffic cones, course markers, tents, tables, and banners/signage. Even if I don’t obtain my overall goal, the money funded will go towards these items. I will continue to seek corporate event sponsors and continue to self-fund. 

We have several unique perks available at different giving levels to help CAT Running go nationwide! CAT-fabulous items from CATlebrity Autograph Photo, CAT Embroidered Hats, CAT T-shirts to Race Day Starters/Sponsor! 

I whole heartily believe this is the beginning of something MEOWarvelous! Thank you in advance for your support.

Don’t worry, even if you can’t contribute, there are other ways to help! I would truly appreciate you sharing this campaign with your family and friends! Like us on Facebook at CAT Running and then watch for CAT Running to come to a city near you soon, where we would welcome you as a runner/walker or a valued volunteer on Race Day!

Happy running,

Denise

story:
Hi, I’m Jerome. I am a chiropractor, and my partner, K is a massage therapist and we have a big vision for Eau Claire, WI. It’s our home, and we have met a lot of people throughout the years who struggle to make ends meet. Every day in our practice, we work with stress; whether it’s physical, chemical, or emotional, stress has a harmful effect on our health, especially if it’s present all the time. Ultimately, people being under constant stress is what brings them to our office, yet in too many cases, stress is what keeps them away. Specifically, the stress of not having the money to meet their needs. Since I was a chiropractic student, I have had a vision to create an affordable, accessible clinic for chiropractic care in the Chippewa Valley. When I found out that K shared a very similar vision, it just made sense to join forces.

For this to work, we need to be in the office as much as possible, doing the work that allows us to make this impact. We are, and will continue to build the “traditional” side of the business. This is what pays the bills, keeps the doors open and the lights on.

We’re at the stage where I need to work a part-time job outside of my office to pay my own bills. This, was fully expected, and we have no qualms with doing this. The faster we can get past that stage, the faster we can realize our desire to serve all walks of life at Balanced Path Chiropractic.

The Brass tacks:

We need $5,000.00 to keep the business moving in the right direction, so we can open our doors to those in real financial need as soon as possible. Our overhead is very low as a matter of principle. I am choosing not to participate in the insurance system, and as a result I can pass the savings on to the consumer. K’s side of the business is more established, and she also maintains a low overhead. All funds received will be used to offset our expenses (it could pay rent for nearly an entire year) so we can keep focused on growth.

You, the contributor, will get what we do best in exchange for your dollars: chiropractic adjustments and massage! Entry level contributions will earn gift certificates that spend like cash. Those who are able give more will receive full care plans, based not on a dollar amount, but on what care you need, and will likely far outpace the investment.

Imagine the impact of helping make this a reality. There are people in our town, right now, for a wide range of reasons, that simply cannot afford to get the kind of health care that they need. Perhaps an injury is keeping them from their work and a series of adjustments, massage, or both would be the exact thing that would get them back to work. In our broken system of “health insurance”, there are people who fall between the cracks all the time, or find that they simply don’t have coverage for anything but an absolute crisis.

Your investment in Balanced Path Chiropractic & Wayfaring Massage can help us close these gaps! Thank you so much for everything you do...

Sincerely, 

Dr. Jerome and K

I am choosing not to participate in the insurance system, and as a result I can pass the savings on to the consumer. K’s side of the business is more established, and she also maintains a low overhead. All funds received will be used to offset our expenses (it could pay rent for nearly an entire year) so we can keep focused on growth.
You, the contributor, will get what we do best in exchange for your dollars: chiropractic adjustments and massage! Entry level contributions will earn gift certificates that spend like cash. Those who are able give more will receive full care plans, based not on a dollar amount, but on what care you need, and will likely far outpace the investment.
Imagine the impact of helping make this a reality. There are people in our town, right now, for a wide range of reasons, that simply cannot afford to get the kind of health care that they need. Perhaps an injury is keeping them from their work and a series of adjustments, massage, or both would be the exact thing that would get them back to work. In our broken system of “health insurance”, there are people who fall between the cracks all the time, or find that they simply don’t have coverage for anything but an absolute crisis.
Your investment in Balanced Path Chiropractic & Wayfaring Massage can help us close these gaps! Thank you so much for everything you do...
Sincerely, 
Dr. Jerome and K

story:
Well hello there, 

We are Molly & Cory Williams - social media marketing strategists with over ten years of video production experience and small town business owners. We would like to introduce you to Millennial Currency. 

Millennial Currency focuses on giving small businesses a platform and an opportunity to grow in the United States.

 

In growing our own small town business, we noticed a lack of exposure for small town business owners and artisans. We wanted to create a platform that business owners felt comfortable learning from while also promoting and supporting the idea of shopping local. We wanted to create a unique shopping experience that focused on artisans and handmade products produced in the United States. Through our online shop, consumers will be able to learn the stories behind the products they are purchasing and directly contribute to artisans pursuing their passion full time. This campaign will allow us to move forward with the opening of the online store by contributing to the initial startup costs.

 

 

We are seeking $6,000 to purchase custom shipping supplies, purchase additional inventory, and aid in product photography costs. As a perk for joining our campaign, you will be one of the first customers of Millennial Currency and be offered a variety of the handmade products that we hope to carry. We have products ranging from leather goods to home decor items to bake goods and it can all be yours. In addition to products, you will be deeply remembered as part of the foundation of Millennial Currency and what truly made our handmade shop possible.

 

 

We believe our project is important for many reasons. With every product purchased from Millennial Currency - you are allowing an artisan and small business owner to pursue their passion full time. In developing Millennial Currency, we have created real relationships with each and every artisan featured in the shop. We hope to create exposure for the artisans and business owners being featured while also facilitating product sales to allow them to continue with their craft. It can be challenging to find the products you are looking for locally which is why we believe the online platform will be so helpful. Consumers can shop handmade items made in the United States while in the comfort of their own home. Millennial Currency gives shopping local a whole new twist and the experience of knowing exactly where their products are coming from.

We have already started purchasing inventory for Millennial Currency which has proven to be a substantial investment. We have found products handmade in the United States are more costly than bulk wholesale items made from other areas of the world. Due to the handmade nature of the products, we wanted to decrease shipping times by housing the inventory ourselves. Inventory has been a startup expense that we have navigated by ordering limited quantities and keeping our product offering low. This campaign will allow us to continue to build the inventory and purchase shipping supplies so we can official open Millennial Currency.
 

What People Are Saying: 

"I see Millennial Currency growing astronomically over the next year and helping other small businesses do the same." -Jenna Decker of 3 Spoiled Sisters 

"Millennial Currency is a strength, not only for our community, but for small businesses all over the world." -Lacey Beldock of Sheer Lace Photography

"I applaud Molly and Cory for everything they have done not only for my business but others as well. The exposure and guidance they have given to many of us small business owners has proven to be invaluable." -Kristen Ashley of Sugar Valley Bakery 

"Millennial Currency is such a unique business that the small details they put into it really set it apart." -Erika Becht of Erika Anne Photography

"With their support of local area businesses, the impact they have already had on so many of us, and their encouragement of customers to "buy local," an investment in their business will have a much broader impact on the businesses around them. An investment in them will pay dividends in other businesses for years to come." -Audrey Roberts of Maple Rock Bed and Breakfast

Will you help us? 

While an investment in Millennial Currency would be BEYOND appreciated  - we understand if you can’t contribute to our dream at this time. We ask for your help by spreading the word about our campaign and helping us shine a light on our talented artisans and small business owners. We believe in our shop and we hope you’ll join us at this beginning stage of Millennial Currency.

 

Sincerely yours,

Molly & Cory Williams

story:
We are Matt & Christy Griffith, and we want to feed you.

Pimiento Tea Room will serve a rotating menu of Southern-inspired small plates, teas and cocktails, and Sunday brunch.  Giving time and attention to humble ingredients native to our region is our love letter to the original owners of the home.  We hope you'll enjoy the juxtaposition of modern presentations and classic flavors.

There are unique costs associated with this project compared to traditional restaurant spaces, but we know opening the Brown-Holloway House to the public is worth it.  Everyone should be able to enjoy this historic home. 

With your help, we'll be able to make the house safe and accessible to every guest.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are committed to securing the property, and we need your help to kick-start the renovations.  We believe that every backer is helping us build this restaurant!  Everyone who contributes will have their picture added to our restaurant's family portrait- a composite of all who are the brick and mortar of Pimiento Tea Room.  From coupon books for tea and scones (you know, fancy biscuits) to invites to private parties, we've got loads of perks to show our appreciation of your generosity.  We truly cannot do this without your support.

As an alternative, if you are interested in becoming part of our ownership group via investment in either the real estate or restaurant operations, please contact christy@pimientotearoom.com so that we can review our business plan and options with you!

 

The Impact

We believe that breaking bread with neighbors is more important today than ever.  Pimiento Tea Room will become a place where the community can gather, honor our past, celebrate our future, and take respite in a hospitable atmosphere.  Great food has the power to transcend so much; no matter what your beliefs or political persuasions are, sharing food is one [very delicious] way to bring people together!

 

Risks & Challenges

Currently, we have the house under contract as well as architectural renderings.  We have gone through the rezoning process to include the house in the Town Village district.  Many hours have been logged in Town Hall discussing site development options.  Many months have been spent in due diligence to ensure this is a viable project.

The biggest hurdle is finding creative ways to meet important development standards while preserving the style and character of the property.  We are personally investing all that we can, but it is expensive to maintain the features that make this 1840s house so charming while making accommodations for all guests.  We know the community understands the importance of saving as much of our town's history as possible, so we are hopeful that support will come in to help us make this a reality.  This is a project worth funding. 

With the help of backers and investors, we can make this happen. 

 

Make some noise!

We would love for you to become a backer of our Indiegogo campaign, and we are also looking for people who are interested in investing.  Please contact christy@pimientotearoom.com if you would like to learn more.  If you want to see this project come to life, please share this campaign with your friends, family, and neighbors!

story:
(Pro-Tip: Jump down to The Loot section to learn what Quest Inn merch you could have.)

About The DM

Everyone has to start somewhere. 

It's crazy to think that in the last year I have gone from having a dream that combines my biggest passions in life (D&D and cocktails) to being the director of a business and having negotiated a business sale; but that's exactly what's happened. 

Hi, my name's Elliot and I have been a bartender and mixologist for three and a half years. I have managed two bars and one shop and I love fantasy roleplaying games. Managing people has always come fairly naturally to me because I like to lead from the front and listen to the concerns of my staff.  I was once asked by one of my bartenders why I had let a waitress tell me off and I responded that "She was right. I should have known better". Managers are people too, they are fallible and make mistakes. I believe that all staff should feel comfortable to give critical feedback to senior staff members as long as it's constructive. As a person who's work life has entirely been in the service industry, I know the way it feels when working the front lines. I personally like it and I get a lot of energy from serving and interacting with customers, but I also know that it's not for everyone; and, also, it isn't unskilled. I want to run a bar where the staff feel like they're being paid what they have earned. I want to pay my staff a living wage that starts with an extra 20p an hour for just being human and rewards the years spent working in the service industry (and further rewards the number of years spent working for my company).  I also believe in giving people a chance: "No experience but you have the right attitude? Great, we can teach you the rest. Just try to make the most of your potential."

I have been an active LARPer for probably 13+ years, it's hard to remember which early teens age I was when I started. During my final year of undergraduate study in Aberdeen I got involved in the roleplaying society and, after learning the ropes as a player and then moving to Sheffield after graduation, I picked up the mantle of Dungeon Master (DM). I started by playing a Pathfinder campaign but have since converted over to D&D 5e as my primary system. I also like Vampire: The Masquerade and the stunningly ridiculous Paranoia. 

I work hard. At the time of writing I'm the manager of a shop in the centre of York, I'm one of the guides on the York Terror Trail and I'm setting my own company up. Yeah, I'm basically working two and a half jobs but it's all in order to get the future that I really want. That future is a chain of geeky and nerdy bars that bring smiles to people's faces. I'm starting with my favourite genre in the fantasy setting of The Quest Inn, York. I then plan on starting The Spaceship Inn, Leeds (name to be confirmed), a science fiction themed bar in the same model as The Quest Inn. Thereafter, it'll be Whitby for a Dracula/Gothic Horror place, Sheffield for a Wasteland/ Apocalyptic Fallout venue, Newcastle for a Mad Scientist laboratory, and Lincoln for a Steampunk/ Victoriana shindig. The £50,000 campaign investment now is just the start of something huge for cocktail and ale lovers in the North of England. After that? Well, who knows. I wouldn't mind seeing franchised venues popping up across Australia, America, and other countries not beginning with A. 

My plan with The Quest Inn is to share myself with the world and to make the world a better place. As a business representation of my hobbies and interests the fantasy cocktail bar will be the first impression on a visiting customer. A top to toe theming will immediately immerse them in a fantasy realm, where they can let their hair down. Anyone stepping off the street will be able to engage and enjoy this aspect of the business and still leave having had a wonderful time and great service. 

For most of the week that is all there is to The Quest Inn; great food and great cocktails equalling a great experience. But during the hours that are normally quieter? Well, then we've got something special. The area normally in use as the dining area will be offered up to roleplay groups to play their games in; with a setting that enhances their story telling.

Behind the scenes I hope to use The Quest Inn and Bars and Blades Limited to improve the world little by little. I will attempt to use the success of Bars and Blades Limited to support other ventures and small businesses with similar ethics. The beauty of our world is our diversity. I intend to celebrate that.

It Begins In A Tavern...

With your help I will be able to start on a project that has the potential to brighten the world a little. With the £50,000 I am seeking I will be able to secure a bank loan to purchase a profitable restaurant in York, Fiesta Latina. I have agreed a sale price of £125,000 for Fiesta Latina. If this campaign can make that lofty target then it will all be down to the support of the people that The Quest Inn comes to life. I will then use my experience from managing in a similar restaurant to run Fiesta Latina for a whole year. I will use this year and Fiesta Latina's established trade to better learn the practicalities of business ownership. After making the most of the Valentines Day trade in 2019, I will use the business' profits to convert the venue into The Quest Inn. I plan to re-open as The Quest Inn during March of 2019.

The business revenue as The Quest Inn will be mostly derived from food and drinks sales as with any standard bar but there will also be the income from merchandise sales, table hire, and miniatures hire. 

£50,000 will be enough to encourage the banks to invest in The Quest Inn and I will be then be able to use Fiesta Latina's cash-flow to support the rest of the business' requirements. Fiesta Latina itself is still a profitable business. Some people have expressed concerns about why it should be on the market but it's simply a case of retirement for the current owner. 

In my years I have managed to gather a lot of experience in managing people but, because I worked in the service industry not far out of London until just over a year ago, I have not been able to gather much capital of my own. Pretty much all that I had went into the business planning stages that prepared for the launch of the campaign and into the marketing of the campaign.

I have a plan but I need your help to bring it to life. If you want to join the party and bring The Quest Inn into existence then as your Dungeon Master I will reward you handsomely with loot. 

Let's get back to details about The Quest Inn:

Making the World Brighter

The Quest Inn's moral ethos will be built around two key principals: happy staff and happy customers.

To achieve these aims, The Quest Inn will aim to become a living wage employer within its first two years of trading and will operate a transparency policy regarding pay and pay-based incentives for long-standing staff members. Our employees will be at the forefront of our care and every effort will be made to make The Quest Inn a good, honest and enjoyable working environment for all our staff members. We believe that by looking after our staff we will simultaneously improve the customer service experience for our customers, thereby helping us to achieve our other key aim of happy customers alongside our dedication to producing an inventive and delicious cocktail menu; beautifully cooked and presented food; a great and welcoming atmosphere; and, a supportive and encouraging community space.

When entering The Quest Inn for the first time the sight of medieval tavern décor and fantasy costumed staff will greet our customers. The Quest Inn will work hard to provide a friendly and inclusive gaming and restaurant experience that will actively lead the way in creating and promoting a supportive gaming community for both residents and visitors in York.

As a gastro-bar the food will be very important but the drinks will be the primary focus of most of the creative energy. The cocktail menu will feature geek and pop culture named cocktails (and mocktails) and will change regularly; affording the customers a different experience with each visit and encouraging return custom. There will also be a range of locally produced ales from across the burgeoning Yorkshire craft brewing industry as well as a hand selected range of ciders and wines. Our food menu will feature exceptional cuisine for starters, mains, deserts, and table plates (large sharing, feast style, dishes); all presented in keeping with the medieval fantasy theme. There will be generous considerations for vegetarians and other diners with dietary requirements.

As part of the community aspect of the company ethos, and to help combat the midweek slump in trade, Monday to Thursday nights will host table-top gaming evenings. These will enable role-play groups to hire the large tables to play table-top role-play games (RPGs) in an inspiring and immersive environment. We plan to work with the university and other gaming societies in York and will encourage them to host their meetings in The Quest Inn for a reduced rate per head. We also plan to set up mutual marketing and cross-promotional benefits with other gaming enterprises in York. By building these professional relationships The Quest Inn aims to create a central hub for the growing community of gamers in York that will connect and support them, whilst also enriching the cultural life of York.

The Sights and Sounds

The Quest Inn is about providing a fun and safe space for gamers, geeks and medieval enthusiasts to socialise and enjoy great cocktails and food at reasonable prices, as well as adding a dynamic must-visit dining experience to York's thriving tourism scene. The two levels of the Fiesta Latina building will enable the venue to facilitate a duel experience, with the entrance level housing the bar and the more casual areas and the second level being the primary dining and gaming area. This will allow separation of gamers and diners from the main bar to segregate the cocktail bar and dining experiences for the comfort of each patron.

Our food will be excellently cooked rustic food befitting of a medieval banquet but with a flavourful twist. Fiesta Latina currently employs some excellent chefs with a background in Brazilian cuisine it is the intention to keep these chefs on to create dynamic food with a Latin flavour contrasted by a medieval appearance, as befits the fantasy freedom of the theming.

The naming conventions for all dishes and drinks will be drawn from fantasy pop culture references like ‘Totally-Not-Rat-On-A-Stick’ (inspired by Terry Pratchett's 'Rat-Onna-Stick'), and 'Meat-Inna-Bun' both derived from the dishes of C.M.O.T. Dibbler in the Discworld series. Other dishes will be inspired by different medieval-inspired fantasy franchises and tropes, like a Lord of the Rings meat feast dish called “Ork Lunch”; and of course "Lembas Bread".

The cocktail menu, however, will be a lot more fluid. New creations will regularly be added to the menu but there will always be a solid baseline of the classics from the cocktail industry available. Furthermore, the bartenders will be encouraged to broaden their skills and research new techniques. One of our other key aims is to support local craft ale brewers by stocking their cask ales. A few bottled beers will also be available. Our hope is that by working with local breweries we will be able to create an authentic medieval tavern experience. To cater to customers who don’t like cocktails and ales there will be a small range of wines and ciders on offer. A soft drinks range will also be available, primarily led by which ones are required as mixers in the cocktails recipes. The Pepsi products currently used by Fiesta Latina will be continued.

The atmosphere of a medieval tavern with period decoration, including fantasy props and treasures, will be enhanced by ambient music befitting a medieval minstrel. The servers will enhance this fantasy atmosphere through fantasy-themed outfits; however, they won’t be asked to affect false accents or ‘put on a show’ as the intended result is for immersion and not farce.

Our hope is to ensnare every sense in order to fully immerse our patrons in to the Quest Inn fantasy realm to the point where they really feel transported into another world. The whole experience will be a form of escapism with customers leaving the Quest Inn blinking at the sudden return to reality.

This sense of immersion will be key for the ‘Tabletop Evenings’. Groups of roleplayers will be able to hire a table for a reasonable fee, with prices becoming more reasonable if bulk session subscriptions are made. There will be scope for RPG tournaments and competitions to be held in the space as well. A library of miniatures and terrain pieces will be available for roleplayers to enhance their gaming experience even more. It also won’t be limited to tabletop roleplayers, as the space will fit well with hosting Live Action Role-Play groups too.

Customers will also be able to take away branded merchandise as a reminder of their trip. Items like tankards and dice bags will be available for purchase over the bar.

Our target audience will include students, young professionals and tourists. We aim to attract attention from these groups by partnering with student unions, societies, other local game shops and Visit York. We also hope that we can build up strong rapport with existing customers of Fiesta Latina so that they will be encouraged to continue their patronage. Furthermore, we trust that our location’s proximity to Clifford’s Tower, Jorvik Viking Centre, and the York Dungeon will also entice new customers both local and tourist alike.

The Loot

The Story of the Adventurer.

Our brave hero climbs the ranks from lowest level one to the most accomplished individual of their time. A story unfolds as you read through the perks of the adventurer's tier.

This table shows what can be found in each tier of the Adventurer's Story. 

For each rung of the perk ladder you will get all that has come before you. So, the more you want the higher you go. 

As with all good RPGs the more risk taken the better the loot. 

The Wall of Fame will be on the ground floor and visible as you enter the bar. Your name on the Wall of Fame can either be your own or one of your RPG character's names. The Portraits will be painted by local York artists and can either be of yourselves or of your favourite character that you have played in tabletop RPGs. 

The Adventurer's Card will be like your own personal character card and will grant you 5% off at any Bars and Blades venue for life. The Hero's Card is the same but with 10% off. 

The Dice bags, Tankards, and Dice sets will all have the Q Logo (seen in the campaign overview) on them.

The Drinks Tokens will grant you one free drink upon presentation of your token to The Quest Inn. Any one drink will be permitted. 

The 10x Tabletop Sessions will be 10 individual bookings of a table in The Quest Inn during Tabletop Evenings. The year's subscription is for an individual and limited in usage only by one calendar year (as many bookings as desired can be made by that individual in that year.

The Handmade Cloak will be just like the one I am wearing in the video. 

 

The Character Perks:

As our hero progresses they meet new and interesting characters. Their stories can be seen in the perks list along with the items associated with them.

Risks & Challenges

This is my first venture and as concepts go it's no small plan. I do have experience in the day to day management of a venue like Fiesta Latina and that is why I have given myself one year in charge of that business. In that one year, spent running Fiesta Latina, I will be able to gain all of the necessary knowledge to be able to make the right decisions for The Quest Inn from a financial and legal standpoint, to add to my existing knowledge on practical management. It will also give me one year to put in place all of the necessary resources to have a quick transformation time. 

The Quest Inn's concept is born out of a huge and still growing, yet still slightly socially marginalised, community of geeks who are always seeking connectivity and social hubs. The digital market already caters to the tabletop RPG community with online shows like Critical Role, Maze Arcana, and Acquisitions Incorporated; each with up to tens of thousands of followers. Whilst this market is being catered for in the digital space it is not being exploited in physical space. This leaves a gap in the market that hasn’t yet been addressed. The Quest Inn aims to exploit this gap in the market by catering specifically to this community but in a manner that should prove attractive to a broad array of audiences. It's in reaching out to those audiences that there is a challenge. Not an insurmountable challenge though.

As this business concept is new to both the bar industry and to the gaming industry there isn’t a benchmark for this model of business. This provides a unique opportunity for marketing and business collaborations and also means that there initially wouldn’t be much in the way of direct competition. Places like Trembling Madness, Stonegate, and the Golden Fleece, Pavement, would be the closest competitors for the atmosphere however they lack the gaming and geek culture aspect of The Quest Inn and also the late-night catering facilities.

There is already a trend in York towards catering to the gaming market with physical spaces but all of the current set ups are only concerned with video games or board games. The retailer Game has recently opened its Belong York gaming area. Pop culture and gaming café’s like Random Encounter on Gillygate, are a trending business model across the country and blend board games with eateries. What is so unique about The Quest Inn is that it will tackle this trend from an entirely new perspective and it will give tabletop RPGs a dedicated space of their own.

Venues like Tavern Brabant, Prague; The Croft Institute, Melbourne; and ABQ, London all encapsulate a specific theme that enraptures and entertains their patrons whilst delivering exceptional service. Like these examples The Quest Inn will deliver an exceptional experience centred around cocktails that enriches the community at the same time. York’s new Viking bar Valhalla, is also be a themed venue but lacks the diversity of services that The Quest Inn will have and it also lacks the commitment to a theme with only the décor representing the idea. Having such a prominent theme can result in customers enjoying the experience and then ticking it off their bucket list. This means that return custom is a challenge but that is why so much time and energy will be put into making the available food and drinks the reason to come back. 

Many roleplay groups have had to find their own spaces in community halls for the purposes of hosting their meetups. Travelling Man does its best to cater to the geek and pop-culture community but as it’s trying to please so many gaming genres it can only provide one night a week to the RPG fans. These venues also lack the catering and refreshments aspect of The Quest Inn and close much earlier in the evening. Reaching out to these groups will require a lot of work and discussions about their requirements.

The Future

Business expansion is the ultimate plan. Once The Quest Inn is completely established in York then work will begin on the first stage of the expansion in Leeds. With geek culture being so varied the fantasy setting of York’s Quest Inn won’t necessarily represent all geeks so each subsequent bar will feature a different genre. The business style will not change only the setting. The aim is to open the second venue within the next 5 years.

The Leeds bar will feature a Sci-Fi theme. Sliding doors that have typical Sci-Fi opening sounds; posters for Vogon poetry readings coming soon (but never actually happening); and a brown duster coat hanging behind the bar will all be but a few of the less obvious nods to Sci-Fi franchises that have captured the imaginations of so many geeks.

Following the Leeds bar will be a Dracula/horror bar in Whitby that will exploit the lack of themed evening entertainment in a town famed for its link to Bram Stoker’s Dracula. Also, in the conceptual stage are a Wasteland/ Fallout/ Apocalypse bar in Sheffield and a mad scientist Molecular-Mixology bar in Newcastle. Crowdfunding campaigns will be used to help fund and market these expansions with the focus being on raising money to expand the existing customer base. “Collecting the set” will be encouraged, with tankards and merchandise available at each location.

Inspiration for this explosive level of expansion comes from businesses like BrewDog and Loch Fyne who rapidly expanded across the country.

There is also the potential for an online RPG show documenting the adventures of a single adventuring party being filmed and hosted in The Quest Inn. We can't be inspired by the likes of Critical Role without wanting to emulate them a little. 

As the business expands the staffing requirements will increase. This will open up new job roles in the management tiers, such as Area Managers, and promote wider employment. The aim is staff the bars with enthusiastic and talented individuals; passionate about geek culture, RPGs and providing excellent service.

Other Ways You Can Help

We can do with all the help you can give! 

If you can't give us money now, then you can help by sharing our tweets and facebook updates.

You can check out our website at: www.barsandblades.com 

Even if you think you can improve this campaign, then give us a shout.
story_txt:
(Pro-Tip: Jump down to The Loot section to learn what Quest Inn merch you could have.)
About The DM
Everyone has to start somewhere. 
It's crazy to think that in the last year I have gone from having a dream that combines my biggest passions in life (D&D and cocktails) to being the director of a business and having negotiated a business sale; but that's exactly what's happened. 
Hi, my name's Elliot and I have been a bartender and mixologist for three and a half years. I have managed two bars and one shop and I love fantasy roleplaying games. Managing people has always come fairly naturally to me because I like to lead from the front and listen to the concerns of my staff.  I was once asked by one of my bartenders why I had let a waitress tell me off and I responded that "She was right. I should have known better". Managers are people too, they are fallible and make mistakes. I believe that all staff should feel comfortable to give critical feedback to senior staff members as long as it's constructive. As a person who's work life has entirely been in the service industry, I know the way it feels when working the front lines. I personally like it and I get a lot of energy from serving and interacting with customers, but I also know that it's not for everyone; and, also, it isn't unskilled. I want to run a bar where the staff feel like they're being paid what they have earned. I want to pay my staff a living wage that starts with an extra 20p an hour for just being human and rewards the years spent working in the service industry (and further rewards the number of years spent working for my company).  I also believe in giving people a chance: "No experience but you have the right attitude? Great, we can teach you the rest. Just try to make the most of your potential."
I have been an active LARPer for probably 13+ years, it's hard to remember which early teens age I was when I started. During my final year of undergraduate study in Aberdeen I got involved in the roleplaying society and, after learning the ropes as a player and then moving to Sheffield after graduation, I picked up the mantle of Dungeon Master (DM). I started by playing a Pathfinder campaign but have since converted over to D&D 5e as my primary system. I also like Vampire: The Masquerade and the stunningly ridiculous Paranoia. 
I work hard. At the time of writing I'm the manager of a shop in the centre of York, I'm one of the guides on the York Terror Trail and I'm setting my own company up. Yeah, I'm basically working two and a half jobs but it's all in order to get the future that I really want. That future is a chain of geeky and nerdy bars that bring smiles to people's faces. I'm starting with my favourite genre in the fantasy setting of The Quest Inn, York. I then plan on starting The Spaceship Inn, Leeds (name to be confirmed), a science fiction themed bar in the same model as The Quest Inn. Thereafter, it'll be Whitby for a Dracula/Gothic Horror place, Sheffield for a Wasteland/ Apocalyptic Fallout venue, Newcastle for a Mad Scientist laboratory, and Lincoln for a Steampunk/ Victoriana shindig. The £50,000 campaign investment now is just the start of something huge for cocktail and ale lovers in the North of England. After that? Well, who knows. I wouldn't mind seeing franchised venues popping up across Australia, America, and other countries not beginning with A. 
My plan with The Quest Inn is to share myself with the world and to make the world a better place. As a business representation of my hobbies and interests the fantasy cocktail bar will be the first impression on a visiting customer. A top to toe theming will immediately immerse them in a fantasy realm, where they can let their hair down. Anyone stepping off the street will be able to engage and enjoy this aspect of the business and still leave having had a wonderful time and great service. 
For most of the week that is all there is to The Quest Inn; great food and great cocktails equalling a great experience. But during the hours that are normally quieter? Well, then we've got something special. The area normally in use as the dining area will be offered up to roleplay groups to play their games in; with a setting that enhances their story telling.
Behind the scenes I hope to use The Quest Inn and Bars and Blades Limited to improve the world little by little. I will attempt to use the success of Bars and Blades Limited to support other ventures and small businesses with similar ethics. The beauty of our world is our diversity. I intend to celebrate that.

It Begins In A Tavern...
With your help I will be able to start on a project that has the potential to brighten the world a little. With the £50,000 I am seeking I will be able to secure a bank loan to purchase a profitable restaurant in York, Fiesta Latina. I have agreed a sale price of £125,000 for Fiesta Latina. If this campaign can make that lofty target then it will all be down to the support of the people that The Quest Inn comes to life. I will then use my experience from managing in a similar restaurant to run Fiesta Latina for a whole year. I will use this year and Fiesta Latina's established trade to better learn the practicalities of business ownership. After making the most of the Valentines Day trade in 2019, I will use the business' profits to convert the venue into The Quest Inn. I plan to re-open as The Quest Inn during March of 2019.
The business revenue as The Quest Inn will be mostly derived from food and drinks sales as with any standard bar but there will also be the income from merchandise sales, table hire, and miniatures hire. 
£50,000 will be enough to encourage the banks to invest in The Quest Inn and I will be then be able to use Fiesta Latina's cash-flow to support the rest of the business' requirements. Fiesta Latina itself is still a profitable business. Some people have expressed concerns about why it should be on the market but it's simply a case of retirement for the current owner. 
In my years I have managed to gather a lot of experience in managing people but, because I worked in the service industry not far out of London until just over a year ago, I have not been able to gather much capital of my own. Pretty much all that I had went into the business planning stages that prepared for the launch of the campaign and into the marketing of the campaign.
I have a plan but I need your help to bring it to life. If you want to join the party and bring The Quest Inn into existence then as your Dungeon Master I will reward you handsomely with loot. 
Let's get back to details about The Quest Inn:
Making the World Brighter
The Quest Inn's moral ethos will be built around two key principals: happy staff and happy customers.
To achieve these aims, The Quest Inn will aim to become a living wage employer within its first two years of trading and will operate a transparency policy regarding pay and pay-based incentives for long-standing staff members. Our employees will be at the forefront of our care and every effort will be made to make The Quest Inn a good, honest and enjoyable working environment for all our staff members. We believe that by looking after our staff we will simultaneously improve the customer service experience for our customers, thereby helping us to achieve our other key aim of happy customers alongside our dedication to producing an inventive and delicious cocktail menu; beautifully cooked and presented food; a great and welcoming atmosphere; and, a supportive and encouraging community space.
When entering The Quest Inn for the first time the sight of medieval tavern décor and fantasy costumed staff will greet our customers. The Quest Inn will work hard to provide a friendly and inclusive gaming and restaurant experience that will actively lead the way in creating and promoting a supportive gaming community for both residents and visitors in York.
As a gastro-bar the food will be very important but the drinks will be the primary focus of most of the creative energy. The cocktail menu will feature geek and pop culture named cocktails (and mocktails) and will change regularly; affording the customers a different experience with each visit and encouraging return custom. There will also be a range of locally produced ales from across the burgeoning Yorkshire craft brewing industry as well as a hand selected range of ciders and wines. Our food menu will feature exceptional cuisine for starters, mains, deserts, and table plates (large sharing, feast style, dishes); all presented in keeping with the medieval fantasy theme. There will be generous considerations for vegetarians and other diners with dietary requirements.
As part of the community aspect of the company ethos, and to help combat the midweek slump in trade, Monday to Thursday nights will host table-top gaming evenings. These will enable role-play groups to hire the large tables to play table-top role-play games (RPGs) in an inspiring and immersive environment. We plan to work with the university and other gaming societies in York and will encourage them to host their meetings in The Quest Inn for a reduced rate per head. We also plan to set up mutual marketing and cross-promotional benefits with other gaming enterprises in York. By building these professional relationships The Quest Inn aims to create a central hub for the growing community of gamers in York that will connect and support them, whilst also enriching the cultural life of York.
The Sights and Sounds
The Quest Inn is about providing a fun and safe space for gamers, geeks and medieval enthusiasts to socialise and enjoy great cocktails and food at reasonable prices, as well as adding a dynamic must-visit dining experience to York's thriving tourism scene. The two levels of the Fiesta Latina building will enable the venue to facilitate a duel experience, with the entrance level housing the bar and the more casual areas and the second level being the primary dining and gaming area. This will allow separation of gamers and diners from the main bar to segregate the cocktail bar and dining experiences for the comfort of each patron.
Our food will be excellently cooked rustic food befitting of a medieval banquet but with a flavourful twist. Fiesta Latina currently employs some excellent chefs with a background in Brazilian cuisine it is the intention to keep these chefs on to create dynamic food with a Latin flavour contrasted by a medieval appearance, as befits the fantasy freedom of the theming.
The naming conventions for all dishes and drinks will be drawn from fantasy pop culture references like ‘Totally-Not-Rat-On-A-Stick’ (inspired by Terry Pratchett's 'Rat-Onna-Stick'), and 'Meat-Inna-Bun' both derived from the dishes of C.M.O.T. Dibbler in the Discworld series. Other dishes will be inspired by different medieval-inspired fantasy franchises and tropes, like a Lord of the Rings meat feast dish called “Ork Lunch”; and of course "Lembas Bread".
The cocktail menu, however, will be a lot more fluid. New creations will regularly be added to the menu but there will always be a solid baseline of the classics from the cocktail industry available. Furthermore, the bartenders will be encouraged to broaden their skills and research new techniques. One of our other key aims is to support local craft ale brewers by stocking their cask ales. A few bottled beers will also be available. Our hope is that by working with local breweries we will be able to create an authentic medieval tavern experience. To cater to customers who don’t like cocktails and ales there will be a small range of wines and ciders on offer. A soft drinks range will also be available, primarily led by which ones are required as mixers in the cocktails recipes. The Pepsi products currently used by Fiesta Latina will be continued.
The atmosphere of a medieval tavern with period decoration, including fantasy props and treasures, will be enhanced by ambient music befitting a medieval minstrel. The servers will enhance this fantasy atmosphere through fantasy-themed outfits; however, they won’t be asked to affect false accents or ‘put on a show’ as the intended result is for immersion and not farce.
Our hope is to ensnare every sense in order to fully immerse our patrons in to the Quest Inn fantasy realm to the point where they really feel transported into another world. The whole experience will be a form of escapism with customers leaving the Quest Inn blinking at the sudden return to reality.
This sense of immersion will be key for the ‘Tabletop Evenings’. Groups of roleplayers will be able to hire a table for a reasonable fee, with prices becoming more reasonable if bulk session subscriptions are made. There will be scope for RPG tournaments and competitions to be held in the space as well. A library of miniatures and terrain pieces will be available for roleplayers to enhance their gaming experience even more. It also won’t be limited to tabletop roleplayers, as the space will fit well with hosting Live Action Role-Play groups too.
Customers will also be able to take away branded merchandise as a reminder of their trip. Items like tankards and dice bags will be available for purchase over the bar.
Our target audience will include students, young professionals and tourists. We aim to attract attention from these groups by partnering with student unions, societies, other local game shops and Visit York. We also hope that we can build up strong rapport with existing customers of Fiesta Latina so that they will be encouraged to continue their patronage. Furthermore, we trust that our location’s proximity to Clifford’s Tower, Jorvik Viking Centre, and the York Dungeon will also entice new customers both local and tourist alike.
The Loot
The Story of the Adventurer.
Our brave hero climbs the ranks from lowest level one to the most accomplished individual of their time. A story unfolds as you read through the perks of the adventurer's tier.

This table shows what can be found in each tier of the Adventurer's Story. 
For each rung of the perk ladder you will get all that has come before you. So, the more you want the higher you go. 
As with all good RPGs the more risk taken the better the loot. 
The Wall of Fame will be on the ground floor and visible as you enter the bar. Your name on the Wall of Fame can either be your own or one of your RPG character's names. The Portraits will be painted by local York artists and can either be of yourselves or of your favourite character that you have played in tabletop RPGs. 
The Adventurer's Card will be like your own personal character card and will grant you 5% off at any Bars and Blades venue for life. The Hero's Card is the same but with 10% off. 
The Dice bags, Tankards, and Dice sets will all have the Q Logo (seen in the campaign overview) on them.
The Drinks Tokens will grant you one free drink upon presentation of your token to The Quest Inn. Any one drink will be permitted. 
The 10x Tabletop Sessions will be 10 individual bookings of a table in The Quest Inn during Tabletop Evenings. The year's subscription is for an individual and limited in usage only by one calendar year (as many bookings as desired can be made by that individual in that year.
The Handmade Cloak will be just like the one I am wearing in the video. 
 
The Character Perks:
As our hero progresses they meet new and interesting characters. Their stories can be seen in the perks list along with the items associated with them.

Risks & Challenges
This is my first venture and as concepts go it's no small plan. I do have experience in the day to day management of a venue like Fiesta Latina and that is why I have given myself one year in charge of that business. In that one year, spent running Fiesta Latina, I will be able to gain all of the necessary knowledge to be able to make the right decisions for The Quest Inn from a financial and legal standpoint, to add to my existing knowledge on practical management. It will also give me one year to put in place all of the necessary resources to have a quick transformation time. 
The Quest Inn's concept is born out of a huge and still growing, yet still slightly socially marginalised, community of geeks who are always seeking connectivity and social hubs. The digital market already caters to the tabletop RPG community with online shows like Critical Role, Maze Arcana, and Acquisitions Incorporated; each with up to tens of thousands of followers. Whilst this market is being catered for in the digital space it is not being exploited in physical space. This leaves a gap in the market that hasn’t yet been addressed. The Quest Inn aims to exploit this gap in the market by catering specifically to this community but in a manner that should prove attractive to a broad array of audiences. It's in reaching out to those audiences that there is a challenge. Not an insurmountable challenge though.
As this business concept is new to both the bar industry and to the gaming industry there isn’t a benchmark for this model of business. This provides a unique opportunity for marketing and business collaborations and also means that there initially wouldn’t be much in the way of direct competition. Places like Trembling Madness, Stonegate, and the Golden Fleece, Pavement, would be the closest competitors for the atmosphere however they lack the gaming and geek culture aspect of The Quest Inn and also the late-night catering facilities.
There is already a trend in York towards catering to the gaming market with physical spaces but all of the current set ups are only concerned with video games or board games. The retailer Game has recently opened its Belong York gaming area. Pop culture and gaming café’s like Random Encounter on Gillygate, are a trending business model across the country and blend board games with eateries. What is so unique about The Quest Inn is that it will tackle this trend from an entirely new perspective and it will give tabletop RPGs a dedicated space of their own.
Venues like Tavern Brabant, Prague; The Croft Institute, Melbourne; and ABQ, London all encapsulate a specific theme that enraptures and entertains their patrons whilst delivering exceptional service. Like these examples The Quest Inn will deliver an exceptional experience centred around cocktails that enriches the community at the same time. York’s new Viking bar Valhalla, is also be a themed venue but lacks the diversity of services that The Quest Inn will have and it also lacks the commitment to a theme with only the décor representing the idea. Having such a prominent theme can result in customers enjoying the experience and then ticking it off their bucket list. This means that return custom is a challenge but that is why so much time and energy will be put into making the available food and drinks the reason to come back. 
Many roleplay groups have had to find their own spaces in community halls for the purposes of hosting their meetups. Travelling Man does its best to cater to the geek and pop-culture community but as it’s trying to please so many gaming genres it can only provide one night a week to the RPG fans. These venues also lack the catering and refreshments aspect of The Quest Inn and close much earlier in the evening. Reaching out to these groups will require a lot of work and discussions about their requirements.
The Future
Business expansion is the ultimate plan. Once The Quest Inn is completely established in York then work will begin on the first stage of the expansion in Leeds. With geek culture being so varied the fantasy setting of York’s Quest Inn won’t necessarily represent all geeks so each subsequent bar will feature a different genre. The business style will not change only the setting. The aim is to open the second venue within the next 5 years.
The Leeds bar will feature a Sci-Fi theme. Sliding doors that have typical Sci-Fi opening sounds; posters for Vogon poetry readings coming soon (but never actually happening); and a brown duster coat hanging behind the bar will all be but a few of the less obvious nods to Sci-Fi franchises that have captured the imaginations of so many geeks.
Following the Leeds bar will be a Dracula/horror bar in Whitby that will exploit the lack of themed evening entertainment in a town famed for its link to Bram Stoker’s Dracula. Also, in the conceptual stage are a Wasteland/ Fallout/ Apocalypse bar in Sheffield and a mad scientist Molecular-Mixology bar in Newcastle. Crowdfunding campaigns will be used to help fund and market these expansions with the focus being on raising money to expand the existing customer base. “Collecting the set” will be encouraged, with tankards and merchandise available at each location.
Inspiration for this explosive level of expansion comes from businesses like BrewDog and Loch Fyne who rapidly expanded across the country.
There is also the potential for an online RPG show documenting the adventures of a single adventuring party being filmed and hosted in The Quest Inn. We can't be inspired by the likes of Critical Role without wanting to emulate them a little. 
As the business expands the staffing requirements will increase. This will open up new job roles in the management tiers, such as Area Managers, and promote wider employment. The aim is staff the bars with enthusiastic and talented individuals; passionate about geek culture, RPGs and providing excellent service.

Other Ways You Can Help
We can do with all the help you can give! 
If you can't give us money now, then you can help by sharing our tweets and facebook updates.
You can check out our website at: www.barsandblades.com 
Even if you think you can improve this campaign, then give us a shout.

story:
Introducing the Play-X Hybrid DUO

Play-X Studio to make the Play-X Tab 8.0 Hybrid DUO, and now another generation is upon us. Relying on the INTEL latest Powerful Quad Core processor, the same little beauty humming away in Windows 10 & Android Hybrid Tablet PC.


Play-X Hybrid ™ Dual OS Smart Tablet PC

The Play-X Hybrid Dual OS smart Tablet PC merges HD IPS LCD display and combine work and entertainment into one experience,

Turning anywhere into the Business office or Playground for entertainment. Using the latest version of Windows 10, Office 365 and Google Android system, Also with HDMI out Support 4K UHD resolution to big HDTV, built-in Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Play-X Hybrid is the ultimate work and entertainment upgrade for any high-definition television.











Play-X Hybrid Options "Wirelessly to BIG TV"




Why we need your support

Your support is critical to our long term success. We need your help to scale this Product and bring it to market direct and quickly at a lower consumer price point for early bird .

We will be taking the funds from Indiegogo to move directly into improving product design and purchasing necessary materials and the manufacturing of these products you booked.

The Impact

High quality products and good user experience:

Plax-X Hybrid's state-of-the-art technology takes top billing, packing the phenomenal power of a Windows 10 PC & Google Android into a single Tablet. Driven by an ultra-fast Intel Quad Core processor, advanced latest chipset and built-in Wi-Fi & Bluetooth, it has the muscle to deliver in 1080p Full HD and 4K UHD the graphical horsepower to support 3D picture that leaps off the HDTV screen.

Plax-X Hybrid in production at the world class production factory has SMT equipment and a large-scale electronic product assembly line and and top quality-control experience in manufacturing electronic products.

We have the software and hardware design engineers and INTEL & Microsoft support. We believe our products will be well-made, easy to use and provide you with a real benefit. The first experience of Windows 10 and Android of the world.


Development stage

We have currently completed:

UI design

PCB design and preliminary product testing

Product tooling

Packaging design

Improving the user experience

Product certifications including CE and FCC certifications pending


Risks & Challenges

While any new endeavor involves risk, The Play-X team have already completed all preparation for mass production. All order will be delivery on End of October, 2015.
In the team’s experience, there are several points in the design, manufacturing and certification processes that could cause delays. We will keep you informed and ensure you know right away if we have run into challenges. 
Certification, software and hardware design all have the biggest potential to affect timing. There is always the possibility of supplier delays. Whatever happens along our production timeline, you can rest assured that we will keep you updated on our progress. 

How you can help?

We know that contributing to the campaign isn't always a possibility for everyone. But if you like Play-X Hybrid and the thing we are doing, please contribute in other ways! We are really thankful of all actions you can make. We made helping really simple for you. please share this page to your friends! 

We're Techman, we need you help!

We're looking for PR partner for world wide marketing, Welcome to join us !

story:
Short Summary

Green Wave Energy (GWE) was established in 2013 to promote a platform for sustainable product development. GWE is supported by a group of members who have a common vision of forward thinking in the fields of waste reduction, water reclamation, sustainable feed supplements, and high protein alternatives. Utilizing our Algae Growth Platforms, GWE is in the process of growing Spirulina algae for food supplements to the Aquaculture Industry.

What We Need & What You Get

Contributions will go towards our pilot facility: finishing the construction of GWE's Algae Growth Platform, and finally growing algae.

Eventually we will be making algae grown in Montana available to the market.

The Impact

Green Wave Energy (GWE) plans to grow algae to meet the ever increasing demand. Spirulina will be our pilot strain. It has often been termed a super-food as it is becoming a widely used food supplement. It is rich in protein, vitamins, minerals, carotenoids, and antioxidants[1]. Using GWE's Algae Growth Platform it is possible to grow Spirulina in a controlled environment that will be free from contaminates. This allows us to reliably produce a quality product.

All of this will be done right here in Bozeman, MT. The area's natural resources, clean crisp air, and pristine water is one example among many that makes Montana the Treasure State. This in mind our company aims at creating natural products that in the end will help protect and maintain the environment in which we live. By utilizing our Algae Growth Platform in areas where there are high levels of nitrates and phosphates we are able to grow algae biomass and reduce the impact on streams and aquifers. 

Waste reduction, water reclamation, sustainable feed supplements, and high protein alternatives are our goals for growing a sustainable future.

Green: Sustainable, Renewable, Clean

Wave: Movement

Energy: Food, Energy for People

Risks & Challenges

Although the demand for spirulina and other algae is increasing, it is not widely used as a food supplement for people. However it is seeing some use as feed in aquaculture to try and replace fish meal. There is some research being done on the viability of spirulina as a feed for livestock. Spirulina is getting some use in making natural food dyes.

Further research into the applications of spirulina and other algae needs to be explored. Our team is dedicated to finding more applications with algae through continued research and development.

We will be promoting awareness and the benefits of spirulina and other algae.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about us. We are on Facebook.

Footnotes

  1. University of Maryland Medical Center https://umm.edu/health/medical/altmed/supplement/spirulina
