Using GWE's Algae Growth Platform it is possible to grow Spirulina in a controlled environment that will be free from contaminates. This allows us to reliably produce a quality product.
All of this will be done right here in Bozeman, MT. The area's natural resources, clean crisp air, and pristine water is one example among many that makes Montana the Treasure State. This in mind our company aims at creating natural products that in the end will help protect and maintain the environment in which we live. By utilizing our Algae Growth Platform in areas where there are high levels of nitrates and phosphates we are able to grow algae biomass and reduce the impact on streams and aquifers. 
Waste reduction, water reclamation, sustainable feed supplements, and high protein alternatives are our goals for growing a sustainable future.
Green: Sustainable, Renewable, Clean
Wave: Movement
Energy: Food, Energy for People

    Risks & Challenges Although the demand for spirulina and other algae is increasing, it is not widely used as a food supplement for people. However it is seeing some use as feed in aquaculture to try and replace fish meal. There is some research being done on the viability of spirulina as a feed for livestock. Spirulina is getting some use in making natural food dyes.
Further research into the applications of spirulina and other algae needs to be explored. Our team is dedicated to finding more applications with algae through continued research and development.
We will be promoting awareness and the benefits of spirulina and other algae.   Other Ways You Can Help Tell your friends about us. We are on Facebook.

Footnotes

 University of Maryland Medical Center https://umm.edu/health/medical/altmed/supplement/spirulina

story:
The Carpe Diem Eco Project is a humanitarian eco-tourism project. The goal is to empower the local people of Nicaragua by utilizing its tremendous tourism potential, while minimizing environmental impact.

In order to accomplish this, I wish to build a sustainable ecolodge, with the help of others, interested in supporting this cause. The ecolodge will immediately reinvest the profits that it generates to create or fund local and vetted humanitarian and conservation initiatives. It will serve as an educational centre, create employment opportunities and economic benefits for local people. It will also provide free accommodations for legitimate humanitarian organizations and at the same time, it will provide nice and affordable lodging for travellers.



For the construction of the lodge, I am using the Cob building technique. After extensive research, I fell in love with Cob building because of its sturdiness, minimal environmental impact, and low cost. Cob is a mixture made from clay, sand, straw and water. It is the key material for the construction of the ecolodge. Cob is natural, fireproof, termite-proof, resistant to seismic activities, inexpensive, easy to build and so much more! 

                                     


The location of the lodge is on a peninsula called Isla Los Brasiles, 30 minutes away from the beautiful colonial city of Leon on the Pacific coast of Nicaragua. For the past three years, I have been researching, working, and saving for this project. In order to avoid loans and investors (that could potentially compromise the integrity of the mission for financial gain), I worked for years, while keeping my living costs very lean, so that I could save enough money to purchase the land myself. I have full confidence in the ecolodge, and in May 2014, I completed the purchase of 10,500 square meters of beachfront property. This is now the site of the ecolodge, and already has 50 trees planted by myself and an employee hired to maintain the land. With wild nature, untouched beaches, no cars, amazing sunsets, and millions of stars, it is paradise!!! After the lodge is built, I will manage the lodge using my thorough knowledge of the area, and my extensive experience in hospitality.

                                         


2015 was the first year of construction and so far we are really proud of what we accomplished.

We dug a well...


We built a tool shed...


we built a Palapa...


We started the construction of 2 beach houses...

 And so much more!


But now we need your help to continue.


Any kind of help is more than welcome, but there are 4 ways that you can make a big difference.

1. Help finance the building of the Carpe Diem Ecolodge.

Help jumpstart the project by making a donation to the construction of the ecolodge. For your donation, you will receive a gift certificate valued at your donation dollar amount to spend at the lodge.

2. Help with the construction efforts of the Carpe Diem Ecolodge.

You don't need special skills to build with cob – nearly everyone can do it, and there will be experienced builders around you. It is not difficult, but it is time-consuming. Come and join us this winter. We will be there from January until June 2016. Escape the cold and join us where it is warm year-round! The campground will be provided for free, just bring your tent. Help with construction a few hours a day and spend the rest of your day enjoying the sun, the beach, the beautiful Nicaragua. We are going to have a great time!

3. Choose the Carpe Diem Ecolodge for your next holiday. 

The profits will be reinvested in the local communities, so just by having a great time staying at the Carpe Diem Ecolodge, you are making a difference!

4. Share the promotion video and spread the word with your friends.

The more people know about the project, the greater impact we can make!

Please visit the Carpediemecoproject.com web page for more information and to watch the complete video.

Thank You!

story:
We offer a complete online internet safety and video walk-through training for you to help prevent hacking and loss of confidential information. You are the first line of defense to help protect your confidential data, but they need to proper support and training to do so. That is where we come in to help. We show you step-by-step how to be more secure when online, on all your different devices and online accounts.

Purpose of this project:

  • Help people stay safe online, including a section for kids to learn important online safety precautions.
  • Lowering your risk of getting hacked and losing your personal data. 
  • Provide a simple way to learn, with short videos that help people of all skill levels learn at their own pace. 

Videos are around 3-5 minutes each, your own pace and your schedule

  • Lowering your risk of being hacked and having your online data stolen.
  • Have video walk-throughs of how to secure all your online accounts. 
  • 2-factor authentication, including backup passwords and recovery keys.
  • Data protection and offline backup.
  • "Strong and long" passwords, including unique passwords for each account.
  • How-to easily/securely store and access all your passwords, so you don't have to remember them.
  • Phishing/Spoofing (SPAM) training and test practices. This is a major way of having your information stolen, and we show you what to lookout for.
  • Importance of VPN (Virtual Private Network) while on an open Wi-Fi network.
  • Understanding firewall, anti-malware, and anti-virus software, understanding that it is not a one-stop solution, but part of an overall plan to help secure your data.
  • Encrypted home Wi-Fi network, and optional Guest Network.
  • Encrypt your data on each device and online.
  • Make sure hardware is secured to its location or can be remotely wiped.
  • Consider your insurance policy covers cyber-related risks, because devices connected to the internet can’t be guaranteed 100% safe (damage to intangible assets).
  • More being added! Send us a message, if you would like us to considering including something in particular. We are here to help people learn about online safety!

The reasons SpeakToomey.com is the best company to offer this online training course:

Jeffrey Toomey, is a former Apple, Inc. employee and is the founder and owner who is running SpeakToomey.com for the past three years, helping small companies better protect themselves online. From all of the technology skills learned at Apple, to making an online training course about the iPhone, and by running his own business where he helps clients with this exact internet safety, makes him the best person to offer a training course on this topic.

Everyone deserves to be better protected while online, and his Indiegogo project offers access to a course at a great early adaptor discount.

Value of a perk:

By backing this project now, you are pre-ordering lifetime access to this online training course, “Protecting yourself online” for only $25. It will retail for $199. Over an 85% discount for backing this project early! Thanks for all the support and sharing of this project!

story:
The Project:

It’s one of the most recognizable buildings in the Baltimore skyline and houses the largest, four-faced pendulum driven clock in the world (larger than London’s Big Ben!), But the Bromo Seltzer Tower is showing her age. The Baltimore Office of Promotion & The Arts (BOPA) is raising funds to restore the Tower so we can give our city the beautiful icon it deserves.

Tell Me More About the Bromo Seltzer Tower!

The Bromo Tower’s backstory is quintessential Baltimore and crucial in understanding the need for its restoration. Captain Isaac E. Emerson, a Baltimore pharmacist, built the Tower in 1911.  Emerson invented Bromo Seltzer, a cure for headaches and hangovers (because if anything, Baltimore is a great drinking town) and in 1891, he organized his own company, the Emerson Drug Company to manufacture the tonic.          

      

With a typical Baltimore chip-on-his shoulder, Emerson felt that anything Europe can do, Baltimore can do better.  Thus the main feature of his headquarters, the Tower, was inspired by the Palazzo Vecchio in Florence, Italy.  Emerson commissioned Joseph E. Sperry to replicate the 13th century stone structure at 21 South Eutaw Street.  Fifteen stories in height, it was the tallest building in Baltimore until the 1930s.  But the most important facet of the tower is certainly the clock, its face measuring 24 feet in diameter- larger than Big Ben in London.

Until 1936, the Tower was distinguished by a 51 ft tall replica of the blue Bromo Seltzer bottle that topped the Tower (after all, in this town you need some more fun than JUST an ornate renaissance-replica tower that’s the tallest building in the city).  Alas, the bottle was far too heavy for the tower to support, and in 1936, the bottle began to crack and the structure was removed.  Unfortunately many of the problems facing the building today are attributable to this engineering flaw.

The Emerson Bromo Seltzer Clock Tower was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1973.  When Emerson donated the Tower to the City of Baltimore, he did so on the condition that the Tower would be preserved.

“He interests himself thoroughly in everything tending to advance our city, and is a patron of all worthy enterprises seeking to push Baltimore to the front” wrote a contemporary of Captain Isaac Emerson. Your donation will keep that spirit alive!

 

Why We Need Your Help:

Repairs are necessary not only for historic preservation but to ensure safety and structural soundness of the building. Cracks and deterioration in the façade of the building due to the weight of the 51-foot spinning Bromo bottle that originally topped the tower have caused leaks and water damage, leading to damage to the inner workings of the clock.

                                                                  


You may notice the scaffolding that’s gone up to remove the clock hands and eventually the clock. But don’t worry, with your help, it will be back soon and restored to its original gravity-driven mechanism.
The Baltimore Office of Promotion & the Arts (more easily referred to as BOPA) is the non-profit organization serving as Baltimore City’s designated arts council and manages the Bromo Seltzer Tower. In 2007, BOPA completed the first round of renovations to the tower, converting it from a vacant, uninhabitable space into artists’ studios with the support of philanthropists Eddie and Sylvia Brown. This conversion helped ignite major economic growth in the area that is now known as the Bromo Arts & Entertainment District

What We Need & What You Get:

All funds raised will go towards the cost of the restoration which is an estimated $1.8 million. To date, $966,500 has been raised with support from the City of Baltimore, Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, Baltimore Development Corporation, Maryland Heritage Area Authority, Baltimore National Heritage Area, Middendorf Foundation and Preservation Maryland.

We want individuals at every level to contribute to a building that’s a unique part of the city and close to the hearts of so many Baltimoreans. Plus, there are some fun Bromo-themed perks that come along with with your support! Even if we don’t reach our goal, 100% of donations will still go to the Tower’s restoration.            

  ....seriously, Baltimoreans love this tower.....

Other Ways You Can Help:

Help us get the word out! 

Share the campaign with your friends and social networks. Post your favorite photo of the Baltimore skyline featuring the Tower, or send them to us!

Got a Bromo story? Send it to us. We know there are people out there who have gotten engaged in the clock tower!

We know that there are numerous other causes in Baltimore vying for your dollars. But the Bromo Tower is representative of the Baltimore spirit and we hope you’ll join us in preserving this icon for generations to come.

And before you ask, the answer is no. Funds raised for this campaign will not help demolish the Hilton and restore the view of the Tower from Camden Yards. But we sympathize with the sentiment.

story:
I would like to take this opportunity to introduce myself. I am the Treasurer of the Dania Beach Kiwanis Club, a charity organization that improves the lives of our community's underserved and underprivileged. Just last month, we organized a school supply drive for impoverished elementary school children. Our other recent service projects include annual toy drives (Christmas in July, Toys for Tots), empowerment of disadvantaged youth (Horses and Handicapped, Camp Boggy Creek) and scholarships for local graduates with inspiring leadership.


We are successful community builders because of benevolent sponsors who, like you, share our vision of selfless service. As such, I ask that you support our upcoming Annual Halloween Bash on October 30, 2015. 


We have three tiers of corporate sponsorship comprised of bronze, silver and gold level opportinities for marketing. What's more? This event will be covered in detail by our local newspaper: "Dania Beach Press." 


With a month to go, we welcome any and all halloween or autumn-themed donations to be used as party supplies, decor, raffle prizes and silent auctions. We are also accepting monetary donations in the form of business gift certificates or checks made out to the Dania Beach Kiwanis Club. In exchange for your contributions, we would be thrilled to advertise your trusted brand to the diverse demographic of our 200+ guests. We appreciate your generosity and thank you for your time.

story:
1912 Club?

1912 Club exists as a family-owned, family-operated bar in the humble Panther City. Angelika Rodriguez and her son Luis have owned the bar for over 10 years and are ecstatic lovers and fans of local music. 1912 as a space is a historic staple in Fort Worth music history, dating back to the late 1960s. The club, as of late, has been embracing every style of live music it can find and is, without a doubt, a creatively free space where any passionate individual can organize events and communicate their ideas through music. 

With your contributions we will be building a better platform for artists and those who support them. This PA system will give 1912 Club the power to unify our city through collective curation and appreciation of the art and music we all care so deeply about.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking at getting the following gear:

  • The mixer: MG16XU w/ Mid-range Sweep $479
  • Front of House Speakers: Two QSCKW153 2878.40 for a pair
  • Proccessor: DBX Drive 260 Rack $600
  • Stage Monitors: 3 Behringer VS1220F $449 for 3
  • The Sub-woofer: 1 Mackie SRM1850 w/ built in crossover $800
  • Microphones: 4 Sure Sm58 $400


Proceeds from Attack of the Funk and this indiegogo campaign will go towards this equipment.

story:
God is...

God is a Presence, a Power that people call by different names like; Father, Lord, Holy Spirit, Allah, Buddha, Spirit, Energy, the Infinite, the Force, the Light, the One. I choose to call this presence God. Even if we have different spiritual beliefs, I know God is everywhere and in everything. Just as multiple languages are spoken around the world, God speaks to individuals differently. I believe people see God everyday; although some may not recognize they are seeing God (yes, even the folks who say they are agnostic or atheist), God is the divine thread that connects everyone and everything and weaves the miraculous fabric we call Life.  

I am...

I'm Anne Strayer. I am a wife, a mommy, a daughter, a sister, an aunt, a teacher, a student, a friend, a creator, a healer, a life insurance professional, and at the core of all that I am, I am a spiritual being. I am a spiritual being and you are a spiritual being. We are all spiritual beings. God is within each of us. We are neither separate nor apart from God. We are one with the One.  

Change your thinking, change your life...

I love recognizing the divine. I love to pray. It feels good. Prayer brings peace and raises vibrations. Prayer is individual and collective. Prayer is powerful. The world is a better place when people pray. Affirmative Prayer focuses on positive outcomes, shifts life experiences, and releases negative thought patterns. Affirmative Prayer creatively impacts the world in a positive way. 
Affirmative Prayer in a Box is:
  • the place to start when you don't know where to start
  • useful when you feel stuck in a rut
  • a starting place for when you're at a loss for words
  • an easy way to begin a prayer practice
  • a useful teaching tool for Science of Mind practitioners 
  • intuitive, flexible, transforming and beneficial for co-creation  
Affirmative Prayer in a Box:
  • helps people learn to pray in a positive manner
  • teaches the basics of the spiritual mind treatment       
  • aids in creative visualization, meditation, and visioning
  • gently guides people to their highest good
  • offers a life of balance and harmony 
  • takes you to the next level of your spiritual evolution 
  • provides enlightenment for personal self-mastery  
  • expands your consciousness
I am so grateful, I am so blessed...

I am so thankful this campaign is going to raise $6,000 to print the first edition of Affirmative Prayer In A Box.  This is the result of many Divine blessings, for which I am extremely grateful. 

With a grateful and joyous heart, I graciously give thanks for learning to tithe time, talent, and treasure. With a loving heart, I give many thanks to the Centers for Spiritual Living! I am incredibly grateful for the Science of Mind Foundations class! I am blessed and inspired by my classmates! I give thanks for each assignment. I am thankful Affirmative Prayer helped me create, complete, and present my final project, Affirmative Prayer In A Box! 

I'm so grateful for the Spiritual Mind Treatments, meditations, visioning sessions, and many, many prayers that manifested as a divine download for my final project! I am so grateful for receiving 70 cards that cover each step of the Affirmative Prayer practice. 

I give thanks to my classmates, my teacher, my mentors, and Reverend Molly for their enthusiastic support! I give thanks to everyone that played with the cards and provided constructive feedback! I am incredibly thankful for the numerous people that have asked to purchase Affirmative Prayer In A Box! What a blessing! 

I'm grateful the demand for these cards made me think bigger because my personal printer is way too small and way too slow to print cards from home! I am thankful that I now know the cost of ink cartridges for a home-office printer is absurd and that 3X5" index cards are not ideal for shuffling! I'm thankful that my husband would prefer me spending my time creating more joy instead of printing 70 individual cards by hand! I'm ESPECIALLY thankful my daughter showed me that our ink runs if the cards get wet! I'm glad she figured that out so I could find a better solution. 

 

I'm so thankful high-quality cards can be produced professionally for a fraction of my home-printing costs! I'm grateful that I can pass the savings on to others, so more people can play! I'm so grateful that indiegogo.com provides a platform to help finance the initial run of a beautiful, high-quality, 70+ card deck!!

I'm thankful for having the courage to release my fear, dream bigger, and live my purpose. And, I am so grateful for each and every person that supports me in this campaign with the following actions:

  • making an in-kind donation
  • placing an order
  • sharing this campaign with friends and family
  • sharing Affirmative Prayer in a Box with other centers 
  • getting the word out on social media
  • making some noise and shaking things up 
  • using the Indiegogo share tools
  • using affirmative prayer to make the world a better place
  • or something even better for greatest good of all.

I release and I let go...

With an incredibly grateful heart full of unconditional love, I lovingly release my words and this campaign to God knowing that all of the details are already taken care of. I open and I allow these efforts to benefit the world. 

And so it is!
story_txt:
God is... God is a Presence, a Power that people call by different names like; Father, Lord, Holy Spirit, Allah, Buddha, Spirit, Energy, the Infinite, the Force, the Light, the One. I choose to call this presence God. Even if we have different spiritual beliefs, I know God is everywhere and in everything. Just as multiple languages are spoken around the world, God speaks to individuals differently. I believe people see God everyday; although some may not recognize they are seeing God (yes, even the folks who say they are agnostic or atheist), God is the divine thread that connects everyone and everything and weaves the miraculous fabric we call Life.  

I am...
I'm Anne Strayer. I am a wife, a mommy, a daughter, a sister, an aunt, a teacher, a student, a friend, a creator, a healer, a life insurance professional, and at the core of all that I am, I am a spiritual being. I am a spiritual being and you are a spiritual being. We are all spiritual beings. God is within each of us. We are neither separate nor apart from God. We are one with the One.  



Change your thinking, change your life...

I love recognizing the divine. I love to pray. It feels good. Prayer brings peace and raises vibrations. Prayer is individual and collective. Prayer is powerful. The world is a better place when people pray. Affirmative Prayer focuses on positive outcomes, shifts life experiences, and releases negative thought patterns. Affirmative Prayer creatively impacts the world in a positive way. 

Affirmative
     Prayer in a Box is:
the place to start when you don't know where to start
useful when you feel stuck in a rut
a starting place for when you're at a loss for words
an easy way to begin a prayer practice
a useful teaching tool for Science of Mind practitioners 
intuitive, flexible, transforming and beneficial for co-creation  

Affirmative
     Prayer in a Box:



helps people learn to pray in a positive manner

teaches the basics of the spiritual mind treatment       
aids in creative visualization, meditation, and
     visioning 
gently guides people to their highest good
offers a life of balance and harmony 
takes you to the next level of your spiritual
     evolution 
provides enlightenment for personal self-mastery
      

expands your consciousness

story:
Who's Rob Hsu?

Hey, that's me! I've been obsessed with food & restaurants nearly my entire life (28 years so far). It was a trip early on to Paris that really sparked my love for the culinary world. My pursuits have taken me everywhere from staging at Le Cirque in NYC during high school to putting my own spin on crepes at Cafe Demitasse in LA.

After college, I trained with a Michelin-level Tea Mastress in Taipei/Hangzhou and later went on to stage at The Spice Table in LA while in cooking school. From there, I took my knowledge of Southeast Asian flavors to Chipotle's Shophouse concept in DC. It was there that I really got to immerse myself in "Wok Cooking" and develop a passion for the craft as I managed operations for their Georgetown (DC) restaurant.

Most recently, I headed up marketing for Aurify Brands' restaurants. I love to cook. But the goal is to become a great restaurateur one day.

Imagine What's Out There

Most people have had fried rice, soup dumplings & dim sum before, but imagine all of the great Chinese food that's still out there. It's like coming to the US and being introduced to pizza, hot dogs and tacos, which are delicious, but really just scratch the surface of American food. Think about all the great regional styles of American BBQ, amazing Cajun food from the South or seasonal American cuisine from across the country. With your support, I'll uncover the great Chinese cuisine we could only imagine and:

  • Share the best dishes I discover with you.
  • Let you in on the secret of where to dine across China and its major cities.
  • Who knows, maybe even open a restaurant featuring the food I discover.

My Journey & What You'll See Along the Way

  • My journey involves backpacking across 17 different regions in China for one year, where I'll visit restaurants & eateries (from hole in the wall to fine dining), meet chefs and venture into local people's homes to uncover and document great food in each region that I visit.
  • I'm looking to raise $24,000 for this one year project to not only cover basic living costs, but also the cost of transportation and research across the 17 regions. Below are the 17 regions that I plan to cover, spending roughly 2-3 weeks in each:  
  • A Day in the Life: While this should be a fun trip, this will by no means be a vacation (vacation for me is kicking it somewhere and just living with minimal planning). This trip involves a considerable amount of pre-planning, reaching out to local restaurants/chefs and recruiting homecooks/scouting locations ahead of time. From the trip's start in Shanghai, each day will involve documenting a different dish, such as the soup dumpling and determining what constitutes a "xiao long bao" versus a "tang bao", whether that's distinguished by the thickness of the skin, proportion of liquid or traditionally held principles.

Perks

Who doesn't like perks? I'll bring back my favorite finds & create experiences from my imagination:

  • Cocktail Menu from a Previous Speakeasy Event:
  • Concept & Cocktails by Yours Truly, Design by the talented Tatum Lau.


Help a Brotha Out

Have no money like me, but want to help in another way?

  • Hit me up at robhsu@gmail.com
  • Know somebody who'd love to host or show me around in these following regions of China?

1. Zhejiang, 2. Anhui, 3. Jiangxi, 4. Fujian, 5. Guangdong, 6. Hunan, 7. Guangxi, 8. Yunnan, 9. Sichuan, 10. Shaanxi, 11. Shanxi, 12. Inner Mongolia, 13. Hebei, 14. Shandong, 15. Liaoning, 16. Jilin, 17. Heilongjiang

Appreciate the support & am excited to hear from you!

*Special thanks to modern day Renaissance man James Zhou (Photographer, Architect, Creative Director) for helping a friend out on this campaign.

Thanks,

Rob

story:
More than one third of babies born in San Francisco every year, are born to families living in Southeastern neighborhoods: Visitation Valley, the Excelsior/Mission Terrace, the Bayview, Portola and Ingleside.

                                                   

In these neighborhoods…

  • 17% percent of mothers receive no prenatal care in their first trimester of pregnancy.

  • Mothers and their families have very limited access to holistic prenatal, birth, and postpartum education and support.


Imagine a welcoming community space where families and children of all backgrounds can gather and receive high-quality holistic support services to grow and thrive physically, emotionally, spiritually and financially.

                            

Community Well was born in response to the pressing need to provide accessible and culturally appropriate holistic health and other wellness services to families and communities in the Southeast neighborhoods of San Francisco.

Community Well practitioners include doulas, midwives, lactation consultants, acupuncturists, body workers, therapists, financial and life coaches, and educators - all under one roof.

Located at 78 Ocean Avenue, in the Excelsior Neighborhood, Community Well will be the first center of its kind in the Bay Area offering:
         

                  

All services will be offered on a sliding scale, to ensure that all families have access to high-quality services, information, resources and holistic support. 

In addition, an affiliated non-profit, Community Well Fund, will provide scholarships for lower-income local families to access a variety of services at Community Well.

                 

Your donation will help us cover start-up costs, including:

  • Facilities build-out – updating and customizing existing space
  • Furniture – private rooms, classrooms, communal spaces
  • Equipment – massage, yoga, lending library, etc.
  • Supplies – office, kitchen, janitorial
  • Professional fees – legal, accounting, etc.
  • Marketing and collateral – printed and web

                     

If you would like more information about Community Well, please contact us.

story:
The Reality Of Life Online

We all hear about it – our accounts and personal information stolen, governments and Big Business and an army of bad guys listening to our phone calls, stealing our texts and invading our social networks. Are you paying attention Hillary? It seems that more and more of our online lives are invaded every day.  These thefts cost us huge amounts of money with no end in sight.

Aren't you tired of being hacked?!?

That right – all of those fancy anti-virus this and anti-malware that security does nothing to protect your information as you send your family, friends and co-workers anything electronic (which includes almost all phone calls BTW).  Things such as HTTPS and VPNs have been compromised and sadly have never worked in the way you hoped or were promised. In essence, living online is akin to playing Russian roulette with your peeps.

Until now there has been nothing to protect you.

We felt the same way - we were frustrated with losing our information, feeling completely helpless online and we wanted to regain our rights online.  It wasn't easy and it has taken all of our savings and years and years of incredibly hard work, mores challenges than we thought possible, and endless hours of coding.  But we never stopped trying as protecting people online is our passion and keeping unwanted parties out of our lives is what drives us.  Now we have broken through and we have an incredible new solution but we need your help to succeed.

Introducing SIPN

We call our new protection SIPN – Secure Invisible Private Network – which secures your life as you communicate with your people online.  With SIPN you can hangout on Google, Skype grandma and go to meetings online – all safely and securely.  SIPN overcomes weaknesses of other efforts and really has the potential to change the world.

Unlike other options, SIPN works below your operating system using a unique new approach to encryption and leveraging a breakthrough out-of-band system that overcomes the single biggest weakness in online security today.  Since SIPN sits at the bottom of your device, it can handle all of your applications while remaining transparent to your device, applications and you.  We call this adaptable, innovative security your "Closed Loop".

We have been working on this groundbreaking technology for over 5 years and we are now ready to offer you this innovative new protection.  We need funding now in order to pay for the servers and people needed to get our product into your hands.  While we have a working version, we need funds to actually launch our protection to the world.  Please invest in SIPN today and help us support our mission to provide true online protection!

Let's Start SIPN

We are not asking for handouts: everybody who subscribes will get our first edition for free for 2 years and you will automatically obtain ALL upgrades and expansions during that time.  This first edition lets you determine what applications you want to protect and then gets out of the way. Today we run across all versions of Windows desktop/tablets, protecting all major social communications apps (Skype, Hangouts, etc…).  In the very near future we will extend this protection to other platforms such as Android and iOS.

Join our team and help us fight back.

Moving forward, we want you to be involved in guiding our path forward.  Do we expand onto Android next or do we increase our protection to email, VOIP, etc…?  Are there companies with which you want to see partnerships?  If you invest now, you will have an important voice helping us determine the future of SIPN!

story:
Hey everybody.

It's come to my attention that I haven't been updating people on this site as to what's going on with Imbibe and it's plan to relocate.
While I have been relaying information to many people in person, I realize that I should have been regularly updating this site as well, so for that, I apologize.
Shutting down Imbibe took a much greater toll on me emotionally than I would have anticipated, and it's taken me quite some time to get back on my feet and feel like I'm ready to take on the world again. But I can tell you with confidence, that I am now once again ready to take challenges on.
I have been looking for a new location since Imbibe shutdown, and was close to signing leases at a couple locations, but since then, I've not been able to find a location that suits our needs. 
I am actively looking for locations, and hope that I will find one soon.
No one misses Imbibe more than I, and I hope that we can find a location sooner rather than later.
I promise to update everyone far more frequently as to what's going on, and let you know that Imbibe will make it's return at some point.
If you have any specific questions please email me directly at bill@imbibeevents.ca

Thanks guys,

Bill

story:
Butterflies, Bugs and Education

We purchased the former "JU-4 Elementary School" in Cummings, KS five years ago with the plan to turn it into a butterfly exhibit and education center. We are located on five acres in the Kansas countryside, yet there are over 1.6 million people within a 50 mile radius and over 2.8 million within a 100 mile radius.  For the last five years we have been doing our research and creating the "World's Most Unique Jewelry" using the wings of expired butterflies.

Butterfly Wing Bling, LLC is our company that produces the premier line of real butterfly wing jewelry and acrylic butterfly display boxes in the country.  We are now ready to take the next step to turn the former school back into a new type of education center.  

The former gymnasium will become a 900 sq. ft. butterfly exhibit with upper level viewing and an insect zoo area.  Imagine the wonder of children and adults as they enter the butterfly exhibit and are surrounded by 100s of butterflies from all around the world.  Those that enter will have the opportunity to feed and interact with some of natures most unique creatures. 

There will be other displays of interesting insects, reptiles, amphibians and aquatic life.

One of the former classrooms will return to its original purpose:  to be a place for education. This classroom will give us the facilities to hold seminars, workshops, day camps and other programs for school groups, scout groups, 4-H groups, tour bus groups as well as public education programs.  We will have many different species available for hands-on up close learning ranging from exotic insects, lizards, frogs, birds and more.  

 

The facilities will be operated by a team of three to start with. The three are:

         David Foster has many years as a pet industry professional, a photographer and business manager.

        Christina Campbell has a Masters in Early Childhood Education with many years of education experience.

       Byron Foster is a retired High School / College science teacher.  He also has many years of experience in the pet industry.

    

Funding Uses:

The primary use of the funds is to complete the construction of the butterfly exhibit and education areas. The areas will require new HVAC systems. There is also additional construction needed  to meet the stringent USDA facilities requirements. There will be other display areas  as we will be developing several large outdoors pollinator gardens for butterflies, bees and other important insects. We have 5 acres of land in the Kansas countryside to work with. We will also be building at least one greenhouse for the production of butterfly host plants and nectar plants for our own operation as well as for sale to the public. We also plan to have aquaponic and hydroponic gardening demonstration units operating for producing organic butterfly plants as well as edible vegetables for humans.

Thank You Gifts:

All of the jewelry items and acrylic display boxes given to contributors are handmade by Butterfly Wing Bling, LLC. These are unique items that are great items for you to enjoy or give as gifts yourself.

"Mother Nature lets the beauty last a few weeks...we let it last Forever"

We are located on five acres in the Kansas countryside, yet there are over 1.6 million people within a 50 mile radius and over 2.8 million within a 100 mile radius.  For the last five years we have been doing our research and creating the "World's Most Unique Jewelry" using the wings of expired butterflies. 
Butterfly Wing Bling, LLC is our company that produces the premier line of real butterfly wing jewelry and acrylic butterfly display boxes in the country.  We are now ready to take the next step to turn the former school back into a new type of education center.  
The former gymnasium will become a 900 sq. ft. butterfly exhibit with upper level viewing and an insect zoo area.  Imagine the wonder of children and adults as they enter the butterfly exhibit and are surrounded by 100s of butterflies from all around the world.  Those that enter will have the opportunity to feed and interact with some of natures most unique creatures. 
There will be other displays of interesting insects, reptiles, amphibians and aquatic life.

One of the former classrooms will return to its original purpose:  to be a place for education. This classroom will give us the facilities to hold seminars, workshops, day camps and other programs for school groups, scout groups, 4-H groups, tour bus groups as well as public education programs.  We will have many different species available for hands-on up close learning ranging from exotic insects, lizards, frogs, birds and more.  
  
The facilities will be operated by a team of three to start with. The three are:
         David Foster has many years as a pet industry professional, a photographer and business manager.
        Christina Campbell has a Masters in Early Childhood Education with many years of education experience.
       Byron Foster is a retired High School / College science teacher.  He also has many years of experience in the pet industry.
        Funding Uses:

The primary use of the funds is to complete the construction of the butterfly exhibit and education areas. The areas will require new HVAC systems. There is also additional construction needed  to meet the stringent USDA facilities requirements. There will be other display areas  as we will be developing several large outdoors pollinator gardens for butterflies, bees and other important insects. We have 5 acres of land in the Kansas countryside to work with. We will also be building at least one greenhouse for the production of butterfly host plants and nectar plants for our own operation as well as for sale to the public. We also plan to have aquaponic and hydroponic gardening demonstration units operating for producing organic butterfly plants as well as edible vegetables for humans.
Thank You Gifts:
All of the jewelry items and acrylic display boxes given to contributors are handmade by Butterfly Wing Bling, LLC. These are unique items that are great items for you to enjoy or give as gifts yourself. 
"Mother Nature lets the beauty last a few weeks...we let it last Forever"

story:
Short Summary

The St. J. Food Co-op is a community-owned business that provides local, organic, and high-quality food to the residents of the Northeast Kingdom. The Co-op has been connecting local producers and customers and facilitating educational programs for more than twenty years. This is more than a food store -- it is a community center. The Co-op has recently been declining in revenue due to internal and external factors such as competition from other grocers, road construction that has discouraged shoppers, and for a time, a lack of budget and permanent general manager at the store.

This has pushed the Co-op into severe debt. But despite these very real struggles, we are confident that all of us working together can make the St. J. Food Co-op the place we have always envisioned.

A change in management and business strategy has taken place that will allow the Co-op to once again become competitive in the local economy. But in order to realize our vision, the Co-op must rise out of these financial straits. The Co-op is now at the point of closing its doors. As the result of consultation at a  general member/staff/board meeting, it was determined we must raise $10,000 for the Co-op to restock the store and reduce the debt enough that the new business model can be put in place to revitalize this vital community asset. 

We, the concerned members of the St. J. Food Co-op, have put together this crowd funding campaign in the hope of raising these funds to revitalize a Cooperative that means so much to the town of St. Johnsbury. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $10,000 in order to help restock the Co-op and put into place the Co-op's business plan and repayment of debt. This crowdfunding campaign is only one part of a larger fundraising plan that will continue for the months to come until the Co-op is out of the red. However, these long term plans will be impossible without this initial boost.

First and foremost, the return for donating to this campaign is knowing that every dollar will go towards stimulating a local, intentional small business that has served the community for many years and helped support the livelihoods of Co-op staff and the local farmers and producers who stock the store.

In return for your generosity, we are offering small shout-outs in thanks on social networks and in the store, personalized letters of thanks from the Co-op board, and even a membership to the store. For larger donations, we will send you some healthy, local Co-op goodies!

Risks & Challenges

As with all businesses, the Co-op is not immune to the tide of the economy. While this campaign will hugely support the continued existence of the store, it cannot guarantee its long term success. However, with this immediate input of capital, future fundraising and the new business plan will be made possible, allowing the Co-op to thrive.

Other Ways You Can Help

Although donations are the most direct way of supporting the continued existence of the Co-op, this is not the only way you can help. Shopping in the Co-op, located at  409 Portland St, St. Johnsbury, VT 05819, is an equally huge help. And, of course, spreading the word to family and friends by social media and word of mouth is always appreciated!

story:
Look around your house, apartment, office cubicle.  Do you see an empty plastic bottle? Despite the fact that you'll probably never think of that bottle again, that bottle is all The Bottle Foundation thinks about. 

While you see a plastic water bottle, we see an opportunity. As you walk throughout New York City, you will notice many New Yorkers rummaging through the garbage, collecting plastic bottles. They take these bottles to recycling centers and receive five (5) cents for each bottle. Our plan is to take homeless and low-income New Yorkers off the streets and employ them directly by adding economies of scale to the process. By working for TBF, New Yorkers will earn a stable wage, have access to benefits, and improve their career prospects. 


The statistics surrounding homelessness in New York City are alarming. In April 2014 alone, there was an all-time record of 54,667 homeless people sleeping each night in the city municipal shelter system (including 13,001 families and 23,116 homeless children). Thousands more live unsheltered in the streets. Over 113,000 unique New Yorkers were homeless at some point in 2010, while over 30,000 New York City schoolchildren will face homelessness at some point this year.

Of course, there are many factors that lead to poverty and homelessness with a lack of affordable housing, lack of sufficient employment opportunities, domestic violence, addiction, and mental illness regarded as some of the most common.  For those struggling with employment, many turn to the New York State Bottle Bill to earn 5 cents for every plastic bottle they collect off the streets.  

At the Bottle Foundation, we'll focus on homelessness attributed to a lack of adequate income. Through our programs,  we'll strive to directly employ hundreds of individuals living on the streets or in shelters primarily as a result of insufficient employment opportunities.


In a nutshell, our idea comes down to a single question:  How can we reduce income related homelessness in New York City without the need of purely monetary donations?  

Our Answer: By applying economies of scale to the incentives built in the New York State Bottle Bill.

The power of what TBF is doing is in the NYS Bottle Bill. The New York State Returnable Container Act of 1982 (aka the "Bottle Bill") enables consumers to redeem most recyclable containers in exchange for the five (5) cent deposit initially paid when the container was purchased. Retailers of these containers (such as Duane Reade) are required to accept redemptions from consumers in exchange for the original deposit. Similarly, redemption centers registered with NYS can also accept these recyclables  (for eventual pickup by the original distributor) in exchange for three and a half (3.5) cents of compensation for processing the redemptions.

By organizing as a redemption center, TBF can personally redeem recyclables in exchange for eight and a half (8.5) cents per container (five (5) cents on the initial deposit, plus the three and a half (3.5) cent handling fee).

Yet, the beautify in our concept lies with the scale that we bring to the process:

  • Instead of haphazardly collecting redeemables from the streets, TBF will appeal to NYC businesses and residential establishments to donate their daily recycling to the foundation. 
  • TBF trucks will collect and sort these donations from the donor’s property, after which they will be redeemed back to the distributor on a weekly basis.
  • TBF will hire unemployed, homeless, and very low-income New Yorkers to run the majority of our operations (i.e., collect contributions, market the organization, appeal to potential donors, etc). This employment is, of course, the core mission of our organization.
  • The income generated through redeemable donations will be used to pay staff wages, increase the scale of our operations, and ultimately hire more New Yorkers.

 

Matt & Nicole became fast friends as sophomores in college. While life took them in different directions, they both landed in NYC. Although they live in different neighborhoods (Matt = West Village, Nicole = Brooklyn), there are certain common themes in both of their lives. Each and every day they see other New Yorkers rummaging through trash to pay their bills. Concerned for these individuals health and safety, they decided to create a non-profit that would give members of their community a safer and more effective way to earn a living.


What We Need: We are looking to you, our friends, family, fellow concerned citizens, in hopes that you will support us in this vision.  Our projections show that with $125,000 in initial grant funding, we can hire a full time director, secure a workspace, and purchase equipment. We know that's a lot of money, but we're confident that we can reach our goal through your help!

To start our fundraising, we are looking for $50,000 in initial funding to kick-off this incredible non-profit. While big businesses and funding sources are interested in our idea - and are willing to help out - they will only contribute once we have secured initial seed money. Your contribution - big or small - will help TBF create safe and environmentally-friendly employment opportunities for struggling New Yorkers.  


If you want to do more than just make a donation, here are plenty of other ways that you can help make TBF a reality: 

  • Become a donor of recyclables: We intend to develop a donor base large enough to support break-even cash flow before even opening our doors. Even if you or you’re organization can’t personally contribute, recommendations to potential donors would be greatly appreciated. 
  • Partner with us: We recognize that that we will only reach maximum effectiveness by working closely with city agencies, community partners, and other nonprofit organizations.  We hope to be able to develop relationships and official partnerships that are mutually beneficial in advancing our missions. 
  • Connect us to resources: Our hope is to minimize our non-program expenditures, while maximizing our program related spending.  For this reason, we’re actively looking for affordable access to physical resources (equipment, workspaces, etc) and human capital (volunteers, board members, financial professionals, etc).


We know we can't make the Bottle Foundation a reality without you.  For this reason, we're going to go the extra mile to thank you.  For those of you who contribute in any way (sharing a social media post, sharing this link with friends, even just following us on facebook), we'll permanently list you as a founding supporter on our website.  Just let us know how you helped out.  For those of you who can donate monetarily, we'll go one step further and print your name on the wrapping of our collection vehicles as an extra thank you.  

The road ahead is challenging, but we are ready to do everything necessary to make TBF the answer to poverty and environmental issues in NYC.  WIth your help, the possibilities are endless with The Bottle Foundation!

story:
Attention Auto Enthusiasts!! 

Hi, my name is Jordan and this is my auto repair shop.   Actually, its your auto repair shop.

  This is the only Do It Yourself auto repair shop in Las Vegas.  It is a fully stocked repair shop that can be rented by the hour.  The rental rate includes tools and the auto lift.  It follows the concept of the Makerspace or the hobby shop found on military bases.   
    I was a technician for over 15 years and hurt my back.  I can't work as well as I used to, so I had the idea to make a shop where the average person can come in and work on their own car or truck.  I run the shop and am available for technical assistance or to lend a helping hand.
I have put my life's savings into setting up the shop and making sure everything was set up and permitted properly, but it has taken so long to go though the permit and inspection process and open the doors, that I am almost completely out of funds.
We just had our grand opening July 25th and my close in the next month.  

I am looking for funding to keep my business alive until momentum grows enough for it to be self supporting.

Your contribution will go directly towards the operating costs of this business and provide funding for advertising.


The shop has very little overhead and is simple to operate.  It has been well received by everyone that has used it.  Our Facebook page has had over 700 likes in the first month of being open, people love the concept!  Our Yelp and Google pages also have great reviews. 

Our challenges are simple, keep the doors open for an estimated 6 months to a year.  That will give the business enough time to grow and prosper. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are lots of ways to help, visit my facebook page http://www.facebook.com/sincitydiy to like, share, and spread the word.  

People need a place to work on their own cars, out of the sun and heat.  Away from apartments and driveways and home owner associations.  This is a place for everyone to use, from a simple oil change to engine replacements.  From pre-purchase inspections to post track day check ups.

My shop is that place.  Don't let it close!

story:
The Market on Main began in 2013 with the idea that the people of Somerset, Kentucky were ready for a vibrant, diverse community market that gave local farmers and artisans a viable outlet for their wares. The project was embraced with open arms and an overwhelming amount of love and support. We have deeply loved being a part of this community and sharing our passion for local food and creative people with the people of Somerset. You have loved us back by showing up every week of the season—rain or shine—and shopping with our vendors, listening to our music, and sharing your lives with us. 

But every week we hear the same thing from you: three hours once a week in the summer just isn't enough. You want access to our healthy farm products in a way that is more convenient to your busy schedules. You also want to get that some warm feeling of community whenever you need to feel good, not just on Thursday nights. 

We have heard your pleas, which is why in the fall of 2015 we are opening a retail location for the Market on Main. But we can't do it without your help! Read on to find out how you can support our vision for a new space in Somerset to get the products you want when you want them. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our vision for a retail space extends beyond just what our farms offer to include other unique offerings of Kentucky farms and artists, as well as natural and fair trade items to help round out the mix. We have leased over 2,000 square feet of retail space to be sure we have plenty of room for plenty of food as well as space for workshops, classes, and maybe even the occasional live music from talented local musicians. 

We have so many ideas for making a space that promotes healthy food and a strong feeling of community and we are willing to do the work, but we can't do it alone. We need some startup cash to help make this dream a reality. In return, we will offer you the same level of innovation and dedication that earned the Market on Main a business of the year award from the Somerset-Pulaski County Chamber of Commerce in 2014 and our founder, Jamie Aramini, a Crave Civic Agriculture Award for local food advocacy. Plus, we've also come up with some fun perks in exchange for your support!

The Budget

We are asking for $15,000 to help complete our goal of opening a retail location. 
Here is a breakdown of where that will go:

Indiegogo Fees $750

Credit Card Processing $500

Reward Fulfillment $3,000

Building Improvements/Repairs $4,000

POS System  $1,200

Display Shelving and Bulk Bins $3,500

Misc. Startup Costs $2,050

This amount only represents a part of our startup costs (such as licenses, permits, leasing, refrigeration, getting the existing walk-in back in working order, and staff) and hopes for the space, but it will go a long ways towards helping us realize our dream of a welcoming, beautiful, inviting space for the people of Somerset to purchase healthy, local foods. 

The Rewards

Your contribution will keep on giving beyond opening day and the delivery of your perks. By helping make this project a reality, you are providing a viable income stream for sustainable farms in Pulaski County and beyond. Even better, you are helping create the Somerset that you want to live in. 

In exchange for your help, we've included some great perks—including early access to our space and an exclusive VIP ticket to our soft launch party! All perks come with your name listed on both our website and somewhere in the store itself. (Out of town and can't pick up your rewards? No worries, we can mail!)

Risks & Challenges

This is a huge project, both in terms of financial and time investment. With any such project, there are bound to be challenges. Things often cost more and take longer, but you can be assured that the same level of devotion that has made the Market on Main a success will be applied to this project. 

If we don't meet our funding goals, this project will still be completed, but on a smaller and slower scale. This could possibly mean a delay in perk fulfillment. It is a bit of an experiment for Somerset, but we fully believe that the community is ready and willing to embrace this new project with the same open arms that have made the Market on Main a success. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even the smallest contribution of $5 will help us achieve our goal. In fact, if every one of our Facebook followers gave $5 towards our goal—this project would be fully funded! If you can't give financially, please consider sharing this project on your Facebook or Twitter accounts to help spread the word! Also, you can continue to support our farmers and artists by visiting the Market on Main every Thursday night from 5-8 pm in downtown Somerset at the Judicial Center Plaza from June-August. Oh, and don't forget—music starts at 6. See you there!

    The Rewards Your contribution will keep on giving beyond opening day and the delivery of your perks. By helping make this project a reality, you are providing a viable income stream for sustainable farms in Pulaski County and beyond. Even better, you are helping create the Somerset that you want to live in. 
In exchange for your help, we've included some great perks—including early access to our space and an exclusive VIP ticket to our soft launch party! All perks come with your name listed on both our website and somewhere in the store itself. (Out of town and can't pick up your rewards? No worries, we can mail!)
    Risks & Challenges This is a huge project, both in terms of financial and time investment. With any such project, there are bound to be challenges. Things often cost more and take longer, but you can be assured that the same level of devotion that has made the Market on Main a success will be applied to this project. 
If we don't meet our funding goals, this project will still be completed, but on a smaller and slower scale. This could possibly mean a delay in perk fulfillment. It is a bit of an experiment for Somerset, but we fully believe that the community is ready and willing to embrace this new project with the same open arms that have made the Market on Main a success. 
    Other Ways You Can Help Even the smallest contribution of $5 will help us achieve our goal. In fact, if every one of our Facebook followers gave $5 towards our goal—this project would be fully funded! If you can't give financially, please consider sharing this project on your Facebook or Twitter accounts to help spread the word! Also, you can continue to support our farmers and artists by visiting the Market on Main every Thursday night from 5-8 pm in downtown Somerset at the Judicial Center Plaza from June-August. Oh, and don't forget—music starts at 6. See you there!

story:
We introduce to you "Pachamama Forest Retreat", an all-inclusive spiritual endeavor, seeded by Nixiwaka and Txarani. Our focus is for this space to benefit our conscious community work and for us to continue the spiritual practices we have implemented over the past 25 years in South Africa.

We have been guided to continue our practice of traditional and holistic healing for our conscious community in South Africa in the forest. We have found land in the Knysna Forest that provides us with good soil, to grow organic food and natural medicines that will be used for the healing retreats we host. This land has some beautiful existing infrastructure on that would makes it possible for us to start hosting healing retreats immediately. Our work is focused on community healing with natural and traditional modalities.

Nixiwaka (pronounced Nishiwaka) a registered traditional healer of South Africa, has been working with spiritual and holistic healing within different communities and traditions for 25 years. His work was seeded by working with the sound journey healing and sprouted into the ancient knowledge of the temazcal (sweat lodge) purification ritual, where the knowledge of indigenous cultures and their teachings of plant medicines has rooted as the core of his works focus.

Txarani (pronounced Charanee) has been working with Nixiwaka for the past 9 months as his partner. She has been working within the conscious community for 2 years, focussing on healing trauma in her body caused by Celiac disease, which has consequently led her to learn more about dietary healing as a whole. Her passion is healing through artistic expression in all forms; vocal (singing & chanting), visual (drawing, painting & sculpting) and physical (yoga,movement & dancing).

Our values and intentions:

  • The practice of spiritual and holistic healing through the guiding of traditional rituals, which teach us how to live harmoniously with the earth and all sentient beings.
  • To heal our bodies through diet, healing our minds through positive progressive thought and healing spiritually through acknowledging our suffering and releasing what no longer serves our path.
  • To incorporate different traditional rituals such as Sound healing, the purification Temazcal, inspired and run in the Native American Red Path format, and Ceremonial rituals in a unique style that has been developed throughout the years of practice in the Huni Kuin Kaxinawa style.
  • To incorporate holistic body purification with organ and parasite cleansing, dietary & organic lifestyle education, offering guided meditations and support through artistic expression, aiding in emotional and spiritual healing.
  • To expand the food gardens, set into action through permaculture, food foresting and biodynamic farming retreats.
  • To include the practical education of food growing, working in the garden will be included into the programs of monthly retreats.
  • To support the less fortunate local community with education on sustainability by establishing a program where people can work in the garden in exchange for produce and knowledge gained.
  • As this land borders the Knysna indigenous forest, we will reforest the property with indigenous trees, sensitively, throughout a 15 year program.
  • We will establish medicine gardens and plant sacred medicines to support the Pachamama community work

Existing infrastructures on the land are:

  • A wooden yoga studio that holds up to 20 people
  • 6 small wooden huts that sleep 2 people each
  • A campsite with unlimited camping.
  • A beautiful wooden communal kitchen & dining area
  • Rain catchment systems on all large structures, connecting pipes and water storage tanks.
  • Nature integrated, fire heated showers.
  • Composting toilets.
  • A Cottage with a kitchenette and composting toilet.
  • 2 wooden houses with a bathroom and toilet each.
  • A small permaculture veggie garden.
  • A small dam which is the water supply for the garden.
  • Electrical power line from municipality.  

How we will expand the existing facilities with the raised funds:

  • Fencing the property of 8 Hectare.
  • Sinking a borehole for fresh spring water.
  • Build large greenhouses to grow nutritious food and medicines.
  • Build a larger ceremonial space with sustainable materials and a central fire, holding 30-40 people.
  • Build more accommodation huts for participants.
  • Renovate all existing infrastructure.
Our plan of Action
We have put this project into action by setting up the purchase of the land, the Pachamama centre through an existing non-profit company.  The non-profit company (a section 21 company) enables us to expand the infrastructure on the land through further donations and crowdfunding.
The space we have found to continue this work on, is a beautiful 8 Hectare property on the border of the Knysna indigenous forest. The center establishes a base for our ever-growing community to come together to learn & explore more of sustainable, low impact living. Nixiwaka has set up similar infrastructures in the past and has an excellent blueprint for what is necessary for this space to be successful. We will apply the same organic based principles to further construction on the property, and are welcoming other experts in our circle to inspire future sustainable ideas and structures.

The impact

Your support will contribute to this base being set up for the conscious community to gather for healing, in a safe and comfortable place. The need for the infrastructure to be state-of-the-art in sustainability, is so we can focus on cultivating the other vital pieces to this whole puzzle; the nutritious food, the relative guidance and information for various retreats, and the accumulation of necessary equipment and products. When we have a solid foundation for our retreats, we will open the doors for the international conscious community to participate with here us.

A significant part of our work is the incorporation of the teachings from the indigenous tribes in Brazil. This is an absolutely vital part of our work because we understand that this work needs to be done with respect and integrity to the lineage of which the teachings come. The ancient wisdom harvested from sacred rituals help us to be open with our hearts, learn how to live harmoniously with mother earth and all her beings, and walk an integral path aligned with our true life purpose.

Nixiwaka is a fully initiated and registered Traditional Healer of South Africa (Reg no. 1067 G.P)

story:
My name is Kerubo Mokaya and am part of the campaign team that is seeking to raise funds for  my church, The Living Word Foursquare Church, Satellite, Nairobi, Kenya to build a permanent place of worship for God. I started attending the church when I was in 7th grade. At this church, my foundation in Christianity developed and my father got completely redeemed. It has also continued to build strong testimonies to many people in the community who are getting saved and turning to God. 

Although this church is in a humble neighborhood in Nairobi, they consistently support each other through different aspects of life. Before I came to attend the University of Pennsylvania in the summer of 2011, they came together and raised some funds that went towards my pocket money.


The Church History: 

The church was planted in Satellite in the year 2004 under a tree with only 5 members. This was motivated by the pastor’s revelation of preaching the gospel into the area due to high incidences of criminal activities, drunkenness, immorality and rising number of street children among other reasons. 

The church continued to grow and by the year 2005, it was blessed with a rented building in a nearby school. However, in 2008, the school was undergoing an expansion and the church Lease agreement was terminated by the end of that year. In 2009, the church leased a piece of land and constructed a temporary building which has been a place of worship for God since then. 

The Church Leadership: 

The church is under Foursquare Gospel Mission in Kenya with the following Leadership:

  • Bishop Joseph Ondicho Michieka- Foursquare Gospel Mission in Kenya. 
  • Pastor Philip Nyabuto Ondima- The Living Word Foursquare Gospel Satellite Church
  • The Church Board comprising of 5 members namely the Chairman, Secretary, Treasurer, Head of Deacons, and youth patron and; 
  • Development committee spearheading the fundraising. 

The pastor provides leadership to the church congregation and is responsible to the church board. Church funds are also kept in a bank account with clear signing mandates as agreed by the church Board.

To reach the unreached, the church is organized into vibrant ministries for men, women, youth, Sunday school, evangelism and hospitality which are coordinated by various heads responsible to the church pastor.

Vision:

To present Jesus Christ to every person in every culture and every nation.

Mission

We are a Great Commission movement transforming communities through the multiplication of disciples, leaders, churches and movements.

What We Need & What You Get

The church currently uses a leased piece land and is on notice to buy the piece of land or demolish the structure and relocate to another place come the end of this year. This is because the owner wants to construct rental apartments. 

Due to this, the church has initiated a fundraising project to buy land and construct a church all valued at Kshs. 12.2 Million (US$ 125, 000).

The Impact

Your contribution will assist build a house of Worship for God that would help in transforming many lives turning them back to God. 

The church will facilitate men, women and youth empowerment, tutoring of elementary school, and Sunday school children.

It will also go along way in enabling this community have a center for other development activities. 


Please join us in spreading the Word of God in supporting by contributing to this noble calling. You will be constantly updated on the progress being made. 

Thank you and May God bless you for your generous support.

story:
We are people reflecting the world with multimedia. Our text includes social commentary, arts in review, and creative writing. The audio stream includes live music and interviews. We now produce original photography, video, and illustration. This is just the beginning. We are also a media company in development. 

THE PEOPLE

Thru Magazine was launched in beta form one year ago by Publisher, owner, and contributor, Sean Ongley. The path to this point began when he received audio/visual technical certification in Los Angeles (2002). He then moved to Portland, attending local colleges for music, philosophy, anthropology, and writing (03-08). As a producer at KBOO Community Radio (06-11) his broadcasts served live music, theater, and arts journalism to the masses. He organized a non-profit corporation called InterArts, producing the St. Johns No Fest (08-11), and Cathedral Park Jazz Festival (12-13). He changed his path in 2014, emerging from a period of self-reflection with Thru Media LLC, which formed on July 23rd, 2015. 

Co-founding owner, Kathleen Dolan, acts as Editor-in-Chief, due to her eye for detail, storytelling, and she has contributed several hit pieces. Her ideas and communication keep things moving. Ingrid Horton, Visual Marketing Chief, has a strong portfolio in design with many branding successes and has been instrumental in producing a high quality appearance for us. Jen Scholten volunteers as Calendar Editor, and contributes regularly with photography and writing. Estevan Munoz writes mostly on film and music, and has a knack for setting off viral posts. Booker Nelson very recently joined us as an editorial contributor. Other past contributors include Jairus Dathan Smith, Jax Ko, Becca Yenser, Evan Wheeler, D. Todd Dickerson, Paula Helen, Mae Pope.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Currently we're all volunteers, and the executives are spending out of pocket. We all believe in journalism, it is an honor and a discipline viewing ourselves as both teacher and student. We're deeply committed, but the volunteerism isn't sustainable. For your support, we're offering perks that highlight our business strategy with four streams of income. 

  • Events are a good source of revenue and marketing, so you can help us open that stream with an RSVP to our launch party in January.
  • Thru Market will be a consignment shop for artists and craft makers, and a gift certificate would give us leverage to develop the shop.
  • We have a limited number of tickets to shows given to us by arts presenters that we cover routinely. Our perk price is 20% below face value.
  • Creative and technical services are a common practice at most publications. This perk gives away such services at a very low introductory rate.
  • Advertising packages are the major stream of income that we can offer business supporters of Thru Magazine. Our low-cost operation allows for a small introductory advert rate in bulk. 

HOW YOUR INVESTMENT BUILDS THE BUSINESS

  • Upgrade web server advancing its lease for a year
  • Upgrade website tools 
  • Secure liability insurance
  • Establish a fair rate pay-table for our contributors
  • Upgrade media tools for audio/visual/computing
  • Produce marketing materials for sponsorship
  • Savings account toward future office
  • Start developing Thru Market, the magazine's shop
  • Start planning the launch event

We want to publish one new piece a day, currently we average one every other day. Last month we had 2,000 viewers and we retain them at a rate of 25%, therefore doubling content would quadruple readership in short time. We'll improve our marketing strategies to reach 20,000 monthly viewers by 2017.

Our plans will require months to roll out. Thru Market will be built from existing templates in our website. We will upgrade to a secure server to ensure a safe marketplace. Thru Events will inaugurate everything with vendor tables at our launch party on January 30th, 2016. We have already confirmed a global dance party presented by Boomarm Nation and Gran Ritmos. A special bar will be supported by Merit Badge Cockatil Co.

AREAS OF LEARNING

We're studying marketing. Breaking through the noise isn't easy, the world is flooding with media, but from what we've discovered, there's room for us. Our unique local-global content, which covers international artists and social topics, is rooted  deeply into Portland and invites readers across the world. 

We're studying management, to deal with unforeseen costs and conflicts. We will retain legal representation and financial consultation. The greatest hurdle so far has never been the idea, or the talent — it’s the money. 

SOME OF OUR FAVORITE STUFF

Jen Scholten's photography has drawn the praise of readers and performers alike, helping to establish the inclusion of photo sets as an integral part of our coverage. Below is Kat MacMillan at this Summer's Improvisation Summit of Portland presented by the Creative Music Guild.


Kathleen Dolan holds the most viewed article and continuously impresses readers with her heartfelt yet journalistically accurate stories. Here is an excerpt from Dance Theatre of Harlem, last April at the Arlene Schnitzer Concert Hall. 
New York was on stage. The collection of bodies, of all different colors, the deepest black to pale white under blond hair, all glowed with radiance in the stage lighting. There was simplicity to the choreography, the lighting and backdrops, and it made me think of a New York distilled; not as a huge, busy, intimidating metropolis but as an accumulation of neighborhoods, resilient and intimate like small towns, and of the relationships playing out everyday on those streets where time seems to stretch both ways.
From The Spirit of Harlem Shines in Portland, April 2015
Estevan Munoz's obsession with Paul Thomas Anderson is revealed with a preview article for the Northwest Film Center's festival devoted to one of America's youngest film legends.
In retrospect, I don’t know what’s more bizarre and unsettling: the character of Freddie Quell or my inexplicable need to act like a character like Freddie Quell. I walked around the hallways of my high-school senior year imitating a man with a jagged back posture, chemical-death-booze on his breath, a slurred mumble, and a face that suggested the victim of a thousand strokes.
From Obsession with The Master, July 2015

Sean Ongley's Horizon at End Times podcast covers a lot of ground as he interviews artists and innovators while grappling with the topics of the day. Sean also produces live music and comedy pieces for the magazine. Below are a few examples that express the range of audio content that we publish.


We have been ramping up our journalistic rigor in the editorial department, and would like to cover more regional news. Todd Dickerson’s op-ed piece about Nestle's plan to bottle 100 million gallons of water a year from Oxbow Springs perfectly illustrates the kind of subjective honesty we value.

The basalt spring water in question, which Nestlé is solely interested in pursuing, is the property of the residents of the State of Oregon, not of the City of Cascade Locks. A trade deal doesn’t change that, but it works around it. What happens to that water is the business of every voter within the state; all citizens of this state are the stewards of that water. If this deal was a good one for Oregon, then why the need to “narrow the scope,” and engage in this kind of obfuscation?
From Nestling in with Cascade Locks City Administrators, May 2015

Kathleen Dolan did something special by embedding in a National Women's Soccer League championship team, the Portland Thorns, during open tryouts. A youth athlete herself, she managed to hold her own and reveal an experience shared with sixty-two others. Her story is the most viewed post on Thru Magazine.

Everything from trapping the ball, to corner kicks, to simple passing was on a level of precision and repetition that was second nature. The spectacles of play these girls could do were awesome to watch. In one scrimmage, a perfect  cross landed on the foot of a player named Melissa and she did a bicycle kick in the goal box. She didn’t score but I had never seen that seriously attempted by a teammate of mine. We used to joke as teenagers after practice and flop around trying to do it, but it probably looked more like we were imitating cartoon characters slipping on banana peels. All the women thought Melissa’s go at it was cool too, and she got some praise in the form of “oohs” and “aahs” but I reacted like we should stop the game and see if there was a clip of this we could send to ESPN.
From Two Days a Thorn, April 2015

An excerpt from Vertighost, an image with text by Jen Scholten

Wore it like a witch
tracing fingertips
along a silver belly.
Snake River.
Shivered twice
as onyx trailed behind,
once for me,
once for mine.


If you can’t help with an investment, but like the idea, share it on social media, follow us, and read something once in a while — reading is supporting.
