story:
The mission of NGO Social Strategies is to empower civil society in developing countries by capacity building local non-profits/NGOs. 

We are a New York-based team working to start a new, innovative, and unique nonprofit organization called NGO Social Strategies, Inc. Our dedicated and professional team will provide high quality organizational, programmatic, branding and marketing consultancy free-of-charge for local non-profit/non-governmental organizations in developing countries. Our mission is to capacity build these organizations to ensure that they develop a self-sufficient and sustainable organizational model. 

Help Us Help NGOs Broadcast Their Message Beyond Borders!

In developing countries local NGOs are providing crucial services and assistance to communities in need. These NGOs help their communities in cases where either the government’s or the international development organizations’ assistance is not able to reach or is not sufficient. We believe that the best solution to sustainable development issues in developing countries will come from a local source. However, the problem that we recognize and aim to solve is that many of these NGOs are struggling to sustain themselves. This is often not because their programs are not creating positive changes and helping their communities, the actual problem is that the general public and donors do not notice or support their work. The result is that many successful projects do not get the funding they deserve and are therefore limited in their development and expansion possibilities, because they lack human and capital resources.

Services we will provide to local non-profits/NGOs in developing countries: 

  • Grant Writing & Research Assistance
  • Social Media Support
  • Marketing, Branding, and Organizational Outreach
  • Publications & Concept Notes
*All services are free-of-charge for qualifying organizations. 

There are a lot of possibilities for NGOs to get to the next level and be noticed by the world. However a common issue for local NGOs in developing countries is that their staff often lack the skills to efficiently utilize modern channels of communication, such as websites, apps and social media. Even the process of directly applying for grants from donors can be a complicated task for local NGOs that do not speak “donor language." The result is that most of the support and funding is allocated to already resource-strong international development organizations.

We believe that local organizations possess the knowledge and understanding best needed to serve local communities.

We aim to change this disconnected relationship between local non-profits/NGOs and the international community and give the "underdogs" a chance! Our services are cost-effective and will generate awareness, interest, and help build a community of supportive network of donors. 

What we need to successfully launch NGO Social Strategies:

Money makes the world go-round and even if we wish we could, we cannot make NGO Social Strategies a reality without funding! Our NGO carries a very limited budget in comparison to most western-based development programs and organizations.

Our expenses include:

·  Salaries for two full-time staff = $60,000USD a year

·  Shared/coworking office space = $3,000USD a year

·  Pool for temporary expert consultants (i.e. graphic designers, grant writers, tax experts, etc.)  = $30,000 USD a year.

Estimated budget for year one = $93,000 USD

With your help we will provide free expert services for organizations in developing countries!

Every penny helps and even if we don’t get the full funding right away we can still start our work with local NGOs. Please help us gain basic funding and begin our mission to help NGOs help others!

For more information, please visit our site: NGOSocialStrategies.org, or follow us on Twitter or Facebook. 

Copyright © 2015 NGO Social Strategies, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

story:
Esteemed historian of Ann Arbor Wystan Stevens has died,  leaving behind a trove of slides, papers, postcards, books, antique Ann Arbor radios and musical insturments, and assorted mementos of the town. It is important these be preserved, digitized, and housed where Ann Arborites can learn and take pleasure from them. With your assistance, priceless artifacts and information will be maintained and displayed for the generations of Townies to come.

The majority of funds will go to the digitizing of over 100,000 Ann Arbor papers and photos, as well videos of historical tours and lectures, with the rest used to transport and donate historical objects to various Ann Arbor institutions. Stanford University Libraries estimates that eight weeks of digitizing documents amounts to $10,000 (this is at least a 20 week project).

Documents and objects will be distributed to the appropriate museums, including the Bentley Historical Museum, Kempf House Center for Local History,
and the Museum on Main Street.

story:
"Green needs Red and Orange needs Blue and Purple needs Yellow and the World needs You"

Hello, I'm Louis Buchetto,
Buddy Benches are a movement that is believed to have started in Germany then found their way to America by a 2nd grader named Christian Buck from York, Pennsylvania. 

The idea is simply a beautiful way to foster friendship on the school playground. It's a place for a shy child to take a seat which sends a message to their classmates 'I'd like to connect.' 
These benches are having a wonderful effect all over the world. 

I'm building these benches because I was that socially shy kid, most of the time loving my inner world. It’s the times in which I struggled to make a social connection that motivates me to make these benches.

I’m guessing because I seemed so content in my world, the times I wanted connection were not noticed by others; so bright, colorful benches with a awesome message, if I may say so myself, seem a great way to help.



All the Perks are of the art on the bench, which reads "Green needs Red and Orange needs Blue and Purple needs Yellow and the World needs You"


For the last 20 years I've been doing some of my best communicating though art with the ideals of Love, Light and Laughter. And I have been fortunate to be invited many times to share my art with hospitals, schools, and places of healing. 

Mural Flagstaff, Arizona.
"When you see only the dark know the light will return"


Schools which receive a Buddy Bench will get a strategic outline of 'How to implement the bench'.


              "If you really want to live in a fun place try the back of a zebra" 


I art and words are of myself and my daughter, the bench design is mine. The line work is carved into the wood, and there is lots of clear coating for outdoor use.

The funding of this project pays for materials, labor, and shipping anywhere in the Continental U.S. Designing the bench and fundraiser is my donation to the effort. 


Carved and painted benches in one of the two art galleries I have had. Nevada City, California and Flagstaff, Arizona.



      Bookmobile Project: "What if a book changed the story of your day?"
      

If you cannot contribute money to the campaign at this time please do help get the word out to others that may be able to help. Thanks you!

Should the full funding not be reached this bench will still be gifted to a school; If you know a school that would like to recieve this bench please have them contact me as soon as possible. 

Love, Light and Laughter,
Louis Buchetto
www.LouisBuchetto.com
Here's a link to: 

Strategies for Using the Buddy Bench

Here's a link to: A short video about Christian:
Here's a link to: How one school uses these benches for children with Austism:

with a awesome message, if I may say so myself, seem a great way to help.All the Perks are of the art on the bench, which reads "Green needs Red and Orange needs Blue and Purple needs Yellow and the World needs You"For the last 20 years I've been doing some of my best communicating though art with the ideals of Love, Light and Laughter. And I have been fortunate to be invited many times to share my art with hospitals, schools, and places of healing. 






Mural Flagstaff, Arizona. "When you see only the dark know the light will return"




Schools which receive a Buddy Bench will get a
strategic outline of 'How to implement the bench'.



              "If you really want to live in a fun place try the back of a zebra" 


I art and words are of myself and my daughter, the bench design is mine. The line work is carved into the wood, and there is lots of clear coating for outdoor use. 
The funding of this project pays for materials, labor, and shipping anywhere in the Continental U.S. Designing the bench and fundraiser is my donation to the effort. 




Carved and painted benches in one of the two art galleries I have had. Nevada City, California and Flagstaff, Arizona.








      Bookmobile Project: "What if a book changed the story of your day?"      

If you cannot contribute money to the campaign at this time please do help get the word out to others that may be able to help. Thanks you!
Should the full funding not be reached this bench will still be gifted to a school; If you know a school that would like to recieve this bench please have them contact me as soon as possible. 
Love, Light and Laughter,Louis Buchettowww.LouisBuchetto.com
Here's a link to: 



Strategies for Using the Buddy Bench


Here's a link to: A short video about Christian:
Here's a link to: How one school uses these benches for children with Austism:

story:
Check out our new video!

http://goanimate.com/videos/0jHf1-0HLyq4?utm_so...

We know we should recycle, We know the world is changing, And we know we can do something about it.

But until now, it was difficult to feel like you were making a difference and it was a hassle to recycle!

Have you ever wanted to recycle but didn't because it took up too much room?

Have you ever wanted to recycle but didn't because it was unavailable or inconvenient?

Well good news, with the EcologizerTM you will never have to experience these problems ever again!

You simply put your recyclable waste item into the EcologizerTM and let the machine do the rest.

The EcologizerTM obliterates the recyclable waste and then sorts and preps the material for reprocessing into new products.

Best of all,  users of our machine (1) no longer need to pay for a waste company to come pick up their recyclable waste and (2) are able to profit from their trash.

Help us save the environment and American workers,

CONTRIBUTE NOW!

Can't afford to contribute? Help us by spreading the word.  Make some noise about our campaign.  And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Forget traditional methods! New renewable energy powered recycling appliance makes it easier for you and your business to recycle!


How Your Support Helps!

We have been working on the EcologizerTM for over a year utilizing personal funds to get to this point. We have some individual components, CAD designs and a patent pending, all of which prove our design. We are now working hard on building our first fully functioning prototype. We need your help to finish building our prototype and to make the EcologizerTM available to the public. 

The funds raised will be used for...

  •  Enhanced Design drawing costs
  • Prototype building costs
  • Production tooling and mold creation costs

Help us make the EcologizerTM available to you and millions of others who would otherwise be unable to recycle.

                             

The EcologizerTM is for businesses, apartments, homes and municipalities.  It will be available in several sizes:  ranging from smaller than a dishwasher to larger than a dumpster.  Some models will even be solar powered.


For Consumers: Protect Your Children's Future:

The EcologizerTM ain't your Grandma's trash compactor; it sorts, cleans and processes recyclable waste. This will allow you, as a consumer, to de-clutter your garage or kitchen and reduce the amount of storage space needed for recyclable waste. This will decrease the amount of times you will have to empty the waste, eliminate the need to pay for a waste company to come pick it up** and can even allow you to sell your recyclable waste to local processing plants.  

**With the EcologizerTM you will be able to have (1) our partners pick up your waste free of charge or (2) be able to drop off your recyclable waste at a processing facility in return for a monetary incentive.  Either way you aren't paying for a waste company to pick up your recyclables.

Want to learn more? Check out this link to our  Brochure.


For Your Business: An Eco-Friendly Way 

The Economics of the EcologizerTM:

The EcologizerTM is more than a Public Relations boost or cool new gadget for your company.  It is a smart investment for your business. Don't let those missed profits go to waste.**  Regardless of whether you receive renewable tax credits, you will recover your full cost of the machine within 3-5 years. If you factor in the opportunity to sell your recyclable waste for money, you will recover your full investment in under 3 years.  On top of that, EcoCycle Ingenuity is working hard to get you the tax credits you deserve for purchasing the EcologizerTM.

**With the EcologizerTM you will be able to have (1) our partners pick up your recyclable waste free of charge or (2) be able to drop off your recyclable waste at a processing facility in return for a monetary incentive.  Either way you aren't paying for a waste company to pick up your recyclables.

Want to learn more? Check out this link to our Brochure.


Quality and Reliability

Our mission is to increase the amount of people who recycle and decrease the cost of recycled products.  It is EcoCycle Ingenuity's goal to be made in America, to participate and promote sustainable practices, to give back to state and local communities, to treat our employees with the highest respect, to donate to charitable organizations and to mentor future generations.



Our invention will create manufacturing jobs in the USA. Help save the environment and protect your children's future. The EcologizerTM will come with a manufacturing warranty and, eventually, be made primarily of recycled materials.


EcoCycle Ingenuity Team

   Kory Sgrignoli Jr.--CoFounder & President


Kory has leadership and managerial experiences from previous endeavors including founder & president of a National Society of Leadership and Success and director of Golden Key International Honors Society. He has had internships for the University of Florida, The Trademark Company and the United States Congress. Kory has earned an Associate’s Degree in Accounting from Santa Fe College, a Bachelor’s Degree in Food and Resource Economics from the University of Florida, and is currently in his 3rd year of law school, seeking his Juris Doctorate.


Gloria Squartino--CoFounder & CEO
Gloria has previous business experience, managing her husband’s welding company for over 20 years.  Throughout this experience, Gloria has formed endless vendor relationships and industry knowledge.  At times, she had several employees working under her husband, but the economic downturn halted the construction market, hitting the industry particularly hard.  However, the welding company still operates today.  This has taught Gloria to crawl before walking and to assess risk in all areas of the business.

Can't afford to contribute? Help us by spreading the word.  Make some noise about our campaign.  And don't forget, use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Fellowship of The Tulgey Wood is a program for people with severe disabilities and the friends who adore them.  We range in age from 15 to 83 and are grateful to call the island of Nantucket our home.  Each year we come together to enjoy both the astounding beauty of Nantucket and our delight in being with each other. We swim, bike with Nantucket Wheelers, sail, surf, fish, and do daily yoga. We create, produce, and perform an original musical. We have a spa day, after dinner storytelling, and music nights, as well as dance parties. Nantucket has welcomed us with open arms and we are frequently invited to attend plays, concerts, and other local events.

Coming from all over the US, from the UK, Canada, and Mexico, volunteers even pay for their transportation to Nantucket. If they can, participants pay $50 a week, but money never prevents anyone from attending. Less than 5% of the funds we raise goes to administrative costs. 

In our three weeks on Nantucket, we create a vibrant community where everyone participates to their fullest.  Because $50 a week cannot meet our costs, we rely on the generosity of donors like you. 

The Tulgey Wood exists for two main purposes:  The first is to share Nantucket with those who would otherwise never have the opportunity to visit. We are able to introduce some wonderful, yet often forgotten, people to the community of Nantucket.  The second purpose is to assist in the startup of similar programs throughout the U.S. and abroad.  Since 1992, we have helped to launch several “sprouts” which are now self-sustaining.  These programs are located in Mexico, Mississippi, California, Florida, Guatemala and Vermont. The Tulgey Wood operates under the umbrella of The Katie Johnson Fellowship, a 501(C)(3).

2015 will be our tenth summer on Nantucket.  This year, the organizers of Tulgey Wood have created a charitable fund with the Community Foundation for Nantucket.  All net proceeds from this Indiegogo giving initiative will go into that fund to directly support this local program.

Visit us at www.tulgey.org for more information and check out the feature article on The Tulgey Wood in N Magazine at http://www.n-magazine.com/fellowship-of-friends/

Our goal is to raise $20,000 in 20 days! Please contribute as generously as you can and share our message with your friends and families! Thank you!

story:
RURAL SPARK LIGHTS UP COMMUNITIES

UPDATE: iDeal made possible: click here

Access to energy is the driving force behind progress at a local level in developing countries. It enables individuals to improve their socio-economic positions, bringing prosperity to communities. Rural Spark is a young and ambitious social enterprise. We seek to supply potentially 400 million Indian people with energy by offering smart technological solutions, distributed through a dynamic network of local entrepreneurial partners.

We founded Rural Spark because we believe that we can improve access to energy, even in the most remote parts of the world. About three years ago, we decided to go to India to start building and implementing tomorrow's energy solutions. We are dedicated to delivering socially relevant innovation by applying a user-centered design approach with a real focus on people.

With a proof of concept already delivered we, together with a large number partners, are working on a brighter future for individuals and communities that are currently without access to safe and/or clean energy. By creating sustainable energy networks in these areas, we seek to bolster these communities with better agriculture, education and healthcare capabilities.

ENERGY, A GLOBAL FUNDAMENTAL RIGHT

Despite India being the world's 5th largest energy producer, nearly a third of its 1.2 billion population does not have access to energy. No access to electricity means no light at night to study by, cell phones cannot be charged and modern agricultural systems cannot be operated. Energy today is a base requirement for almost anything and can therefore be considered a global fundamental right. By applying a social user-centric design approach, we believe that much can be achieved for the 400 million people that are currently still without electricity in India alone. The clean, solar powered energy kits developed by Rural Spark are designed in such a way that they improve the social and economic competitiveness of these 'off-the-grid' communities. With our creative and sustainable solutions, we aim to drive forward progress in the heart of the places that stand to benefit most.

RURAL SPARK ENERGY KIT

Where demands meets supply

To start building the energy networks of the future, Rural Spark has developed the Spark Station. This solar powered micro energy plant gives local energy vendors the capacity to generate, store and trade energy. This energy can then be used for a wide range of applications. Our products will ensure that significantly greater energy mobility can be achieved. These Spark Cubes are also the first major step towards developing smart grids in rural India. These devices makes use of sustainable solar energy and are fitted with 16 USB ports that can power devices such as lights and cell phones. Our Spark Cubes also contain two 12V ports for devices that require additional power, like television sets, air conditioning devices and agricultural equipment.

Additionally, Spark Cubes can also be connected to the Spark Station. These stations intelligently store any unused solar energy, that can be used when there is too little or no energy available.

Side view Rear view

Spark Station

Outputs
16x USB outlet (5V)
2x 12V DC outlet (with switch)

Input
2x input from energy source (12 - 24V)
1x input from grid (18V)

 

Spark Cubes

These modular battery packs store surpluses of energy that can be used to power applications later when no energy is generated.

Capacity: 20Wh, 6Ah LifePO4
Outputs: 2x USB outlet (5V)

 

READ MORE ABOUT OUR SOLUTIONS

HOW THE RURAL SPARK MODEL WORKS

We are in the process of developing a system that allows us to communicate effectively with our customers where surplus energy is available and in turn when energy is required. This data is significant, as it allows vendors to efficiently trade energy using the Spark Cubes. This is the first step towards building smart grids in areas that are now completely isolated from electricity.

ACTIVATING A GROWING NETWORK

of local energy suppliers

As a dynamic organisation of free-spirited, tech-savvy entrepreneurs, we believe in creating strong, self-sustaining communities empowered through smart solutions, modelled on the base-of-the-pyramid philosophy. Our future-proof, scalable, technically sound products give local energy suppliers the tools to set up their own micro energy plants. Offering them the potential to immediately start trading electricity in a way that directly benefits the resilience of the community in which they work.

Since founding the company, we have already set-up partnerships with over a 100 local energy suppliers that provide electricity to 1,500 people on a daily basis. People whose futures have been improved by access to sustainable energy. Agriculture, education, communications as well as healthcare have improved in places that were previously without electricity. If energy was available, it came from harmful and potentially life-threatening fuels like Kerosene. This is why we believe that the success of these local entrepreneurs is testimony that positive steps can be made when you invest in the potential of people and their communities.

READ MORE ABOUT OUR PILOTS

We learned that respect for local cultures and ideas are paramount in doing business in developing areas. We have come to learn things about our products that we ourselves could not have envisioned. We have seen local vendors making sure that schools can power TV’s, hospitals have light to operate by and many more practical applications using our energy products. We even been told that cricket matches have been played at night using lights powered by our systems. The scope of our applications is endless and in all honesty that fills us with a great sense of pride.

READ MORE ABOUT OUR LOCAL ENERGY SUPPLIERS

POWER TO THE PEOPLE

Tackling the societal challenges faced by today's society demands innovation, determination and a new way of doing business, not only more socially aware but also with a greater sense of togetherness. We at Rural Spark feel that the decade ahead will not be coloured by sluggish multinationals, but by young dynamic enterprises that offer elegant solutions to complex problems.

We work from the bottom up, activating our users and collaborating with those who, like us, believe that business can be achieved for the greater good. This is why we decided to use Indiegogo to build a dedicated community of peers. We aim to create a strong global network of supporters who also believe that energy should indeed be a basic right, allowing us to make this world a better place no matter where you were born.

DUTCH INNOVATION AND LOCAL EXPERTISE

Rural Spark was founded in 2011 by three young Dutch people, an engineer, a designer and a business developer. The team has since rapidly grown into an organisation that bridges local expertise with distinctly innovative solutions. Today, Rural Spark is set up as a limited company both in The Netherlands and in India and has people working hard in both countries to create the success we are certain it can be. The Netherlands is home to our creative specialists that are on top of all the technological advances as they happen. In India we have a scalable team of Indian professionals led by two Dutch specialists in the field, one being our founder Evan Mertens, who helps to implement our products where they matter most.

"Energy inspires me. Through my research I learned that we can build smart grids if and when we enable people to share electricity and build intelligent information networks that detail exactly where energy is available. I strongly believe that with the right tools, we can build sustainable, distributed energy grids in rural India."

- Evan Mertens
Co-Founder, C.T.O.

"I love the possibilities that today's innovations bring, but I also realise that there is a strong need to translate our western innovations into workable solutions, that directly benefit the lives of people elsewhere."

- Marcel van Heist
Co-Founder, Design

"If we really want to make a difference in this world, we need to accept that it has to be done by creating sustainable business models based on social entrepreneurship. Rural Spark has embraced this inclusive business model, which ensures the company can continue to fulfil its obligations and potential. Revenue on all levels makes the system self-sustainable and able to constantly improve."

- Harmen van Heist
Co-Founder, C.E.O.

 

PARTNERSHIPS

At Rural Spark we believe in collaboration, both in India and at home. This is why we are thankful to the many partners that believe in us, as we believe in our partners in India. Our ongoing collaboration with our social, research and business partners like Triodus Bank, Stichting DOEN, BOP innovation center, TU Delft, TU Eindhoven, Afdeling Buitengewone Zaken, Royal Dutch Embassy and many others fills us with the confidence to pursue our ambitious goals. Together we believe that we can make a real difference and create a brighter future for the 400 million people in India that today are still without electricity.

WHAT'S NEXT?

Whilst we have already celebrated some great successes over these last few years, we continue to raise the bar and have set ourselves the ambitious task to manufacture and distribute 10,000 new Spark Stations. Last spring, we signed MoU’s with local manufacturers and distribution organisations in India. By the beginning of 2016, we will be ready to rollout our projected 10,000 Rural Spark Energy Kits that will supply 150,000 rural households with electricity. That's access to energy for over 750,00 people. You too can play your part in helping to level the playing field for those born into less fortunate circumstances and excluded by the market. By supporting our campaign you directly contribute to the well-being and socio-economic progress of people in energy deprived areas. Team up with Rural Spark today and join us in ensuring that thousands of people have a brighter tomorrow.

At this point in time we require an investment of 150,000 dollars to meet our direct manufacturing and distribution needs. The local conditions are demanding, which means that the products need to be of the highest possible quality. A large proportion of your contribution will help us to set up the factory facilities to produce an initial 150 energy kits that will provide 1,500 people with electricity. Scaling up to the projected 10,000 kits then becomes easy.

300,000 dollars will allow us to achieve our goal. A proportion of these funds are dedicated to placing more kits in the field, reaching even more households, , whilst the rest goes towards sales and training on the ground, , efficiency improvements and additional services for our customers. We realise that our goals are ambitious but we are equally aware that the matter is pressing for those living without clean, reliable and sustainable energy sources. Reaching these 750.000 people is only the beginning. We would like to thank you in advance for your generous support and invite you to help us lay the foundations for a trustworthy stable smart grid, that has the potential to solve real life problems as well as improving local economic competitiveness. We would like thank you once again for your help and buying into our mission.

REWARDS

 $ 10,-  electricity for one family 

 $ 25,-  Local Energy Supplier

 $ 30,-  Local Energy Supplier

 $ 75,-  Electricy for a village

 $ 750,-  super supporter
 LIMITED, ONLY 5 AVAILABLE 

 $ 3.000,-  Involved supporter
 LIMITED, ONLY 5 AVAILABLE 

Contribute more

If you want to be involved with Rural Spark and contribute in different ways, we love to hear from you! Do you have an idea to help us raise even more money or to expand our community? Contact us and we will work on a special partnership package especially for you.

FAQ

We will contribute to this section as soon as your questions start coming in.

of local energy suppliers
As a dynamic organisation of free-spirited, tech-savvy entrepreneurs, we believe in creating strong, self-sustaining communities empowered through smart solutions, modelled on the base-of-the-pyramid philosophy. Our future-proof, scalable, technically sound products give local energy suppliers the tools to set up their own micro energy plants. Offering them the potential to immediately start trading electricity in a way that directly benefits the resilience of the community in which they work.

Since founding the company, we have already set-up partnerships with over a 100 local energy suppliers that provide electricity to 1,500 people on a daily basis. People whose futures have been improved by access to sustainable energy. Agriculture, education, communications as well as healthcare have improved in places that were previously without electricity. If energy was available, it came from harmful and potentially life-threatening fuels like Kerosene. This is why we believe that the success of these local entrepreneurs is testimony that positive steps can be made when you invest in the potential of people and their communities.

READ MORE ABOUT OUR PILOTS



We learned that respect for local cultures and ideas are paramount in doing business in developing areas. We have come to learn things about our products that we ourselves could not have envisioned. We have seen local vendors making sure that schools can power TV’s, hospitals have light to operate by and many more practical applications using our energy products. We even been told that cricket matches have been played at night using lights powered by our systems. The scope of our applications is endless and in all honesty that fills us with a great sense of pride.

READ MORE ABOUT OUR LOCAL ENERGY SUPPLIERS


POWER TO THE PEOPLE
Tackling the societal challenges faced by today's society demands innovation, determination and a new way of doing business, not only more socially aware but also with a greater sense of togetherness. We at Rural Spark feel that the decade ahead will not be coloured by sluggish multinationals, but by young dynamic enterprises that offer elegant solutions to complex problems.

We work from the bottom up, activating our users and collaborating with those who, like us, believe that business can be achieved for the greater good. This is why we decided to use Indiegogo to build a dedicated community of peers. We aim to create a strong global network of supporters who also believe that energy should indeed be a basic right, allowing us to make this world a better place no matter where you were born.

DUTCH INNOVATION AND LOCAL EXPERTISE
Rural Spark was founded in 2011 by three young Dutch people, an engineer, a designer and a business developer. The team has since rapidly grown into an organisation that bridges local expertise with distinctly innovative solutions. Today, Rural Spark is set up as a limited company both in The Netherlands and in India and has people working hard in both countries to create the success we are certain it can be. The Netherlands is home to our creative specialists that are on top of all the technological advances as they happen. In India we have a scalable team of Indian professionals led by two Dutch specialists in the field, one being our founder Evan Mertens, who helps to implement our products where they matter most.


"Energy inspires me. Through my research I learned that we can build smart grids if and when we enable people to share electricity and build intelligent information networks that detail exactly where energy is available. I strongly believe that with the right tools, we can build sustainable, distributed energy grids in rural India."
	
- Evan Mertens Co-Founder, C.T.O.


"I love the possibilities that today's innovations bring, but I also realise that there is a strong need to translate our western innovations into workable solutions, that directly benefit the lives of people elsewhere."
- Marcel van Heist Co-Founder, Design


"If we really want to make a difference in this world, we need to accept that it has to be done by creating sustainable business models based on social entrepreneurship. Rural Spark has embraced this inclusive business model, which ensures the company can continue to fulfil its obligations and potential. Revenue on all levels makes the system self-sustainable and able to constantly improve."
	
- Harmen van Heist Co-Founder, C.E.O.

 

PARTNERSHIPS
At Rural Spark we believe in collaboration, both in India and at home. This is why we are thankful to the many partners that believe in us, as we believe in our partners in India. Our ongoing collaboration with our social, research and business partners like Triodus Bank, Stichting DOEN, BOP innovation center, TU Delft, TU Eindhoven, Afdeling Buitengewone Zaken, Royal Dutch Embassy and many others fills us with the confidence to pursue our ambitious goals. Together we believe that we can make a real difference and create a brighter future for the 400 million people in India that today are still without electricity.


WHAT'S NEXT?
Whilst we have already celebrated some great successes over these last few years, we continue to raise the bar and have set ourselves the ambitious task to manufacture and distribute 10,000 new Spark Stations. Last spring, we signed MoU’s with local manufacturers and distribution organisations in India. By the beginning of 2016, we will be ready to rollout our projected 10,000 Rural Spark Energy Kits that will supply 150,000 rural households with electricity. That's access to energy for over 750,00 people. You too can play your part in helping to level the playing field for those born into less fortunate circumstances and excluded by the market. By supporting our campaign you directly contribute to the well-being and socio-economic progress of people in energy deprived areas. Team up with Rural Spark today and join us in ensuring that thousands of people have a brighter tomorrow.
At this point in time we require an investment of 150,000 dollars to meet our direct manufacturing and distribution needs. The local conditions are demanding, which means that the products need to be of the highest possible quality. A large proportion of your contribution will help us to set up the factory facilities to produce an initial 150 energy kits that will provide 1,500 people with electricity. Scaling up to the projected 10,000 kits then becomes easy.

300,000 dollars will allow us to achieve our goal. A proportion of these funds are dedicated to placing more kits in the field, reaching even more households, , whilst the rest goes towards sales and training on the ground, , efficiency improvements and additional services for our customers. We realise that our goals are ambitious but we are equally aware that the matter is pressing for those living without clean, reliable and sustainable energy sources. Reaching these 750.000 people is only the beginning. We would like to thank you in advance for your generous support and invite you to help us lay the foundations for a trustworthy stable smart grid, that has the potential to solve real life problems as well as improving local economic competitiveness. We would like thank you once again for your help and buying into our mission.

REWARDS


 $ 10,-  electricity for one family 





 $ 25,-  Local Energy Supplier





 $ 30,-  Local Energy Supplier





 $ 75,-  Electricy for a village





 $ 750,-  super supporter  LIMITED, ONLY 5 AVAILABLE 



 $ 3.000,-  Involved supporter  LIMITED, ONLY 5 AVAILABLE 


Contribute more

If you want to be involved with Rural Spark and contribute in different ways, we love to hear from you! Do you have an idea to help us raise even more money or to expand our community? Contact us and we will work on a special partnership package especially for you.

FAQ
We will contribute to this section as soon as your questions start coming in.

story:
TheChandlery.com

The Chandlery | Florida

We hatched a plan to incorporate a cafe while experiencing the fun of shopping at the candle shop.  We have been in business as a candle shop and won Florida's Retailer of the year for the state of Florida in 2014 so we feel pretty comfortable with bringing an awesome retail experience.  
We have just secured a bigger space at 1300 Prospect Ave by the river and Riverview Park .  OUR PLAN is to bring an awesome cafe/retail experience together as a destination location and to expand the Historic Downtown Melbourne area. The City is also planning a vitalization of the 15 acre park and river front area as well.
Your contributions will help us achieve the ability to host daily events such as a Senior Scene, Florida Tech Friday Nights, Candle Making Classes, Chalk Painting Classes our our PWAP (Parties With A Purpose) which is a fundraising party for various local non-profits.


What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is to raise $3,000 to help facilitate the opening of the cafe.  We hope to bring enjoyment and food to our customers.  Any amount that you can contribute to the design and build-out of the Chandlery & Cafe would be greatly appreciated.

Hate crowdfunding projects that give you nothing in return? This isn't one of them...

  • Tired of donating $50-100 and getting a coozie?  No more of that.  
  • FOR EVERY $1 YOU DONATE YOU WILL RECEIVE A $2 FOOD CREDIT ONCE WE OPEN.  DONATE $100, GET $200 CREDIT.
  • It goes without saying, if you are willing to donate you will be forever in our thoughts and that will always reflect in your checks when you dine with us even after your food credit runs out.  

The Impact

At the very minimum you will be helping with job creation in a town that is constantly feeling the flux of employment solely based on the space program and government funding.  Secondary support to farmers, ranchers and fisherman in the state of Florida as we plan on working in direct contact with the meat and dairy we source.  Lastly you will help us, your friends, which means the world to us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially?  Want to help some other ways?  Of course!!!  We need help in a myriad of areas.  If you can help us with any of the following please get in touch!

  • Marketing
  • Website work - help me make something look good that I'm not good at!!! 
  • Carpentry - Want to help do general labor?  We are more than willing to pay half cash and half food credits at a great rate if you know how to swing a hammer
  • Electrical work - same deal as carpenters
  • Painting/cleaning/general volunteer labor.  Pizza/beer/food credit every day.
  • Salvage scrounging (we are looking for cool old antiques and salvage to make decor with)

Thank you!

We obviously couldn't do this without you.  Your giving or your support.  From the bottom of our hearts, thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Around two years ago I had the passion and ambition to shape ambitious students into consciousness startups with Can-Do Productions. I made a community added lots of friends in it and asked each of them to post about their passion and talents.

I hoped to see lots of posts, but it wasn't that easy. I came to realize that my Dutch friends are scared to post about what they are building, making, doing. Something was missing here: A sharing culture - from sharing ideas to co-creating new startups together, this only happened inside schools and not very regularly. People do school projects and get their grades and a friend told me that University students are 6% entrepreneurial. So only 6% would either start to live their own lives and the rest would work for a boss after study.

I felt sorry for those, the problem mainly was that they weren't conscious enough about WHO they ARE and WHAT they WOULD like to MEAN to the WORLD. A system that pushes them into a job that are currently wiped out by our emerging technologies wasn't either going to help them find success or happiness in their lives so I thought about becoming a personal coach for fellow students in finding out WHY they are here, WHAT they could mean to society and HOW to do so.

I started a blog FOR and BY young entrepreneurs within the Netherlands, interviewed most ambitious young entrepreneurs here about their WHY and kept trendwatching with Can-Do Productions to show people WHAT is possible with emerging technology and trends. With my own experience and those from others who joined our blog, (from interviews, visiting events, joining startup competitions) I surrounded myself with like-minded individuals. Most of them were 10-30 years older - they knew already what they wanted to fulfill in live, but most of them came to realize that after a career until at least their 30's.

Way to late if you ask me, because then most people start to settle, and how can you make impact in the world if you have people waiting for you at home? Well that is pretty hard if you aim internationally instead of locally.

I setup a young activism foundation called RUUW to create entrepreneurship in my own town. Our first event attracted 160 individuals between 15-35 and we are currently setting up 3-4 events a year to create community entrepreneurship to brand the local environment and keep young ambitious people here to organise awesome things together.

I became the most active Young Creator in the online Young Creators community and helped out with 1000s of questions that were asked in this national young entrepreneurs community and grow the community from 500 members to 6300 nowadays.

I wrote a winning essay about the future of co-creation and crowdsourcing with the aim of running countries by crowdsourcing with inhabitants and got invited to present it on the EACA/EDCOM conference. A conference where European Universities compete with each other to solve European issues with research and governmental marketing campaigns to be spread out around Europe by the European Commission.

I became more and more passionate about the Startup climate and got invited to start blogging for Startup Grind (the biggest Startup channel with over 215k readers). Still I had the urge to change something bigger than just helping single startups further. therefore I wrote a business plan for reforming education and saw different like-minded people startup their own schools based on personalised and purpose learning. Since my school had elements in it that included businesses the law was not open for it kickstart my business plan into a real school last year so I started organising the first international Education Hackathon with a blend of (education) experts, students, webdevelopers, webdesigners and creatives, over 20 partners and sponsors were happy to help out in needs but all without asking for money, I wanted their expertise and resources where they had enough from. Last weekend I co-organised this hackathon with Operation Education - those who I have worked together with to write the business plan and help people with all the essentials to start a new school and the hackathon turned out to be a big success.

With solutions that can disrupt the full education industry as it is nowadays by a totally new layer of personalization: BioClock personalised schedules, Diagnosing ADD & ADHD with an App for free, Personalised extra curriculum tasks for ambitious students, Spotify for peer2peer reviewed learning materials and a book swapping platform for exchanging summaries, e-books, books and in the meantime reviewing it per chapter by lecturer and student. Also they found a way to end the need of Grades by changing it towards being able to put knowledge into practise.

As we are combining these prototype solutions now with new and old schools my next adventure - something I have been working on for nearly 8 month is the Changemaker Summit (check it out!) Where I combined changemakers knowledge around the world with the Education hackathon online via Google Hangouts I would now love to create a bond with this community that I have been working on from the start with Tara Byrne, the New York founder of the Changemakers community, currently accounting for more than 1000 changemakers around the globe mainly based in the US.


My only issue to do so is the cost issue, since I have organised everything without money all my life I haven't got the financial resources to buy a flight ticket and pay for the accommodation in San Francisco and therefore I ask you for your help.

Today this financial needs would cost me around 1600 euro for a flight to be in San Francisco and meetup with my fellow Under30changemakers for around a week, although prices go up every day I expect to need around 2000 euro for the flight to San Fransisco from Amsterdam and back in another ten days when the campaign is finished.

Including accommodation for 11 days (1 August - 12 August) this costs me an extra 1100 euro, looking at average prices of Airbnb housings.

This brings a total of 2000+ 1100 = 3100 euro for my trip, in which if I run short I will eat from cans and live on a bench in the park (I don't have such a high living standard).

The Impact

To sum up the impact this trip can have:

  • I want to change the way young people see the world and act towards tackling worlds' toughest problems, not only regionally but also internationally.
  • I want to organize a changemaker summit afterwards and need to collect feedback from this first internationally summit to start an under 30 changemaker chapter here in Europe
  • I will help out local non-profit entrepreneurs in San Fransisco with the hackathon part and will connect our Dutch community with the US community
  • Every extra money will go to the organisation of the next Changemakers summit in Europe

Risks & Challenges

The only risk you have is that I get sick and have to cancel the flight and accommodation. This would result in:

  • Sending the money back or using it to organise elements of the Summit here in Europe
  • See how I can promote or help out your business/problems with the skills I have taught in my experience in startup coaching.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Your share can be of immense value!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word, and back my Thunderclap campaign to help spreading the word. The Thunderclap Campaign runs until the 10th of July just before the campaign ends, so please don't wait and support me, it just takes 5 seconds to do so :)

story:
NOOKS is shy. It likes to hide in corner. NOOKS is an object that leave to the center of the room, but designed for the corners or edges. Please follow us to the NOOKS Clock.


NOOKS Clock is formed by a foldable PVC plastic sheet:



How does it work?

  PST

Attach the Removable Damage Free Mounting Tape

 

 

 

 

 


NOOKS CLOCK

The minimalist style clock can be filled completely to the bedroom or living room.

 


NOOKS mounted at the corner of the room which have the best viewing angle 


Product Dimension

Packaging Size

Timeline

Risks and Challenges

Manufacturing: Numerous prototypes have been developed and countless hours have been spent refining the NOOKS. Manufacturers are ready to proceed and are awaiting orders. Being able to work closely with the manufacturers allows me to strictly monitor quality control. However when manufacturing any physical goods there are sure to be unforeseen challenges, both big and small. We promise to be open and transparent in our communications in timing and design changes.

Packaging: The product will be packaged in Hong Kong. This will allow me to inspect each product individually to ensure the best possible quality. Our team will personally handle all packaging and logistics. This means that you can communicate directly with me and the team without anyone in between.

Deliveries: If the project becomes hugely successful, delivery times may have to be extended to compensate for larger order volume and production runs. Thus we are setting up an in-house logistics team which will be focusing on delivery. We will do our best job to deliver the excitement to you on time, in both a reliable and cost-effective way.

Behind NOOKS

Kan Chau was born in Hong Kong who has been worked in the field of industrial design since 2001, for client including Coca Cola, Black & Decker, Whirlpool and Quicksilver Sport. In 2009, he was pursuing a master's degree of design at The Hong Kong Polytechnic University. In 2010, Kan started NOOKS as a platform to share his design perspective.

I am incredibly proud of what I have achieved, and would like to share my passion with all of you. With your support, you will help me meet minimum order volumes required by the manufacturers and handover the tooling costs, packaging and shipping. I truly appreciate your support and looking forward to turn the NOOKS clock into reality.

THANK YOU!

story:
Lowside all began with an idea for a magazine about five years ago. We realized that there were no high-quality publications that catered to the East Coast Garage-Built Motorcycle Community, so we began printing Lowside Magazine to feature the custom work of the talented builders on the East Coast. The magazine really took off and now we feature custom and vintage bikes from around the world. We have subscribers across the globe and have shipped over 50,000 issues. In addition to direct sales, Lowside Magazine is sold in small bookstores, tattoo shops, motorcycle shops, and many online retailers. Through Lowside Magazine we have connected with a huge network of people from many walks of life who are passionate about motorcycles—all styles, makes, and models.

For two years we looked for a space that could be used as Lowside Magazine headquarters, but we could not find anything within our budget. Eventually we found a great space in the up-and-coming neighborhood of Remington in Baltimore City, but it was way out of our budget. That’s when the idea hit us. Why not also open a garage that caters to the garage built and vintage bike enthusiast? The facility we found was perfect. The space offered us a place where we could open a 2,000 square foot retail storefront as well as a 4,000 square foot garage for service work, painting and fabrication. Just behind the main shop on our campus is an 8,000 square foot warehouse. We took a major gamble and signed the lease. With all of our savings, we made extensive renovations, bought inventory and in August of 2014 we officially opened a motorcycle shop, 515 MOTO.


The reception in the community has been great. There are no other motorcycle shops in Baltimore City that work on all makes and models of bikes, and the dealers won’t touch a bike that is over 10 years old, in fact, they are now referring their customers to us.  Sales in the store are steady, and the shop is packed with bikes awaiting service. We've hired four mechanics on staff, two painters, two fabricators and two employees in the store.

We even have a pretty cool gallery in the shop where we display, promote and sell the work of local and international artists.


Remember that 8,000 square foot warehouse we mentioned? Well, we decided to put it to good use... The problem with vintage bikes is that nobody wants to work on them, so in many cases you need to figure out for yourself how to perform basic motorcycle maintenance and make repairs. In addition to tools and knowledge to do so, you also need a workspace and homes with a garage in Baltimore City are rare.


We know how hard it was for us to find a garage space, and here we were faced with more space than we could ever use. We decided to open the space up for anyone who wanted to work on their bike and created the Lowside Garage. For a small monthly fee a member has 24/7 access to the garage and a 10’ x 10’ spot where they can store their tools and parts, can do complete builds and restorations, regular maintenance, or just share ideas and knowledge with the other garage members.


We currently have close to 50 members in the Lowside Garage, with more waiting for a spot to open up. Each member has their own story, their own project and each one is different. In one bay with have a generational project underway. Three generations of one family come together every weekend to restore a '78 Triumph Bonneville. It's a site to behold, grandfather, father and son building something together, making memories that will last a lifetime. Next to them we have a Rastafarian building a Harley generator shovelhead trike, on the other side a business executive restoring a classic VFR 500 back to pristine condition. We have a tattoo artist who comes in late at night to chop apart his perfectly fine Sportster to make something his own, and an IT Specialist who is the first one there every Saturday morning to work on his Vintage Honda Race bikes. We have a team of engineers that share a bay as they build a Honda Café Racer, and a fire inspector that just moved out after finishing a complete tear down and restoration of a 1979 CX500.

There are interesting stories like that all around the garage, people from all walks of life in one place, drawn together by the opportunity that Lowside Garage offers. As in many cities, garage space is at a premium or nonexistent. That is certainly the case in Baltimore. The Lowside Garage provides a space for these stories to unfold, and in many cases saves a junker from the scrap yard and breathes new life into a once treasured bike.

In addition to providing workspaces for our members, we also offer classes to anyone that is interested. We open the Lowside Garage to the community and host classes ranging from basic motorcycle maintenance, introduction to welding and carburetor repair, with more classes planned for the future. Our hope is to instill in people that necessary D.I.Y. attitude and understanding of the mechanics of a bike that you should have when you own a motorcycle.

This endeavor started without any investors, and we are really proud of the work that we have done with very little money, but we need to make some major facility improvements and updates to better serve our members and customers. Furthermore, we need to upgrade our current tools and workstations and expand our inventory to meet the demands of our diverse customer base. Despite the many revenue streams, much of our work has been a labor of love and we need investors in order to truly get both the 515 Moto Shop and the Lowside Garage up and running and sustainable well into the future.

So where will your money go?
We have three areas that need improvement in order to operate a profitable small business and live the American Dream.

  1. To Truly make the Lowside Garage a Community Garage we need to make some major improvements. The Lowside Garage is not a profit center, we sponsor it as a way to give back to the community of riders where guys and girls, young and old can do something that for many seems unreachable, build their own bike. Restore that rusty old clunker that’s been in your dad’s shed for as long as you can remember or build that chopper you have dreamed of since the first time you saw Easy Rider. Our mechanics and fabricators routinely donate their time to help all members out, whether through a bit of advice, or actual hands on work, but we’d like to do more and need a little bit of help to truly make the Lowside Garage a place to build something awesome.
    • We need to offer improved security to our members and plan to do so through a key card access system, which can be monitored remotely, and upgraded video surveillance system. An amazing thing about the community space is that in a little over a year of operation, we have not had a single incident of theft, destruction or malice reported by any member. However, with the recent unrest in Baltimore City, we would like to ensure that anyone using the garage is in a safe environment at all times.

    • It’s cold back there. It’s a warehouse after all, with cinder block walls and a concrete floor. We would like to upgrade the old oil furnace into a more efficient heating system so that members can work in a more comfortable environment through the winter months when the majority of members are working on their bikes.

    • We want to open the doors to everyone and teach more classes in the garage to the local motorcycle community. To do so properly, we need to establish a classroom area and separate it from the members private spaces. We need to build walls and provide a safe environment for the students to work in. Additionally, we need to upgrade the power of the building and purchase tools and supplies for the classes such as welders, welding gear and consumables, fabrication tools such as plasma cutters, grinders, mills, lathes, finishing equipment such as respirators, exhaust fans and safety and protective gear, including face masks, ear protection, eye wash stations, explosion proof cabinets and used chemical receptacles.

    • We would like to better segment each workspace into a more defined area by building knee walls throughout the complex. This will allow us to have a more controlled and organized environment as well as expand the available spaces so that members of the community may become a part of the garage.

  2.  In order to offer our customers the best experience in the retail shop, we will take your investment and put it right back into the motorcycle community by increasing our inventory. We believe in supporting good old American workers. There are hundreds of craftsmen in this country, creating unique motorcycle parts that we would love to carry as part of our everyday inventory.

    • We will use your investment to purchase directly from the source and stock our showroom with American Made parts, apparel and accessories. As much as we would love to have everything in our shop come from small American Manufactures, the truth of that matter that is not entirely feasible if we want to offer an abundance of parts for all makes and models. In those instances, we will buy stock for the store from our established dealer accounts.

    • Once we have fully established the 515 Moto retail store, we plan to expand our offerings beyond just Baltimore and fully develop an eCommerce website to offer an alternative source for motorcycle parts on the web. Your investment will help us in this endeavor through the purchase of inventory, computers and shipping equipment.

    • Finally, we will need to purchase a dealer’s license and bonded insurance in order to become Baltimore’s only marketplace for vintage and used motorcycles where members and customers can buy, sell, or trade.

  3. With your investment we will grow the business to a sustainable level by upgrading our power and purchasing tools to increase efficiency and safety in the shop. We started with very little beyond our own private collection of tools and lifts. Though they have served us well, we need to purchase more. We currently have three workstations set up for motorcycle service work, but have room to grow. And our work list demands it. We have the customers, and we have the space. We just need more resources to keep up with the demand. Your investment will allow us to set up additional work spaces by purchasing motorcycle lifts and hiring more mechanics. We also need to upgrade our electricity to three phase industrial power and purchase additional tools in order to really get our fabrication plans off the ground.

    Even if you are not a motorcycle enthusiast, we hope that you can see the value of having a shop like ours in your community. We hire locals and support our community. As a small business, we make every effort available to source our parts and products from the neighborhood so that as much money as possible stays within the community. When viable, we purchase hardware from the locally owned shop up the street, send our apparel orders to the local screen printer around the corner, and after a hard day of honest work, we patronize the local shops, restaurants and pubs in our neighborhood.

We need all the help that we can get from the Motorcycle Community. We hope that our track record of producing top notch content for our publications and performing top notch service for our customers in the Baltimore Area has demonstrated our commitment to the community that we love and are a part of. As a way of saying thanks for the amazing support over the years, we have put together some pretty cool perks to entice you help us on our journey.

If we reach our goal, the name of everyone who supports our endeavor will appear printed in a future issue of Lowside Magazine and will be posted for eternity on the wall of Lowside Garage as a benefactor.

Every little bit helps. The Motorcycle Community knows that more then most. Ever run out of gas on the side of the road? Chopper broke down on the Gypsy Run? We're the kind of guys that stop and offer a hand. It's in our nature. Think of your donation as a way of ensuring that we'll always be there to stop and lend a hand. So go ahead, make a fist and gently press it to the screen. We hope to do it in person one day.

A pretty sick t-shirt. Another pretty sick Black t-shirt to go in your drawer of sick black t-shirts. "Do you really need another black t-shirt (in your wife's/girlfriend's best voice) To us, a black tee is the sign of a working man. You have a few white tees, but they have oil and grease stains all over them so they are buried in the back of your drawer or have become rags for the shop. The black ones have their stains too, but they're almost invisible. The design produced for our campaign will be limited edition, and only available here. Every time you dig through you drawer of black t-shirts and come across this one, you'll know that you helped an independent motorcycle shop truly get off the ground and make a difference.

A Pretty Fly Magazine. We put out one hell of a magazine, and it sells well, but producing content and printing isn't cheap. Lowside Magazine alone cannot support the goals and ambitions of 515 Moto and Lowside Garage. That is why we are asking for your help here. As a perk you'll be added to our subscriber list and with the printing of each issue, we'll throw a copy in the mail especially for you. Each issue has over 100 pages of the finest vintage and custom garage built choppers, trackers, bobbers, café racers, race bikes and just about anything insanely cool on two wheels.

A piece of Art in your life. An original illustration ready to frame and decorate your man cave, workshop or guest bathroom. Based on the photograph of Jason Sheets'  Born Free 6 Panhead by Magic Ken that graced the cover of Lowside Issue #15. Art by Eric Wheatley of Lowside Mag/515 Moto/Lowside Garage. Limited edition, signed and numbered, 3 color screen print on White 100# French Paper.

If there was an award for being an awesome person, we'd give it to you for buying this package. We're going to pull out all the stops to make sure that this package is worth your investment. We're going to design a couple of awesome t-shirts, and print them on high quality tees. We'll throw in a nice limited edition poster to hang on your wall and pack the box with other goodies as well. Hats, key chains, stickers, beer koozies, whatever we can fit. Thanks for being awesome.

There's something about buying American-made motorcycle parts that puts a smile on our faces knowing that a good soul was in his shop, late at night after a hard days work, producing something custom for me. No pair is identical. A computer didn't bend these bars. Bruce did. Ken did. Both good, honest men. They'll make you a set by hand. To your specs. Your contribution will help us update some of our tools and increase our capabilities so that we can produce more parts. Right here in Baltimore, in the Good'ol USA.

Your helmet, custom painted by a master painter. We're lucky to have moved into a facility with a fully functioning paint spray booth, even luckier than that was when we partnered with Jeff Yarrington. Jeff has been painting cars and motorcycles for over 30 years and knows his way around a spray gun better then most. The examples above are more than is offered with this perk, but we wanted to show the depth of his creativity. The one on the left matches the Street Fighter Ninja we are finishing up and has electroluminescent panels embedded in the helmet that light up using a simple battery pack. The one on the right is real special, and is a technology that we are working on perfecting and bringing to the market at an affordable price. Using a sprayable electroluminescent coating, we have been able to completely illuminate the helmet.

Dropped your bike? Or is it just really, really ugly? Well, how about a new paint job? We'll break it down to the frame and paint it how you like it. You pick the colors and the style, and we'll turn that rough old project bike into a beautiful piece of art.


A full on custom bike built just for you. If you've always wanted a custom bike, but don't have the patience or space to build one, well this is your shot to have one built from the ground up to your specs. Tracker? Café Racer? Chopper? Bobber? Street Fighter? The choices are endless, though some exclusions do apply.  Obviously we can't source and restore a 1936 Knucklehead or a 1948 Indian Chief. Check out some of the amazing one of kind bikes that Jeff has built. We'll build you a bike that fits your individual style. Before purchasing this perk, please give us a call at the shop to discuss 1-800-974-4807.

So there you have it. There's our pitch. We love motorcycles...and Baltimore. That's why we're building here in Charm City. We hope that you can see the value in having a business like this in the community. With all the negative press that Baltimore has received lately, we're still committed to this land of Pleasant Living. We won't save the world, but we can make our little part of the world a better place.  
Thanks for listening and wish us luck! Please help us futher by promoting the campaign on your social network, blog and by telling your friends the good ol' fashioned way, in person.

Double Rainbow from when we first moved in for Good Luck.
story_txt:
Lowside all began with an idea for a magazine about five years ago. We realized that there were no high-quality publications that catered to the East Coast Garage-Built Motorcycle Community, so we began printing Lowside Magazine to feature the custom work of the talented builders on the East Coast. The magazine really took off and now we feature custom and vintage bikes from around the world. We have subscribers across the globe and have shipped over 50,000 issues. In addition to direct sales, Lowside Magazine is sold in small bookstores, tattoo shops, motorcycle shops, and many online retailers. Through Lowside Magazine we have connected with a huge network of people from many walks of life who are passionate about motorcycles—all styles, makes, and models. 
For two years we looked for a space that could be used as Lowside Magazine headquarters, but we could not find anything within our budget. Eventually we found a great space in the up-and-coming neighborhood of Remington in Baltimore City, but it was way out of our budget. That’s when the idea hit us. Why not also open a garage that caters to the garage built and vintage bike enthusiast? The facility we found was perfect. The space offered us a place where we could open a 2,000 square foot retail storefront as well as a 4,000 square foot garage for service work, painting and fabrication. Just behind the main shop on our campus is an 8,000 square foot warehouse. We took a major gamble and signed the lease. With all of our savings, we made extensive renovations, bought inventory and in August of 2014 we officially opened a motorcycle shop, 515 MOTO.The reception in the community has been great. There are no other motorcycle shops in Baltimore City that work on all makes and models of bikes, and the dealers won’t touch a bike that is over 10 years old, in fact, they are now referring their customers to us.  Sales in the store are steady, and the shop is packed with bikes awaiting service. We've hired four mechanics on staff, two painters, two fabricators and two employees in the store.We even have a pretty cool gallery in the shop where we display, promote and sell the work of local and international artists.Remember that 8,000 square foot warehouse we mentioned? story:
Short Summary

As The Founder of the Village, I believe there is more to life than work and the rat race and even if we were to win the rat race....we will still be a Rat....Not to say that rats are not great Living Beings as well!! 

However I believe let Humans be Humans and Rats be Rats...Life is much more fun when there is Diversity.

Having come from a broken family and traveled in many countries and spent most of my life in UK with a "High Achieving Corporate Career", life was still not fulfilling , even tho my Career was what some people could only dream of. The Material world still left a huge spiritual hole in my soul and my heart yearned for more. So as a result I started my soul searching journey and 14 years later the idea of " The FIG TREE SANCTUARY and HEALING VILLAGE" was born . A place where we can all re-treat to, where any of us can come to de-stress, rejuvenate, energize, heal, find peace n harmony, have fun  as a holiday retreat or for a life time......a SANCTUARY.

Your Financial Contribution will allow us to buy land and space globally to start building and manifesting YOUR SANCTUARY.


What We Need & What You Get

  

  • Ideally looking to raise at least 100, 000 pounds now, this would buy enough land to start building the Village at lake Bunyonyi, SW Uganda and In Zanzibar, Tanzania and also set up the Admin and Management Office in London, UK
  • For every 50 pounds you donate we will give you a Poetry n Music CD , Naturally Divine Products and a short holiday at Lake Bunyonyi  Resorts. The more you donate, the more you get.
  • All contribution will be going towards building THE FIG TREE SANCTUARY and HEALING Village.

The Impact

  • Your Contribution will allow people who can not afford retreats and a place of sanctuary to have one for FREE,  open to all globally, a SANCTUARY for every one who needs it. It will also be a place for ANIMALS and endangered plant species that need a sanctuary and a home.
  • The FIG TREE Sanctuary and Healing VILLAGE has already been tested and proofed on land that was borrowed to us by extended family for a while at Lake Bunyonyi. We proved that " The FIG TREE Sanctuary and Healing Village" was a positive, healing and empowering space for the extended community locally and visitors globally, who were invited to stay for free through Couch Surfing.
  • Please visit the photo gallery on www.thefigtreesanctuaryandhealingvillage.com to see the POSITIVE impact the TEST PILOT site was.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge is securing as much land as possible across the globe. We have already tested and proved that such a space is required and has very positive impact to the  local and global community.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word out and make some noise about your SANCTUARY campaign.
  • Use  Indiegogo share tools!
  • VOLUNTEER!!

And that's all there is to it.

Having come from a broken family and traveled in many countries and spent most of my life in UK with a "High Achieving Corporate Career", life was still not fulfilling , even tho my Career was what some people could only dream of. The Material world still left a huge spiritual hole in my soul and my heart yearned for more. So as a result I started my soul searching journey and 14 years later the idea of " The FIG TREE SANCTUARY and HEALING VILLAGE" was born . A place where we can all re-treat to, where any of us can come to de-stress, rejuvenate, energize, heal, find peace n harmony, have fun  as a holiday retreat or for a life time......a SANCTUARY.
Your Financial Contribution will allow us to buy land and space globally to start building and manifesting YOUR SANCTUARY.
   What We Need & What You Get     Ideally looking to raise at least 100, 000 pounds now, this would buy enough land to start building the Village at lake Bunyonyi, SW Uganda and In Zanzibar, Tanzania and also set up the Admin and Management Office in London, UK For every 50 pounds you donate we will give you a Poetry n Music CD , Naturally Divine Products and a short holiday at Lake Bunyonyi  Resorts. The more you donate, the more you get. All contribution will be going towards building THE FIG TREE SANCTUARY and HEALING Village.    The Impact 
Your Contribution will allow people who can not afford retreats and a place of sanctuary to have one for FREE,  open to all globally, a SANCTUARY for every one who needs it. It will also be a place for ANIMALS and endangered plant species that need a sanctuary and a home. The FIG TREE Sanctuary and Healing VILLAGE has already been tested and proofed on land that was borrowed to us by extended family for a while at Lake Bunyonyi. We proved that " The FIG TREE Sanctuary and Healing Village" was a positive, healing and empowering space for the extended community locally and visitors globally, who were invited to stay for free through Couch Surfing. Please visit the photo gallery on www.thefigtreesanctuaryandhealingvillage.com to see the POSITIVE impact the TEST PILOT site was.    Risks & Challenges  The main challenge is securing as much land as possible across the globe. We have already tested and proved that such a space is required and has very positive impact to the  local and global community.   Other Ways You Can Help 
Please spread the word out and make some noise about your SANCTUARY campaign. Use  Indiegogo share tools!
VOLUNTEER!!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
About Academy of Friends: 

Academy of Friends (AOF) was founded in 1980 as a small, private Academy Awards® night party shared by 25 friends over a little food, champagne and Hollywood glamour. This annual gathering soon formalized itself into a gala with the mission of raising revenue and awareness of the scourge of HIV and AIDS affecting the greater San Francisco community. During the ensuing 35 years, Academy of Friends continues Celebrating Life and Empowering Hope.

What We Need & What You Get

At AOF’s centerpiece, individual and corporate sponsors are the framework of AOF’s ability to raise funds. Ongoing support is needed to help make a difference! 
  • Individual and Corporate Sponsorships
         >  Sponsorships start at $350 and include a ticket (or tickets) to the gala and recognition in our program materials, social media, and website for an entire year. 
         > Donations in any amount are appreciated and are 100% tax-deductible.

Why you should give

Help us provide a vehicle for local bay area organization to raise awareness about their specialized services for HIV/AIDS:

  • HIV Prevention - through education, outreach and awareness
  • Legal and counseling services and job training programs
  • Youth outreach
  • Food and meal programs
  • Suicide prevention
  • Community awareness and communications

Challenges

It has been more difficult to find corporate support as people living with HIV are surviving longer and are under the radar of many programs. 

  • There is no cure for HIV.
  • Government funding and most grants are restricted to specific purposes and uses. The monies raised by AOF are unrestricted and help fill in the gaps.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us raise awareness about the good work our beneficiary partners are doing by sharing with your friends, co-workers and company management:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share via Facebook, Twitter and email.

THANKS!!!
