story:
50% off for all campaign supporters.

After you make a contribution you'll receive a discount code from us which will give you a 50% discount in our online shop. That way you can get some Crazy Bastard Sauce at a great price while you wait for your reward to be shipped.


What is Crazy Bastard Sauce?

We make hot sauce without added sugar, without chili extract, without artificial ingredients and using only the highest quality fresh ingredients. 
It's been a good year so far. We've made a lot of hot sauce. We've been stocked by over 20 retailers across Europe, reviewed and approved by some of the best chili bloggers in the business, and we've won two international awards, including a world champion title at the World Hot Sauce Awards.

We're delighted with all of this, but it means we need to grow. Crazy Bastard Sauce needs a home. We can't keep up with demand unless we set up our own production kitchen, and we need your help to do that.

So far we've been renting kitchens by the day, but their lack of storage and special equipment is really holding us back. We can't have ingredients delivered to someone else's kitchen so we have to pick them up ourselves, which takes up a lot of time that could be spent cooking sauce.

We've found a place that we think will be perfect, but it needs a lot of work. With your help we plan to install a production kitchen, a shop, a storeroom and workshop. A place where we can cook, create and experiment, and also where we can learn with others and share what we've already learned.

What's the Money for?

Apart from the cost of the renovation, there are the costs of installing the kitchen equipment. Second hand equipment will work just fine in most cases, but it's still going to cost more than we have. From the ovens needed to roast the chilis and the huge pot we cook the sauce in, to the refrigeration, storage units and wash basins every kitchen needs. All this will cost about €20,000 and you can see a breakdown of those costs here. If we get about 60% of that we can cover the rest ourselves. If we get more we could get other equipment that will allow us to develop other quality products like fresh salsas and other spicy treats.

Why should you contribute?

It's incredible how many strange and unnatural ingredients can be found in food these days. There is no reason for this except to make low quality products seem better. Most sauces contain Xanthan Gum to stabilise and thicken them, most packaged salt contains Ferrocyanide to stop it from clumping together, and most processed food contains refined sugar to cover the taste of low quality produce and to appeal to our natural love for all things sweet. The way we see it, don't make watery sauce in the first place that needs to be thickened and just shake the bottle if it separates, use a salt mill to grind unprocessed sea salt crystals, and take advantage of the natural sugars already present in all fruit and veg. 

Your support not only helps a small business get off the ground, it supports a level of quality which needs to be observed more often in the foods we eat today.

What do you get in return?

Apart from our undying gratitude, we would like to thank you for your support the best way we can: by making your mouth burn and your tastebuds sing. Our sauces are available in different quantities in every reward level, along with some exclusive merchandise which marks you out as a true Crazy Bastard. There's also some limited release hot sauce editions including the Berlin Reserve, which is made entirely of organic produce grown in and around the beautiful city we live in. The Private Reserve includes exotic ingredients that would be too expensive to use in any normal batch of sauce. The chili infused vodka is something that we occasionally experiment with to try flavour combinations (The Jalapeño & Date vodka is amazing). 

The top reward is a box of sauce that has been specially designed in collaboration with you. Want to try a hot sauce with ghost peppers and whiskey? We can do that. We'll make it exactly as hot as you want it to be. We'll even design the label for you. Maybe you want to name it after your dog or your restaurant... Jon will hand illustrate a great logo that you'll love and have all the labels printed. It will be just like a sauce you might find in your favourite hot sauce shop, but made specially for you. And there's 50 of them so you can hand them out to your friends (or enemies).

Have a browse through the perks on offer, there's something for everyone in there.

How else can you help?

You can also do us a huge favour by spreading the word about this campaign. Do you know someone in your life who loves spicy food? Do them a good deed and introduce them to Crazy Bastard. They will thank you. Use the tools the internet gave us to tag, share, tweet and post about this crowd funder to anyone and everyone you can before the time runs out.

FAQs

Why are we using US Dollars? 
Because it's the only currency option which allows payment by credit card on the Indiegogo platform. The Euro price in the description is correct as of 8. August 2015.

When will the rewards be sent? 
We're going to get all the packages out as soon as we can, but the time immediately after the campaign will probably be a bit chaotic, and depending on how many contributions we have it might take a few weeks to get organised. To ease the process we may send some rewards out before the end of the campaign.

When will the rewards be sent?  We're going to get all the packages out as soon as we can, but the time immediately after the campaign will probably be a bit chaotic, and depending on how many contributions we have it might take a few weeks to get organised. To ease the process we may send some rewards out before the end of the campaign.

story:
My Enterpride is the world’s first socially conscious business ecosystem.

It's an ecosystem because it has the tools to follow your entire business process from idea, to validating your idea, getting it developed and getting it out there all in one place. 

A startling fact is that half of all new businesses will fail within the first 5 years. Startling because small businesses account for 50% of the global added value, provide two out of every three jobs and are more likely to adopt socially responsible practices. So if anyone has what it takes to make real global change its small business owners.

It is just as shocking that 3.1 million children will die of hunger this year. Tweet: Something is broken with a world where $1.00 would feed a child for a week, yet 17.000 children die each day due to hunger. @MyEnterpride

By connecting the two, My Enterpride gives your business valuable tools to validate your ideas, get advice, fund, build, market, grow business, and make a global social impact just by using the tools. That’s because we take 20% of our earnings from subscriptions and donate them to UNICEF and World Food Programme, both recognised high impact United Nations organisations.

You can also find us here:

Exactly how does it work

At the heart is a forum based social network where you can get input on ideas, get advice from the community about anything related to business. This very same community can back your project with funding, help build it by offering their freelance expertise and buy your services or products. All in one place.

It starts with an idea

So you have a great business idea, but you need to know how good.

In our open community groups, or pods, you can find or start discussions on almost anything business related, from idea validation, to mentoring and advice and much more

Making it happen

Turn your idea into a reality with crowdfunding. You offer rewards to and your backers pledge funds. Backers do this to get rewards.

Rewards can be anything from a thanks, first access to your innovative product, to offering advertising for your backers on your website. Only your imagination limits what you offer your backers get for supporting you.

Get expert help

You will definitely need help to get your business off the ground. You'll need everything from a website to an accountant. Find the expertise you need to build and grow your business from other businesses, freelancers and more. They may even be the businesses you met in the community. 

Pre-launch 

While each tool can be used independently, it helps that the same businesses that validated, funded and offered their expertise are interested in your new product.

Announce it, get your product listed in our beta-list, get input on pricing and get marketing best practice advice all before you launch.

Get your first sales or get new business.

Get your first sales or generate new business. Use quick, highly discounted daily deals, to sell and market your business. Create a deal on anything.

We take care of letting the community know and they will let the rest of the world know.

Marketplace

If there are business related products you need or want to sell then use the eCommerce marketplace. Good business offers - without the time limit of voucher based deals.

Buy and sell anything from business courses to promotional gifts and business electronics.

Pay it forward

We are all about sharing at My Enterpride. Now that you have established your business, it's time to share the experiences you made along the way, give advice, back new ideas. Everything you received along the way. Of course you can still use the tools you've used to continue to generate leads, sales and more.

We give by donating 20% of what we earn to UNICEF and World Food Programme. That's because we believe that basic education and not going to bed hungry should be basic human rights.

How much should does this cost a business?

Here is a breakdown of our pricing, just for the sake of enlightenment we have added pricing of some potential competitors, but actually there is no site that can offer all we offer.

Here is how you can help

This entire project is currently, created, managed and run by one person with a mission to change both the way business, and to certain extent, the world operates. It is at a point where the system is there and fully operational. The first 200 businesses are already signed up and there is a following on the social networks and now I need help to take it to the next level.We have what's called a 'minimum desirable product' - now we want to take it to the max.

In the short term you can help if you are a start-up, small business or freelancer and by getting involved and just by signing up. Be part of the community, create funding projects, post jobs and sell stuff. If you’re not one of these, I am sure you know someone that would be interested. Please share what is being done with them.

Next you can help by backing the project and get one (or more) of the rewards being offered.

Your contribution goes to

Some might object to contributing to marketing, but for every dollar we spend on marketing brings in a potential sale and with it a 20% contribution to a worthy cause. We estimate that every dollar we spend on marketing is doubled as a contribution due to the subsequent sales. 

For every 20.000 subscribing members we would be able to feed 25.000 children everyday and prevent them from dying of hunger. We can't get that amount of members without marketing and improving the platform's usability.

To be self-sufficient we need a total user base of 1.500 members of which one in five would be a subscriber. Within 12 months we want to reach the first 20.000 of which 4.000 would be subscribers. We would then be able to donate $160.000. Eight times what we would like to raise with this campaign.

To make each dollar more effective the network needs to develop and your money will also go towards this. This will go towards creating an even better user experience and utilise the synergies that are the thinking behind the project even better.

Of course we need to hire in the expertise we need to do these things.  All contributions will be used with same bootstrapping mentality that has brought it this far.

Here is what you can get

A fiver gets you a virtual high five and personal thanks.

For a tenner, we’ll let the world know how awesome you are as well.

Create a daily deal or list your products for just $25 and save 50%. We are not like similar sites that take up to half of earnings in commission. We don’t take commissions. So it doesn’t get any cheaper.

Did you know that Yoda was an entrepreneur. He must have been. Get the proof with your own “Do or Do not. There is not try” poster for half a C-note.

Anyone that has a business knows that it can be really difficult to say no to new business opportunities, demanding customers and more even when you are overworked. Now you can get a good quality t-shirt so that you don’t get asked. A word of caution though , you may want to think twice about wearing it for a night on the town, or not ;-) also for $50


What about signing up and you’ll get a three month elite business subscription to help your business. Great for if you are just starting out, or want to generate new business. We’ll include a feature in our newsletter and on social media. Of course anything you create with us will also be promoted. All of this for just $200, you save $400.

Your business website is your virtual shop window. What does your shop look like? Get a logo design and website to match for half a grand, $500. We manage the whole process and find the best freelancers to get it all off the ground. We’ll even throw one month elite business subscription to help you get well on your way.

What about investing $750 in us and we will give you a 6 month elite business subscription worth $1.200, a blog article highlighting your business, monthly promotion on our social networks and listing on a special favourite business page.

Need a full business campaign package? For $1.500 and we will give you one year’s elite business subscription worth $2.400, two blog articles highlighting your business, weekly promotion on our social networks and listing on a special preferred business page that includes your logo. Finally, whilst we generally don’t advertise on the member pages we will advertise your business in these area’s where your ad will be rotated with only nine other businesses.

Company vision and culture

Our vision is simple, we want to be the tool every small business reaches for to fund, build and grow their business and define a business roadmap for a better world.

We want to achieve this through:

Transparency

We aim to be transparent in everything we do. Transparency builds trust, invites communication, empowers equality and instills respect. We aim to be visible, upfront about our actions, operations, and so on. Our default position is the belief that those that we deal with treat us in the same way.

Growth

We seek to be consistently growing. This is just the beginning. Both today and in the future, we set our sights on providing relevant tools for a more complete approach to business. Our goal is be an integrated part of your business process. To do that we need to constantly grow.

Profit

The lives we touch should be more profitable. Business is the most powerful influence in the world today and profit is the driver for that influence. Our business model takes a conscious approach to making a difference in the world. To make that difference we need to be profitable, for everyone.

This isn’t going to be a walk in the park.

No one here is kidding themselves that this is going to be a walk in the park. We have the same risks that any new business has. There is still a long way to reaching our vision and your contribution is the first very important step along the way that will help a lot to getting there.

Tweet: "A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step." - Lao-Tzu. Help My Enterpride take the next step http://myen.co/1TLA9qr

In the interest of making the best product we can any small changes to the site, rewards and more could be subject to small modifications which we will announce in the "Updates" section.

As with all Indiegogo Crowdfunded Projects: Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.

We take your trust in us very seriously. We will endeavour to make sure our Indiegogo backers are delighted about joining us on this journey.

About

Based in Denmark, My Enterpride was born out of a desire to find a way for business to give back. We believe strongly in the principal of a sharing economy where business can help each other to grow, as well as be a force for positive change.

By providing a premium platform for many business needs My Enterpride offers crowdsourced solutions for business needs. This crowd of business users can likewise be used as a source of change by channeling 20% of the income we generate from our users back into society.

I am principally passionate about two things, helping businesses through the power of collaboration and influencing global social injustice. On the surface unrelated, until you realise that business and in particular, small business, is one of the most powerful empowering economic forces on the planet. These ideas have crystallized into the launch of My Enterpride. A socially conscious business ecosystem for startups, small business and freelancers.

Jason Lorjé – Social Entrepreneur

Now you can get a good quality t-shirt so that you don’t get asked. A word of caution though , you may want to think twice about wearing it for a night on the town, or not ;-) also for $50

What about signing up and you’ll get a three month elite business subscription to help your business. Great for if you are just starting out, or want to generate new business. We’ll include a feature in our newsletter and on social media. Of course anything you create with us will also be promoted. All of this for just $200, you save $400.
Your business website is your virtual shop window. What does your shop look like? Get a logo design and website to match for half a grand, $500. We manage the whole process and find the best freelancers to get it all off the ground. We’ll even throw one month elite business subscription to help you get well on your way.
What about investing $750 in us and we will give you a 6 month elite business subscription worth $1.200, a blog article highlighting your business, monthly promotion on our social networks and listing on a special favourite business page.
Need a full business campaign package? For $1.500 and we will give you one year’s elite business subscription worth $2.400, two blog articles highlighting your business, weekly promotion on our social networks and listing on a special preferred business page that includes your logo. Finally, whilst we generally don’t advertise on the member pages we will advertise your business in these area’s where your ad will be rotated with only nine other businesses.
Company vision and culture
Our vision is simple, we want to be the tool every small business reaches for to fund, build and grow their business and define a business roadmap for a better world.
We want to achieve this through:
Transparency
We aim to be transparent in everything we do. Transparency builds trust, invites communication, empowers equality and instills respect. We aim to be visible, upfront about our actions, operations, and so on. Our default position is the belief that those that we deal with treat us in the same way.
Growth
We seek to be consistently growing. This is just the beginning. Both today and in the future, we set our sights on providing relevant tools for a more complete approach to business. Our goal is be an integrated part of your business process. To do that we need to constantly grow.
Profit
The lives we touch should be more profitable. Business is the most powerful influence in the world today and profit is the driver for that influence. Our business model takes a conscious approach to making a difference in the world. To make that difference we need to be profitable, for everyone.
This isn’t going to be a walk in the park.
No one here is kidding themselves that this is going to be a walk in the park. We have the same risks that any new business has. There is still a long way to reaching our vision and your contribution is the first very important step along the way that will help a lot to getting there.
Tweet: "A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step." - Lao-Tzu. Help My Enterpride take the next step http://myen.co/1TLA9qrIn the interest of making the best product we can any small changes to the site, rewards and more could be subject to small modifications which we will announce in the "Updates" section.
As with all Indiegogo Crowdfunded Projects: Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.
We take your trust in us very seriously. We will endeavour to make sure our Indiegogo backers are delighted about joining us on this journey.
About
Based in Denmark, My Enterpride was born out of a desire to find a way for business to give back. We believe strongly in the principal of a sharing economy where business can help each other to grow, as well as be a force for positive change.
By providing a premium platform for many business needs My Enterpride offers crowdsourced solutions for business needs. This crowd of business users can likewise be used as a source of change by channeling 20% of the income we generate from our users back into society.
I am principally passionate about two things, helping businesses through the power of collaboration and influencing global social injustice. On the surface unrelated, until you realise that business and in particular, small business, is one of the most powerful empowering economic forces on the planet. These ideas have crystallized into the launch of My Enterpride. A socially conscious business ecosystem for startups, small business and freelancers.

Jason Lorjé – Social Entrepreneur

story:
https://antiresumemanifesto.wordpress.com

There it was, right in front of me. As though the name behind eloquent, inspiring, words I have frequently called upon for self awareness, were foreign to me. Foreign, yet, familiar. Foreseeable, yet, provoking.

Forbes.Com #9 Power Woman; Sherly Sandberg, COO Facebook; Net Worth $1 Billion; Source of Wealth: SELF MADE.

Self. Made. I ran those two words over and over in my head. Self. Made. What was it about that concept that was so provocative? Unheard of paired with both a billion dollar net worth a woman’s face? But that’s it isn’t it? That change in perspective, that unanticipated revolution of one’s self worth that defines a leader.

Leader /’li:de/; noun: a person who rules, guides, or inspires others;head.

Too broad. Too simplistic. Too primal. One who rules. My mind drifts back to the undeniable legitimacy of Sandberg’s words that shook the archaic foundation of gender stereotyping to its core.

“Women, feel fraudulent when they are praised for their accomplishments. Instead of feeling worthy of recognition, they feel undeserving and guilty, as if a mistake has been made.”

There it was. Self Made. Leader. In it’s richest definition. If you fail to thrive, in business or in life, the only person holding the blame is yourself. Look past men and women. Look past gender-roles, conventional sexuality, sexism and general expectations of boy vs. girl. And look at the odds.

As inspiring leaders, business entrepreneurs, investors, managers and dreamers we will be nothing if we cannot look past the shallow exterior of any seemingly impossible obstacle and break it down to it’s most primitive, exposed root.

One might say “men hold women back” but, the woman who responds, “why do we let them?”, is the Leader we set out to discover, define and immolate. That is the Leader I want to become; and embodying the very precision of my point, who is going to stop me?

“Careers are a jungle gym, not a ladder; and who wears a tiara in a jungle gym anyway?”

Sit at the table. Lean in.

story:
Short Summary

Gunpowder Falls Brewing has been in business for about 4 years now and we are looking for your help to make our tasting room into an atmosphere that bring craft drinkers together and most importantly to have them come back time and again.  Currently all our funds have been put into the production and distribution, and now we are asking for your to help to update our tasting room atmosphere into something enjoyable for everyone!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We needs funding help to update our tasting room as well as be able to distribute our beer out to the public!

Things We Need:

-new paint

-new decor

-updated lighting

-countertops and bar facelifts

-new seating

With your help we will better be able to serve the locals who love our beer and tasting room, as well as expand out and share our brews with those who are looking for a destination craft brewery to visit and enjoy.

 

The Impact

Gunpowder Falls Brewing wants patrons to feel comfortable in the tasting room environment. With new and updated seating, paint, and bar equipment, we will be able to bring new life to our tasting room and better serve those craft drinkers who show up to have a cold brew with us!

 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest hurdle right now is gathering the extra funds to help renovate the tasting room and make it as special as we can.  We have big plans for it, now we just need the extra funds to get rolling!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Stop in an see us here at the brewery! 

Our tasting room is open every Friday (5-9pm), Saturday (2-9pm) and Sunday (1-6pm)

Also ask about us at your local bars, eateries, and distributors!

story:
Sustainable torque system technology

Hello everyone. My name is Bennett Ross, CEO and founder of Ayla Group, Inc. I’m a product developer that’s researched and tested renewable products for 15 years. As the result of such hard work and research, I am very excited to share with you an amazing new product.

We’ve developed a technology that is designed to remove “Range Anxiety” associated with all-electric vehicles. We have a revolutionary solution that provides unlimited driving range for all-electric vehicles, without the need to recharge or refuel the vehicle.

Our sustainable torque system is engineered to replace all other automotive propulsion systems, including combustible engines, hybrid engines, hydrogen fuel cells, electric vehicles, and solar-powered vehicles, producing no carbon emissions, no radiation, and no other hazards to the environment. This is something completely novel, something tailor-made for people who care about sustainability and who want to face this crisis head on.

What will the money go towards?

Right now, we are turning to you, for help raising $289K. This start-up capital is going to cover the costs of manufacturing a fully functioning Electric Vehicle with Unlimited Driving Range. We at AYLA Group appreciate any and all contributions to this project, monetary and otherwise, and we thank you for your time.

Here is what the $289,000 will go towards.

  1. Full development of the Sustainable Torque System and Retrofit
  2. Primary Custom Controller Smart Software
  3. Secondary Custom Controller Smart Software
  4. Primary Controller hardware and electronics
  5. Secondary Controller hardware and electronics
  6. Fabrication equipment for transfer case
  7. Fabrication equipment for hydraulic system assembly
  8. Purchase vehicle to retrofit
  9. Fabrication and retrofit the vehicle
  10. Primary inverter
  11. Secondary inverter
  12. Custom pump system
  13. Start-up power supply
  14. 100kW DC Generator with advance cooling system

Once completed, and to prove our technology, we will drive from coast to coast across the U.S. without refueling or recharging. We will record our excursion and provide streaming live video as to our progress.

 

 

The Technology - Here's how it is works

We've develop a 5 step process to overcome range anxiety with conventional all electric vehicles.

Step 1 - We start with a start-up power source. The power source can range from a few different items. In this example, we used a 3,900 watt DC battery.

Step 2 - We use an inverter to switch the DC battery power to AC.

Step 3 - We added an AC motor hydraulic pump system (AC motor - 2,300 watts).

Step 4 - We added a transfer case to the hydraulic pump system.

Step 5 - We added a generator that is capable of generating enough energy to power the vehicle and the sustainable torque system (example: 100kW generator).

Once the generator creates energy, the start-up power source (battery) is no longer needed and is powered off (this process takes seconds to happen).

A carbon free, green energy loop powers the system until the desired shutdown sequence is requested.

Virtually any amount of energy can be created, for virtually any application (a home, business, bus, train, etc.).

 

 

The Math

The "Start Up" power supply starts the system only (not needed for continuous power to the Sustainable Torque System).

Example: Start Up power supply - Lithium Ion Battery, 12.0V x 325A = 3,900W

The Inverter/Converter - Inverts or converts the Start UP power supply.

Electrical Switching Unit - Directs the flow of power to the units requiring power.

Pump Motor - The AC (or DC) motor, pumps hydraulic fluid through the system (a pneumatic system may be used).

Example: 2hp, 20 Amp, 115v (2,300 W), 1.75 gpm @ 2000 PSI

Hydraulic Cylinder - 6 inch bore, 2 inch stroke

12.5664 sq. in. surface area (11.3392 sq.in. w/shaft), 12.5664 x 2000 PSI = 25,132.8 lbs. of lift (11.3392 x 2000 PSI = 22,678.4 lbs. of lift)

Torque

25,132.8 lb. x 1 ft. = 25,132.8 ft. lb.

Gearbox (Transfer Case)

Creates the correct RPM for items - Generator(s) or other items.

Generator

Example: 3,000 RPM - 100kW electric generator (used to power a 90kW all electric car motor and the Sustainable Torque System).

Our Goal

Our plan is to replace all other automotive propulsion systems, all the systems that rely on fossil fuels and natural gases. This sustainable torque system will also replace battery packs so that range anxiety is no longer an issue.

Our system requires no recharging and no refueling, saving you tons of time and money. Plus, our system makes no carbon footprint, emits no radiation, produces no hazardous materials, uses no super magnets, uses no hydrogen, uses no solar panels, and creates power on demand. Totally portable, this is truly the super-powered device that the 21st century craves.

 

 

First we remove the battery pack from the all-electric vehicle. Then install our “Sustainable Torque System” power on demand platform. With our technology on-board, you have virtually an unlimited range vehicle – without the need of timely recharging or refueling....., and yes, zero emissions.

The technology exist today and we are excited and ready to implement our product.

We are extremely pleased with our findings, and we believe that everyone that is concerned about our planet will be equally as pleased.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter with your friends and family. We appreciate it. Thank you.

Plus, our system makes no carbon footprint, emits no radiation, produces no hazardous materials, uses no super magnets, uses no hydrogen, uses no solar panels, and creates power on demand. Totally portable, this is truly the super-powered device that the 21st century craves.  First we remove the battery pack from the all-electric vehicle. Then install our “Sustainable Torque System” power on demand platform. With our technology on-board, you have virtually an unlimited range vehicle – without the need of timely recharging or refueling....., and yes, zero emissions.The technology exist today and we are excited and ready to implement our product.We are extremely pleased with our findings, and we believe that everyone that is concerned about our planet will be equally as pleased. Other Ways You Can HelpYou can also help by sharing this campaign on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter with your friends and family. We appreciate it. Thank you.

story:
THE BACKGROUND

I'm Chelsea Green, a career bookseller and publishing employee! My dream is to open a bookstore with a bar and cafe in the North Dallas area -- a place to read and relax with your favorite drink!  I have teamed up with my husband, Colin, and my sister, Jessica, and we plan to open a store for bibliophiles and their friends and family to enjoy great books over a glass of wine, a pint of beer, or a cup of coffee. I need your help to make this dream a reality!

 

THE REASON

In 2006, I started working at one of those big box bookstores. I worked for that same chain in 3 different stores, across 2 states, and in 6 different positions, for 7 years, until I left to work at one of the top 5 book publishers in NY. I worked for 4 years in inventory and sales; learning all the ins and outs of the publishing world. I quickly realized that I missed my family back in Texas, but wanted to keep my love of working in the book industry alive!

When I found out there was no indie bookstore in the area, I knew what I had to do! I am teaming up with Colin, my husband, who I met at that previously aforementioned big box bookstore, and my sister, Jessica, who has been my partner since 2015 in running our book subscription box company, MyBookBox! (mybookbox.com)

The MyBookBox team meeting author Julie Murphy:

 

THE BOOKSTORE

BIB•LI•O•BAR: a bar relating to books; also, a bar for book lovers

We hope that BIBLIOBAR will soon be a bookstore and bar located in North Dallas. We will offer general interest books, graphic novels, bookish gift items, and events with a focus on the community and bringing amazing authors to the area! 

This won't just be another bookstore for you to run in and run out. Our store will encourage new and seasoned readers to pick up a book and a drink in a casual, cozy setting, making our store the perfect spot to discuss your favorite books and authors or to sit quietly and read to your heart's content! All of our new bookish friends (you!) will be able to drink the best wines, try local craft beer and ciders, locally roasted coffee, and small bites at our bar! 

North Dallas will have a new place to hang out in a fun and comfortable environment for the whole family. Designed for reading and discussion, we plan to have a variety of exciting events every week, including author readings, wine tastings, game nights, and book clubs for all ages. It will be your favorite place to have a wine with the ladies, play date with the kids, game night with the guys, or an afternoon with the family. We will have a dedicated children's space, offering the best children’s books, story times (while mom and dad have a drink!), educational workshops, and more.

 

HOW WE ARE DIFFERENT

Going to a chain bookstore or library is a fun time, but going to an independent bookstore is a completely different experience! At BIBLIOBAR, every book and item that we carry will have been carefully selected by our team, not some corporate algorithm.

We will never hush your children... we will have a secured children's area where your kids can pick up and read any book they want! We will have the kids section in the back of the store, so you can browse the adult section or sit at the bar while they play. We are even looking into having child monitors at the bar so you can keep an eye on your children while you relax.  

We want to be a place for mom and dad to relax anytime, while showing your children the importance of reading! 

 

GIVING TO BIBLIOBAR WILL GIVE BACK!

As a small, locally owned business we want to give back to our community! We will be supporting local businesses and charities, below are just a few of the ways we plan to give back!

  • sourcing local craft beer and coffee
  • sourcing locally grown food
  • using local bakers to provide our desserts
  • hosting a fund share with a different local charity each month
  • hosting field trips to the store for local schools 

 

OUR EXPERIENCE

  • Our team has a combined 12 years of book-selling experience and 8 years of working in event and bar management!
  • We have run a successful, and financially secure book business for the last 2 years and made contacts that will we will be able to count on for advice in our new endeavor.
  • We have been finding mentors in fellow independent bookstore owners, meeting with them across the country. We have visited over 20 stores this year alone!
  • We are investing in the course provided by Paz & Associates, the leading bookstore consultants in the country, offering an intensive course on the realities of running a bookstore.
  • We're also studying the resources and industry sales data provided to us by the national bookseller trade association, American Booksellers Association (ABA) and the regional bookseller association, Mountains & Plains Independent Bookseller Association (MPIBA).

Our MyBookBox subscription box:

 

WHAT WE NEED!

WE NEED YOUR HELP to build a new home for the strong literary community of Dallas. I am asking my fellow book lovers to raise $50,000, which is about half of the estimated start-up budget. This money will help fund our initial inventory orders, build out of the store, furnishings, technology costs, and coffee and tap set up for the bar, but it will also serve as a proof-of-concept to prospective property owners and lenders. Every dollar we raise beyond the goal is a dollar we won't need to take on in start-up debt.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Use Indiegogo's share tools, use the hashtag #bibliobartx and make sure to tag us! We're on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram @bibliobartx. Call up your friends and say "Let's help this awesome group of folks open a bookstore in Dallas!" Be sure to tell them about the awesome perks they can receive for supporting a local bookstore! 

Thank you so much for believing in us! We can't wait to spend our days and evenings with you in our new bookstore!

Love,

Chelsea, Colin, and Jessica

 

BIBLIOBAR IN THE MEDIA

(Updated as of 12/3)

D Magazine

Preston Hollow Advocate

Shelf Awareness

Publisher's Weekly

Bookselling This Week

Shelf Awareness 10.19.2017

Guide Live

Plano Magazine

As a small, locally owned business we want to give back to our community! We will be supporting local businesses and charities, below are just a few of the ways we plan to give back!

sourcing local craft beer and coffee
sourcing locally grown food
using local bakers to provide our desserts
hosting a fund share with a different local charity each month
hosting field trips to the store for local schools 

 
OUR EXPERIENCE



Our team has a combined 12 years of book-selling experience and 8 years of working in event and bar management!
We have run a successful, and financially secure book business for the last 2 years and made contacts that will we will be able to count on for advice in our new endeavor.
We have been finding mentors in fellow independent bookstore owners, meeting with them across the country. We have visited over 20 stores this year alone!

We are investing in the course provided by Paz & Associates, the leading bookstore consultants in the country, offering an intensive course on the realities of running a bookstore.
We're also studying the resources and industry sales data provided to us by the national bookseller trade association, American Booksellers Association (ABA) and the regional bookseller association, Mountains & Plains Independent Bookseller Association (MPIBA).

Our MyBookBox subscription box:

 
WHAT WE NEED!
WE NEED YOUR HELP to build a new home for the strong literary community of Dallas. I am asking my fellow book lovers to raise $50,000, which is about half of the estimated start-up budget. This money will help fund our initial inventory orders, build out of the store, furnishings, technology costs, and coffee and tap set up for the bar, but it will also serve as a proof-of-concept to prospective property owners and lenders. Every dollar we raise beyond the goal is a dollar we won't need to take on in start-up debt.
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Use Indiegogo's share tools, use the hashtag #bibliobartx and make sure to tag us! We're on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram @bibliobartx. Call up your friends and say "Let's help this awesome group of folks open a bookstore in Dallas!" Be sure to tell them about the awesome perks they can receive for supporting a local bookstore! 
Thank you so much for believing in us! We can't wait to spend our days and evenings with you in our new bookstore!
Love,
Chelsea, Colin, and Jessica
 
BIBLIOBAR IN THE MEDIA
(Updated as of 12/3)
D Magazine
Preston Hollow Advocate
Shelf Awareness
Publisher's Weekly
Bookselling This Week
Shelf Awareness 10.19.2017
Guide Live
Plano Magazine

story:
Bref résumé

 

Passionné par les plaisirs gastronomiques et la saine alimentation, j'ai mis 4 ans au HEC en démarrage d'entreprise à mûrir ce projet d'épicerie nouveau genre. J'espère apporter un vent de changement en démontrant qu'il est possible de trouver qualité, service et entregent dans un marché. Père de famille, je vois d'autant plus l'importance de laisser aux nouvelles générations une planète en santé. Je veux promouvoir une vision d'harmonie qui allie plaisir et écoresponsabilité. 

 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Vos dons servirons à remplir nos silos en vrac d'une valeur de 30 000$ et à financer notre système de caisse au coût de 40 000$. 

Pour chaque dollar investi nous vous remettrons :certificat cadeau pour l'épicerie ou pour le bistro local, repas gastronomique ou autres... 

 

Voici les dépenses 

Fonds de roulement                          10 000

Inventaire                                             60 000 

Équipement d’épicerie                   104 000

Équipement informatique                 9 000

Caisses enregistreuses                   40 000

Amélioration locative                      80 000

Marketing et promotion                   21 000 

Loyer                                                      10 000

Permis et droits légaux                      4 000

Coût total :                                 338 000

 

L'impact

 

En contribuant à notre projet vous participez activement à soutenir l'économie locale et aidez une entreprise familiale à s'épanouir tout près de chez vous.

Après 17 ans de travail dans le milieu de la restauration, me voilà prêt à relever de nouveaux défis. Mon expérience et ma  formation font de moi un gestionnaire fiable et compétent.

D'autres façons d'aider

 

Diffusez notre vidéo et contribuez ainsi à l'épanouissement de notre entreprise.

Nous avons hâte de vous retrouver au marché!

story:
Summary

Our aim is to have every hiker in the world want to walk El Camino de Costa Rica, or part of it, at least once in their lifetime.  As travellers pass through rural towns along the Trail, they will stop for food, supplies, lodging, and to enjoy restaurants and cafes.  These towns and villages will grow economically in response to the establishment of the trail. This slow, socially inclusive economic development of rural towns is the fundamental objective of the effort.

Mar a Mar, with 23 Associates, including business leaders, tourism operators, local leaders and hikers, was established as a nonprofit association in Costa Rica in November of 2016 and has a strong volunteer Board representing varied expertise and a committed Executive Director. Six team leaders implement various aspects of the organization: Route Development; Community Engagement; Institutional Engagement; Communications and Public Relations; Fundraising; and Legal and Fiscal matters. With this disciplined and committed Board and volunteer team leaders, Mar a Mar has been able to accomplish a great deal in one year.

Mar a Mar has succeeded in becoming known in the world of hiking in Costa Rica, has presented its work to several gubernatorial entities where the ideas were well received and has established relationships with several lodges, community leaders and cooperatives such as Coopearruco in Orosi.   We have a digital version of the route available for guides to take groups. El Camino de Costa Rica travels through public roads as well as through the indigenous people’s lands. Of the 15 towns where hikers would sleep, all but 5 already have capacity for at least 20 tourists.  One of our accomplishments in 2016 was to establish the capacity to take day hikers on the route and to date we have walked seven of the fifteen sections with groups. A major accomplishment has been the establishment of relationships with experienced tour operators who plan to start leading hikers along the route in 2017. In fact, the first hiker completed walking the Trail in February!  We have a Board treasurer and a CPA on retainer.

What We Need

These are some key milestones that still need to be achieved. We can't accomplish them without your generous support!

In order to fund our initiative, we seek seed money of  $50,000. Under the strong leadership of the Mar a Mar Board, the seed money would contract with program managers who would work on priority projects which will include:

  • Work with local associations to improve and maintain the trail.
  • Work with local associations to mark the trail.
  • Implement the Mar a Mar marketing plan which includes audience identification, developing content for advertising and publicity and the best media for the various publicity messages, and developing orientation and guide materials for hikers (maps, trip preparation information, lodging and dining guides, identifying nearby attractions along the trail, safety and first aid information, etc.)
  • Continue to engage with tour operators to take tourists along the route.

The Impact

Costa Rica’s GNP is driven by tourism, but rural towns do not benefit from this economic gold mine as tourists are commonly frequenting the coastal areas of Costa Rica, and neglecting the rural and indigenous areas of the country.  This trail will promote carbon neutral tourism, which is sustainable, affordable, and most importantly respects Costa Rica’s natural environment and cultural traditions.

Our strategy is that these projects would establish a flow of hikers and thus create a demand that would further engage the communities along the Trail.

Risks & Challenges

Some of the challenges that Mar a Mar faces in establishing El Camino de Costa Rica include unfavorable route conditions.  Some of the zones through which the trail passes have high levels of rain and ﬂooding that impact the trail and bridges. Your contribution will assist in improving and maintaining safety along the route.

Ways You Can Help

A small amount of dollars will go a long way in this project to trigger entrepreneurial opportunities in rural villages

  • $10.00 would go towards developing materials for hikers
  • $20.00 would go towards engaging local entrepreneurs
  • $30.00 would go towards marking the trail
  • $50.00 would improve infrastructure on the trial

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can certainly contribute in other ways:

  • Share our video and link with your friends
  • Come and hike the trail!

story:
Short Summary

    Thank you for your interest in this very important campaign, "Operation Thank you for your Service," a Florida, Non-Profit organization, provides no-cost, group vacations to returning soldiers and their caregivers, designed to heal their hearts & minds.

    My name is Edward Estevez and I have experienced, first hand, the effects of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). I am a United States Army veteran of the first Persian Gulf War.  With the help of GI Bill benefits, I earned my B.B.A. at the University of Miami, while majoring in legal studies. My wife Anai is a real estate professional whose expertise is business management. We are proud parents of five, now all adults, one of which is an Air Force vet, and another is currently active Air Force, deployed. Although being a soldier will always live within me and is part of who I am, the experiences of war seriously affected my health. After being diagnosed with PTSD and later suffering a heart attack at the age of 46, it has been a priority of mine to create new, happy and positive experiences, leaving the memories of war behind. As Pulitzer Price winner, microbiologist and humanist Rene Dubos has said "What happens in the mind of a man is always reflected in the diseases of his body".  Scientific research has shown a correlation between vacationing, improved cardiovascular health, and emotional well-being. I am living proof of this.

    Your pledge will help heal the hearts and minds of our returning soldiers.

    Every American soldier swears in at an enlistment ceremony and takes an oath to support and defend our nation and to protect our freedoms. In the world we live today, more and more of these men and women are coming home scarred by what they have experienced overseas. As is the transition protocol, the returning veteran is given information on obtaining education benefits, résumé writing, and other guidance on reintegrating into the work force. The veteran undergoes health registration and screening. If necessary, the veteran is advised of mental health treatment, which mainly consists of medication, such as anti-depressants.

    Your pledge will contribute to, instead, helping them experience the freedoms they have been protecting, in a holistic approach to reintegration. These are proactive and valuable measures to really say "Thank You For Your Service."

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to raise $25,000. The funds will cover all costs, for 10 veterans and their caregiver, including:
  • Cruise vacation to various destinations in the Caribbean
  • Accessible Accommodations for the physically challenged
  • An accompanying Experienced Veteran Recreational Activities Director
  • Transfers
  • Insurances
  • Taxes
  • Port Charges
  • Tailored Activities
  • Land Excursions
  • Cruise Vacation Souvenir for the Veteran
  • Website Development
  • Printed Marketing Materials
  • Postage
  • Establish this organization, including licenses, filing for tax exemption, registrations, and legal fees,  allowing it to carry it's mission nationwide.
  • Developing relationships with other Veteran Service Organizations

 If we are unable to reach our goal, we will provide the extraordinary cruise vacation experience to as many veterans as we can and continue to improve the campaign for future efforts.

The Impact

According to the NY Times, between 2005 and 2011 the military increased its prescriptions of psychoactive drugs by almost 700 percent. A study done by the American Sociological Association found that the more vacations people take, the less dependent they are on antidepressants.

  • Think about this: for a period of six months to a year at time, among other things, improvised explosive devices, chemical attacks, and ambushes, 24/7. It is the life of an American soldier in combat. For many of our vets, the effects linger, and violence is still part of their daily lives because, this is what they had, continuously, as their environment, and its that which is shaping their view of the world around them.

31% of Americans die of Cardiovascular disease. Besides diet, exercise, and smoking, stress is a leading cause of this disease. Stress in the mind causes blood vessels to constrict, raises our blood pressure, and elevates heart rate.
A study conducted by the Department of Physiology, Medical University of Vienna found that health-related vacation outcome are significantly affected by the way a  vacation is organized. That's where we come in!

In this study, recuperation was facilitated by free time, warmer (and sunnier) vacation locations, exercise during vacation, good sleep, and making new acquaintances, especially among vacationers reporting higher levels of pre-vacation work strain, such as veterans with PTSD.

In 2011, Expedia's Vacation Deprivation Study indicated that, in the US, 36% of potential vacationers preferred beach vacations with plenty of relaxation time. Other location categories, such as cities, nature related, or theme parks, were at least 10% less preferred. Of those who preferred the warmer beach climates, 63% were in the age group of our vets, ages 18-44. This is the basis for our choosing the Caribbean Islands.

Another component of our holistic approach is referred to as "Capitalization." Shelly Gable, a professor at UCLA, has done extensive work in the area of capitalization. Capitalization is about sharing positive events with others which may increase positive emotions and a sense of increased belongingness. The more that positive emotions are shared, the greater likelihood that they will be remembered.

Here's a glimpse into current veteran statistics:

Statistics from the Congressional Research Service 2000-2014

Troops Deployed: 2.5m
Post Traumatic Stress Disorders: 164,817

Traumatic Brain Injuries: 307,282

Current Limb Amputations: 1,537

  • Lower Limb - 74%
  • Upper Limb - 22%
  • Upper & Lower Limb - 4%

Wounded Heroes in Need: 437,315

YOU DO THE MATH......

    Risks & Challenges

    Although manageable, there is a lot of coordination to take place with this type of endeavor. From the selection of candidates to the logistics and coordination of travel, not to interfere with the veterans responsibilities, such as work or health care related appointments etc. Also, veterans with symptoms of PTSD, have a tendency to isolate.  We've learned that science supports group activities for veterans with similar circumstances.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand some of you cannot contribute, but that does not mean you cannot help:

    • Please share this campaign with your friends and family. Every penny counts.
    • You can easily use the share tools to post this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram.

     

    THANK YOU FOR YOUR PLEDGE AND FOR SPREADING THE WORD!

story:
Creating Vibrant Food and Medicine


Who We Are:

We are Grandpa Steve, Steve, Anne and Runa Kirk. 62 years separates the youngest from the eldest in our multi-generational home. Together we have come to live amid a regrowing forest nestled in Capon Springs in the Cacapon Valley of West Virginia.


Photo by Melissa Jones

I (Steve) started working in Organic food markets in 2010 and was thrust into a large Organic Grower Cooperative in Lancaster, PA selling wholesale organic produce from Amish Growers. I've worked since then, as a buyer, coordinator, purchaser, and, along with Anne, consultant to local and organic retailers and wholesalers. All the while we have been passionate foragers and lovers of the fungi and always strive to live as land-based as possible.

Our role as foragers started many years before with a passion for wildness and a steadfastness to embracing its intimate role in our lives. It was there, in the garbage strewn forests outside Baltimore City, that we learned to forage for morels and process our first acorns. It was there that we learned to find Oyster and Dryad's Saddle when we couldn't find morels. As we moved to different locations around the area we discovered our own secret foraging spots of abundant fungi from spring to fall. We excitedly looked for signs of spring by what we saw on the ground. Red Clover, Yarrow, Nettles, Chickweed and Dandelion frequently adorned our salads and dried in our kitchen.

Morel watercolor painting Anne made Steve

for his birthday one year. We really LOVE fungi!

We seek to break from our role as facilitators and marketers and use our knowledge to produce the highest quality, organically grown, and robustly varied mushrooms. We seek to encourage decomposition in the overly logged forest which we now live and  help the surrounding community heal and feed while decomposing the massive amount of debris left from over cutting. Our goal is to heal and nourish people and landscapes.

Hexenring will create fresh and dried mushroom foods and medicines for distribution in a radiating local market. We will seek to serve our immediate community first and expand our distribution further only when needed to sustain our fungal community. We want to facilitate knowledge of mycological landscape techniques to others so we create the largest group effort to repair the forest around us.

Our fungal production will be done indoor and outdoor in order to maintain healthy strains of our varied gourmet and medicinal selection. Our indoor production will be efficient and light in resources used. Our outdoor production will be as integrated as possible into the existing ecosystem. We seek to enhance the ecology of our backyard through expanding the network of mycelium that West Virginia is famous for.

We can't do this alone. We need the help of our friends, families, and, most importantly, the local community to bring a vibrant food and essentials producer to eastern West Virginia. We will be offering a vast variety of mushrooms all grown on wild or organic substrates. We will be stewards of the spore, spawn, mycelium, and fruit bodies by perfecting sterile culture techniques and growing in a hybrid of indoor and outdoor mediums. Mushrooms include Reishi, Oyster, Shiitake, Paddy Straw, Pioppini, Lion's Mane, Turkey Tail, King Stropharia, Maitake, and more in the years to come!

Hexenring will host educational events, workshops, and other efforts to spread knowledge and community-sufficiency as far as we can.

Anne Kirk: Wood products and the timber industry are still a large part of West Virginia's economy. Although coal mining is in decline, we still have mountain top removal and natural gas fracking to contend with. Any environmentally exploitative industry you can think of thrives in areas of economic hardship, and finding a job in this region extremely difficult. Currently Wal Mart is the largest employer in the state. "West Virginia is the third most forested state in the United States. Forests cover 78.0% (12.0 millions acres) of the state’s 15.4 millions acres of land. Almost all of the forested land (11.8 millions acres or 98.3 %) is classified as commercial forestland, which is available for timber production." And "produce" it they have, in staggering quantities.

"Out of the 10,000,000 acres of virgin forest that existed in the State of West Virginia before 1750, only these 263 acres remain."

Until recently I did not realize the vast differences between an old growth forest and a more recently regrown post logging forest like the one on our property. It's far more than just the size of the trees, though that is certainly the most striking difference when you first enter. After spending time on a road trip exploring deep within the old growth forests of the Pacific Northwest, we discovered the vast expanse of fungi, plants and animals that flourish in an ancestral forest. One reason for this is the staggered age of the trees all providing different habitat and food. When a forest has been clear cut (logged to literally nothing) and replanted it has not been "replaced". Instead a tree crop has been planted - highly uniform in age and species. Think of  a Christmas tree farm versus an actual vibrant forest. In the newly replanted forest there are no dead trees on the forest floor that the fungi feed on. The fungal mycelium suffers and beneficial decomposition comes to a halt.

The three groups of Saprophytic Mushrooms aka The Decomposers include most of the gourmet mushrooms we intend to work with. Basically, the Primary Decomposers are first to the forest feeding party, and they grow insanely fast. They release enzymes and break down the cellulose (plant tissue) of a stump, fallen tree, compost, anything cellulose really, until they no longer can. Next enter the Secondary Decomposers who rely on the previous activity to work their magic. Last to join is the Tertiary Decomposers who really complete the cycle. All three stages of these fungi can coexist on the forest  floor within a healthy forest where there is constant replenishment of organic material. And this is what makes cultivation so exciting, just because you've grown mushrooms on one growing medium (substrate) doesn't mean that material is used up, you just need to move up the ladder of decomposition.

In a replanted forest the natural cycle of debris is interrupted. This causes  a huge loss of species diversity which has devastating affects. Our aim with Hexenring is to explore and utilize a wide variety mycological landscaping tactics to rehabilitate our burgeoning forest back to its previous "wild and wonderful" state. We will be true stewards to the land and want to cultivate a healing relationship that will encourage biodiversity in our region.


Why Fungi?

Fungi are coming up more often in mainstream news articles as their effects as decomposers are studied on treating the current environmental crisis. As decomposers they have a unique ability to help restore polluted land which is refereed to as "mycoremediation", or the ability of fungi to 'degrade or sequester contaminants in the environment'  - such as an oil spill. Have you seen Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind?   Spoiler alter - the radioactive forest was cleansed by none other than fungi, aka mycoremediation.  We want to use our ever expanding knowledge of the wild world to reestablish what has been lost to the wreckage of industrialism.

We also want to reestablish wild medicine as a powerful healing tool by sharing the knowledge of edible and medicinal plants and fungi with our community. We think gourmet mushrooms taste great, but their actual healing potential is staggering and too often overlooked. Modern western culture lags behind in our exploration and knowledge of the healing benefits of mushrooms, but the health benefits are huge. Recently you may have heard the rumors about certain mushrooms killing cancer cells. If you're having trouble swallowing that amazing fact, just remember that they're being used to treat OIL SPILLS too.  We plan to offer a wide variety of medicinal fungi products to support our local community, which is unfortunately considered the "most depressed" state in the country, amongst other distressing statistics regarding obesity, prescription drug abuse, and untreated mental health disorders - something our friends back in Baltimore should find shocking.

As if we needed another reason to be obsessed with all mycellium offers, have you heard about Colony Collapse Disorder (CCD) and the fast loss of the pollinators known as honeybees? While CCD is generally accepted to be caused by an  aggregate of factors converging to lower immunity among bee colonies, the use of certain pesticides is known to be a large culprit. The well know mycologist Paul Stamets, who is a huge influence on our techniques for cultivation and mycological landscape planning, is researching the effects of mycelium on saving our pollinators from one of their biggest threats - the varrora mites. This is research I keep a close eye on as I hear the news of my natural beekeeping mentor Meme Thomas of Baltimore Honey losing over 90% of her naturally kept beehives last year. We hope to explore this relationship between mycelium and pollinator's health by creating a sanctuary for honey bees and native pollinators on our land.

Beyond the specific and scientific there is a feeling and beauty to mycelium and its fruit bodies. The gentle primordia emerging from tiny dots in the soil. The indescribable individualism of each mushroom. And ultimately the intense fragility of each piece yet the inherent strength in structure. The magic of the mushroom runs deep and it has long been too ignored by "foraging experts". It is time to restore the fungi, from forest to plate. We are but a small part of the rapid renaissance of the mushroom.

Smallest Morel I've ever found! Not picked of course, just admired.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we need to realize our vision

  •  A new room in our garage to create a sterile culture (mushroom) lab and grow room $5,000
  •  Additional grow room $5,000
  •  Sterile Culture lab equipment  $4,000
  •  Initial strain and spawn purchases  $1,500
  • Culturing and Substrate supplies $1,000
  •  Preservation and value added supplies $1,000
  • Off-setting initial transportation cost $1,000
  • Containers and vessels for shares, wholesale, and additional products $500
  • Value added production supplies $1,000

= $20,000 fundraising request

If we raise over our goal? We have ideas for that dream too!

  • Continuing education about herbal medicine via in person and online study courses, workshops, and always more books!
  • Hosting of events and workshops to educate the community about the benefits of creating mycological landscapes
  • Bottling, jarring, labeling and packaging supplies for herbal medicines, teas, and dried mushrooms
  • Website domain, website hosting, and email services
  • Mushroom-mobile - a car in the shape of a toadstool! HA, just kidding. I prefer to travel on broomstick.

If we can't reach our entire fund raising goal we will use whatever funds we do obtain to begin establishing as many projects as possible. Our model is highly adaptable to scaling with the biggest hurdle being creating on-site sterile culture .  If we can't afford to do that from the onset we will simply intensify our outdoor production and keep striving toward our goals.

The Impact

Now, more than ever, we need to localize rural and wild areas so we can be independent, vibrant, and healthy. Supporting Hexenring allows us to build a place where people can nourish, thrive, learn, and connect.

We want to be a hub of community involvement. We desire to always be learning, sharing, and teaching. This enriches our lives and the land we now call home simultaneously.

Risks & Challenges

The tasks before us are daunting, don't doubt it! But it is precisely that challenge that motivates and inspires us, and frankly we've adapted to thrive under immense pressure. We know we are on the right path because we are being beckoned to walk  deeper and deeper into an unknown forest. The future looks like hard work, intense learning, trial and error, frustration, epiphanies and jubilation. A labor of love as the saying goes - one that we are prepared to embrace wholeheartedly.

Learning sterile culture for mushrooms, our biggest hurdle for maintaining consistent supply and strain vitality, is well underway and we are experimenting currently with DIY methods.  Steve's previous experience working for one of Maryland's finest environmental labs makes him a qualified person to get things set up utilizing whatever methods we can obtain from funding.

The equipment is essential, but we are an inherently inventive family and have always prioritized making do with what we have over making excuses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course even the smallest donation helps (financially and  psychologically) but also, please share this with your friends and help us connect to the most lively community possible. We thank everyone for their support and we look forward to a growing future. Lots of love from Hexenring and the Kirk family!
story_txt:
Creating Vibrant Food and Medicine Who We Are: 
 We are Grandpa Steve, Steve, Anne and Runa Kirk. 62 years separates the youngest from the eldest in our multi-generational home. Together we have come to live amid a regrowing forest nestled in Capon Springs in the Cacapon Valley of West Virginia. 

Photo by Melissa Jones
I (Steve) started working in Organic food markets in 2010 and was thrust into a large Organic Grower Cooperative in Lancaster, PA selling wholesale organic produce from Amish Growers. I've worked since then, as a buyer, coordinator, purchaser, and, along with Anne, consultant to local and organic retailers and wholesalers. All the while we have been passionate foragers and lovers of the fungi and always strive to live as land-based as possible.
Our role as foragers started many years before with a passion for wildness and a steadfastness to embracing its intimate role in our lives. It was there, in the garbage strewn forests outside Baltimore City, that we learned to forage for morels and process our first acorns. It was there that we learned to find Oyster and Dryad's Saddle when we couldn't find morels. As we moved to different locations around the area we discovered our own secret foraging spots of abundant fungi from spring to fall. We excitedly looked for signs of spring by what we saw on the ground. Red Clover, Yarrow, Nettles, Chickweed and Dandelion frequently adorned our salads and dried in our kitchen. 


Morel watercolor painting Anne made Steve for his birthday one year. We really LOVE fungi!

We seek to break from our role as facilitators and marketers and use our knowledge to produce the highest quality, organically grown, and robustly varied mushrooms. We seek to encourage decomposition in the overly logged forest which we now live and  help the surrounding community heal and feed while decomposing the massive amount of debris left from over cutting. Our goal is to heal and nourish people and landscapes. 
Hexenring will create fresh and dried mushroom foods and medicines for distribution in a radiating local market. We will seek to serve our immediate community first and expand our distribution further only when needed to sustain our fungal community. We want to facilitate knowledge of mycological landscape techniques to others so we create the largest group effort to repair the forest around us. 
Our fungal production will be done indoor and outdoor in order to maintain healthy strains of our varied gourmet and medicinal selection. Our indoor production will be efficient and light in resources used. Our outdoor production will be as integrated as possible into the existing ecosystem. We seek to enhance the ecology of our backyard through expanding the network of mycelium that West Virginia is famous for.
We can't do this alone. We need the help of our friends, families, and, most importantly, the local community to bring a vibrant food and essentials producer to eastern West Virginia. We will be offering a vast variety of mushrooms all grown on wild or organic substrates. We will be stewards of the spore, spawn, mycelium, and fruit bodies by perfecting sterile culture techniques and growing in a hybrid of indoor and outdoor mediums. Mushrooms include Reishi, Oyster, Shiitake, Paddy Straw, Pioppini, Lion's Mane, Turkey Tail, King Stropharia, Maitake, and more in the years to come!
Hexenring will host educational events, workshops, and other efforts to spread knowledge and community-sufficiency as far as we can.
Anne Kirk: Wood products and the timber industry are still a large part of West Virginia's economy. Although coal mining is in decline, we still have mountain top removal and natural gas fracking to contend with. Any environmentally exploitative industry you can think of thrives in areas of economic hardship, and finding a job in this region extremely difficult. Currently Wal Mart is the largest employer in the state. "West Virginia is the third most forested state in the United States. Forests cover 78.0% (12.0 millions acres) of the state’s 15.4 millions acres of land. Almost all of the forested land (11.8 millions acres or 98.3 %) is classified as commercial forestland, which is available for timber production." And "produce" it they have, in staggering quantities. 
"Out
 of the 10,000,000 acres of virgin forest that existed in the State of 
West Virginia before 1750, only these 263 acres remain."

story:
Short Summary

Somebody had to take a chance on creating unique sauces that uses better ingredients.  Ingredients based on quality and taste, not margin. I made a choice to not use low grade and artificial ingredients to make our sauces. We all want more from our foods and the companies that represent them. Since their success has built complacency, it's on us to rise up and build new companies that will stand for what we want now and deserve as an option. 

  • Andre Gourmet Sauce Co represents the people who want one of a kind healthier, tastier sauces (unlike any other sauces on the market). 
  • Andre Gourmet Sauce Co is my family livelihood (we don't have a plan B, we sell sauces or we don't eat) it's that kind of attitude, faith and hard work that allowed us to make it this far. But now we've reached a point where we need help to keep this mission alive and not die because of: people hadn't heard about it, lack of support or no working capital. 
  • Your contribution will help us achieve the necessary working capital to stay in business and continue to bring you the best quality sauce the world has never seen before or tasted. Unlike other sauce companies, we choose not to follow, but be a leader in being exceptionally unique and satisfying, using high quality ingredients like Organic Apple Cider Vinegar with the Mother, Organic Maple Syrup, and Celtic Sea Salt®.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need as much funding as we can get, but if I was to put the bare minimum that would be $7,000. This funding will be used as working capital to catch up on the rent for the building, catch up on the utility bills and other overhead, like licensure. If we raise more than our goal, then we will use the remaining funds to develop our other sauces and products to disrupt the status quo of the industry and bring you the best of the best! Remember I said it once and I'll say it again you and your family deserve the best! 
  • The unique perks start with our Maple BBQ Sauce called the Equalizer! Watch this video when we start making it as a 2016 release. Other perks would include t-shirt and caps that show you identify with a brand that stand for the premium quality, taste, and style! We will have shirts with catchy phrases  like, "I'm a Smolder-ing fella" or for the ladies "I Smolder and I know it!". "Life ain't the same without Flame!" "Get Blaze or Die Trying!" "Equalizer-Even the cooking playing field!"
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will use what we raise as a supplement to further our mission and move forward with getting distribution for our products.

The Impact

  • Our campaign is valuable to the contributor and to the world because we are tired of the same old same old. Sauce hasn't changed over the last century, making them out dated and boring. The impact that a contributor makes show the big companies  that people want sauces that are not only satisfying in taste but outstanding in quality.
  • We've been successful up to now from nothing (we even managed to hire a intern). Imagine what we can do with help from our contributors or catch a break from distributors and retailers (create more jobs).
  • At first people wondered if we're serious about impacting the industry by going against the grain by offering more quality instead fighting for the bottom. We've been in business for almost a year, we've gone from obscurity to first choice! Come join the 2016 movement to eat better with small companies who stand for the people!

Risks & Challenges

  • I've been an entrepreneur all my life and I've failed more than the average person has tried. From that I've learned a few things, I've learned that if you aspire to do something great, I realize people will join you. This is my chance to stand for what I want for myself and what other people want for themselves as well. We deserve the best. Some don't even have the option. The challenge is to build it...once it's available they will come if it's around long enough for people to catch on. 
  • I plan to overcome getting our product to our customers through online subscription/or recurring billing and free shipping on orders $30 and up. They can choose their frequency and products they want to receive and it'll arrive at their doorstep automatically. People want automation, the convenience to get the things they value without going out of their way. 
  • Also we are currently submitting to retailers like Whole Foods, Publix, Restaurant Chains, etc so people can have the option to purchase a premium product, not just a low cost, low quality product.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
