story:
LATEST NEWS! VIGOA's Campaign Launch in Miami!

(11/12/15) – VIGOA partnered with Art Nouveau Gallery in Wynwood, Miami's Art District, to celebrate the pre-launch of VIGOA's Indiegogo Campaign, during the gallery's most recent exhibit opening! 


See Gallery for more Images.

********

Back in 2008, I made a determination to change the way we do business in America.

I was working in operations for a well-known convenience store chain here in the US. While the operations aspect of the business is extremely efficient, the quality of the food and products isn’t the best. Processed food and giant corporations rule the shelves. I didn’t question it. It's simply how it is.

I traveled to Japan and noticed that the convenience stores there are very different than what they are here in America. Everyone goes there to get breakfast and lunch. The food is fresh and tasty. The stores are neat and well-kept. 

It made me think, why don’t we have the same convenience here in America?

During this time, I also came across an article that talked about how women in Africa were being exploited to profit the coffee business. It stressed the need for more creative ways to do business that add value for both the owners and the clients, without sacrificing the people that supply a store's shelves.

At that moment, I determined, I will take on the task to create this model. With VIGOA, I will completely revolutionize the food business industry by making it accessible and truly convenient for everyone.

This campaign is the first step to making my determination a reality. I have great conviction that VIGOA will lead the way into the future of convenience in America. I invite you to be a part of this revolution. 

NOW IS THE TIME! 

Carlos Vigoa

VIGOA: THE NEW ERA OF CONVENIENCE

VIGOA is a high-end convenience store for people who want simple yet delicious food, beverage and product options that are conveniently available anytime, at a fair price and that do not come at the cost of their health or bad business practices.

We will roast our own coffee in-house. We will have an organic juice bar. We will bake our own bread. Our products will be provided by an organic certified distributor. Plus, we will work with local farmers to have the best produce.


VIGOA will offer fresh homemade food prepared daily by my partner,                    Chef Pablo Coca Mir, a great culinary artist who brings his passion and love for food.


WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

At this point, VIGOA is a revolutionary concept. In order to make this idea a reality, your support is crucial!

I am absolutely determined to open our first store in 2016. To make this happen, I have set a goal of $100,000.00. These funds will help us:

  • Secure the best location (aprox. 3,000 sq. ft.) in VIGOA’s home base of Miami, Florida ($15K) 
  • Construction/Remodeling Costs ($35K)
  • Rent the Equipment Needed to Operate Successfully ($20K) 
  • Purchase the Merchandise to Stock our Very First Store ($20K) 
  • Miscellaneous Costs (e.g., licences, fees, pre-opening labor costs, etc.) ($10K)
With your support, VIGOA will implement a business model that carries only the best products and food with an efficient and groundbreaking operation that is fair to its employees and sustains the community it is a part of. Now that's convenient!

AMAZING PERKS!

Your support will create history, but I’m not simply asking for donations. 

In exchange for your backing, you will receive amazing gifts and perks, like our Free Coffee and Tea for Life! You can pre-order VIGOA's products now and be the first to enjoy them! Check them out at the right hand side of this page!

You will also receive periodic updates so you can follow our progress in 2016!


VIGOA'S IMPACT

VIGOA is a necessity in our modern world.  I've lost count of all the conversations I've had with people that complain that there are simply no food options for healthy conscious individuals available quickly and priced fairly. 

They also tell me how much VIGOA is needed and how much they would appreciate having a one-stop shopping store where they can grab a deliciously healthy bite to eat as well as any item they need, quickly at any time.

I am confident that this model will be successful not only at a local level, but that it can be easily replicated in any part of the country. Once we open our first store, the sky is the limit. 

WHAT ARE THE RISKS?

This is the very first step VIGOA is taking to become a reality and not just an idea. Many people have great ideas but fail to make them possible because they lack the operations and logistics expertise to execute them.

I have 20+ years of experience in the area of operations in the food and convenience store industries. I have successfully opened 75+ stores in the US and Latin America in these categories.

I have trained the staff before opening a store and made sure they meet the highest standards.  I have monitored the success of the store after it opens to make sure it generates profit. I have increased sales 300% in just 6 months by implementing innovative marketing strategies. 

In short, I have the necessary experience, the track record and the passion to open this business successfully and guarantee it operates with the highest standards.


VIGOA'S BIGGEST CHALLENGE

Like many other entrepreneurs, the toughest challenge I currently face is acquiring the initial funds necessary to make this leap. 

This campaign is the crucial first step toward opening our doors. It will pave the way to acquiring additional financing needed to continue building VIGOA's foundation and success, brick by brick.

VIGOA will revolutionize the food business in America. I invite you to be a part of this historic movement in its early stages. Every bit counts! 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

Please join the movement for healthier living by sharing this campaign with your friends using the tools in this site (via email, social media or pure old-fashion word of mouth!) 

Support VIGOA and help America welcome the New Era of Convenience Stores! 

Thank you so much for all your support! Now is the time!
story_txt:
LATEST NEWS! VIGOA's Campaign Launch in Miami!

(11/12/15) – VIGOA partnered with Art Nouveau Gallery in Wynwood, Miami's
Art District, to celebrate the pre-launch of VIGOA's
Indiegogo Campaign, during the gallery's most recent exhibit opening! 


See Gallery for more Images.
********
Back in 2008, I made a determination to change the
way we do business in America.
I was working in operations for a well-known convenience
store chain here in the US. While the operations aspect of the business is
extremely efficient, the quality of the food and products isn’t the best.
Processed food and giant corporations rule the shelves. I didn’t question it.
It's simply how it is.
I traveled to Japan and noticed that the convenience
stores there are very different than what they are here in America. Everyone
goes there to get breakfast and lunch. The food is fresh and tasty. The stores
are neat and well-kept. 

It made me think, why don’t we have the same
convenience here in America?
During this time, I also came across an article that talked about how women in Africa were
being exploited to profit the coffee business. It stressed the need for more
creative ways to do business that add value for both the owners and the
clients, without sacrificing the people that supply a store's shelves.
At that moment, I determined, I will take on the task to create this
model. With VIGOA, I will completely revolutionize the food
business industry by making it accessible and truly convenient for everyone.
This campaign is the first step to making my determination a reality. I
have great conviction that VIGOA will lead the way into the
future of convenience in America. I invite you to be a part of this
revolution. 
NOW IS THE TIME! 

Carlos Vigoa







VIGOA: THE NEW ERA OF CONVENIENCE



VIGOA is a high-end convenience store
for people who want simple yet delicious food, beverage and product options
that are conveniently available anytime, at a fair price and that do not come
at the cost of their health or bad business practices.

We will roast our own coffee in-house. We will have an organic juice bar. We will bake our own bread. Our products will be
provided by an organic certified distributor. Plus, we will work with local farmers to have the best produce.

VIGOA
will offer fresh homemade food prepared daily by my partner,                    Chef
Pablo Coca Mir, a great culinary artist who brings his passion and love for food.



WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

 

At this point, VIGOA is a
revolutionary concept. In order to make this idea a reality, your support is
crucial!
I am absolutely determined to
open our first store in 2016. To make this happen, I have set a goal of
$100,000.00. These funds will help us:

Secure the best location (aprox. 3,000 sq. ft.) in
     VIGOA’s home base of Miami, Florida ($15K) 
Construction/Remodeling Costs ($35K)
Rent the Equipment Needed to Operate Successfully
     ($20K) 
Purchase the Merchandise to Stock our Very First Store
     ($20K) 
Miscellaneous Costs (e.g., licences, fees, pre-opening labor costs, etc.) ($10K)

With your support, VIGOA will implement a business model that carries only the best products and food with an efficient and groundbreaking operation that is fair to its employees and sustains the community it is a part of. Now that's convenient!

Your support will create history,
but I’m not simply asking for donations. 
In exchange for your backing, you will
receive amazing gifts and perks, like our Free Coffee and Tea for Life! You can pre-order VIGOA's products now and be the first to enjoy them! Check them out at the right hand side of this page!
You will also receive periodic updates so you can follow our progress in 2016!

I have trained the staff before opening a store and
made sure they meet the highest standards.  I have monitored the success
of the store after it opens to make sure it generates profit.
I have increased sales 300% in just 6 months by implementing innovative marketing
strategies. 
In short, I have the necessary experience, the track

operates with the highest standards.

face is acquiring the initial funds necessary to make this leap. 

This
campaign is the crucial first step toward opening our doors. It will pave the
way to acquiring additional financing needed to continue building VIGOA's foundation and success, brick by brick.
VIGOA will revolutionize the food business in America. I invite you to be a part of this historic movement in its early stages. Every bit counts!

living by sharing this campaign with your friends using the tools in this site
(via email, social media or pure old-fashion word of mouth!) Support VIGOA and help
America welcome the New Era of Convenience Stores! Thank you so much for all your support! Now is the time!

story:
Welcome to Wandering Ravens!

My name is Kristen Lindtvedt and I am the founder of Wandering Ravens. What is Wandering Ravens you ask?  Well, Wandering Ravens was born from my experiences this past summer while on a 7800 mile, cross-country road trip with my Son during which we documented on our blog the horrific levels of poverty and homelessness we encountered in every state we traveled to; it broke our hearts, and made us angry.
​  
Our experiences on the road made me realize that as a country we must turn ourselves back toward community and look for a different way to help each other; a line of thought that ultimately birthed a question in my mind which led to an idea, "what if we could create a world in which every person struggling with poverty had the ability to make the life they wanted through other means using the corporate complex being used against us on a daily basis?”  What if, instead of the standard fast food joint and big box retailer we could create a business that didn’t put profit before all else and took greater responsibility for its own communities and committed itself not just to making a profit, but to making a difference in a sustainable way that helped people actually escape poverty and homelessness. 

As a direct result of these experiences on the road I changed the course of my life and decided to build a company that would directly help impoverished individuals. Not a charity, but a unique socially responsible, supportive, yet real-world based gift, art and craft company that provides free access to materials, training, and retail support to impoverished individuals looking to obtain the entrepreneurial skills needed to aid in the control of their own lives and futures. And on November 23 we opened our virtual doors which you can see here!

Why Wandering Ravens is Needed!

Traditional charities work hard to help alleviate the realities of poverty but they do not ultimately help people escape it. Traditional businesses do not work as in our current corporate industrial complex they are primarily focused on profit and not the human capital within.  Therefore it is time for something new, something holistic and sustainable that provides a better way to make a living, something that puts helping others be prosperous on equal footing with helping ourselves be prosperous.

What I Need to Fully Make this Dream a Reality

  1. The first steps of the Wandering Ravens mission were established when we began documenting our experiences this past summer.  By speaking out about what we saw and experienced we began to lift the veil of secrecy poverty is too often shrouded in. 
  2. The second step was to put the words into action through the formal establishment of Wandering Ravens "the company" and the establishment of our company website and online gift boutique.  I have self-funded the site, store, and core product line, as well as our first supported artist, Dorothy Walsh, who debuted as the first Wandering Ravens Featured Artist on November 23, 2015 (see her page here), but need additional funds to bring my entire dream to fruition, the creation of the physical training and studio space. 
  3. Build the studio/training center! The studio will work in conjunction with the boutique by creating a physical space where qualified individuals can access for free the, fine art and craft, writing, marketing, coaching materials, training, and the retail support they need to create unique, high-quality products that will be sold from our gift boutique. The studio will also serve as our premiere gallery space where all of the original fine art works created by our supported artists will be on display and be available for purchase directly through the artist.

The exact breakdown of how the funding from this campaign will be used to help me bridge the gap and fully fund this project is as follows:


Every Bit Helps!

Whether you can contribute directly to my campaign or spread the word by sharing it everything you can do to show support counts! It takes a collaborative effort to make any business successful and I am truly thankful for any way you choose to take part in helping Wandering Ravens succeed. 

I acknowledge these goals are lofty, but I firmly believe the Wandering Raven vision is attainable! I’m devoting my life to seeing Wandering Ravens into reality, won’t you please help me succeed by making a contribution

Thank You Gifts

All supporting contributors will receive a hand written letter of thanks and appreciation and be added to our Wandering Ravens update list.  However, as a small token of extra thanks there are several other Wandering Ravens goodies being offered as well.  On the gallery page are pictures of some of the items being offered.  Please see the Perk Levels listed on the right of the page for full details of every item being offered.

Again, THANK YOU for your support and please help us spread the word by sharing this campaign with as many people as you can!

story:
Short Summary

I am Maria Del Carmen Parra Cano, known to most as Carmen. I am married to my amazing husband Brian and together we have two beautiful little girls, Yolehua Luna and Quizani Texcohtli. In my two and a half years as a stay-at-home-mom, I have been able to grow as a person and most importantly as a wife and mother. Prior to becoming a wife and mother, I worked in the non-profit area for over 10 years. I have a Bachelor of Interdisciplinary Studies in Non-profit Administration & Sociology. During that time, I also received an Occupational Studies in Culinary Arts  Degree from Scottsdale Culinary Institute and am currently pursuing a Masters in Business Administration with an emphasis in Finance,

This past year was difficult for our family with the unexpected passing of my mother, Maria Cristina Parra. My mother was a tailor for over 40 years and brought her family to Arizona from Mexico in order to sustain her family through the art of sewing. My mother made authentic mariachi suits, outfits for ballet folklorico, wedding dresses, quinceanera dresses, and much more. Her passing not only affected her family, but hundreds of clients and community members that considered her a friend.

My mother gifted me my first ring sling which was made from Guatemalan fabric. She gave it to me prior to the birth of my first daughter and I use it DAILY!! The tradition of using a rebozo or a wrap to carry our little ones is one of rich history and has been passed down from our ancestors for centuries. Being an active babywearing mom and seeing how this tradition is such a "trend" within mainstream society, I have created Indigena as a method to continue our traditions and support women along the way.

In supporting women, I began a partnership with a collective of traditional weavers in San Juan La Laguna in Guatemala who were left to sustain their community after losing coffee crops in the area due to a hurricane. These women use traditional back-strap looms and a treadle foot looms. The collective is a member of the Fair Trade Federation.

At this point, my family has already made the initial investment of purchasing some fabrics to launch and paid membership fees to the Baby Carrier Industry Alliance. We are prepared to manufacture each item in our home. What we were not prepared for however, is the cost of sending items off to a testing facility. Though using these types of carriers have existed for centuries, the babywearing industry is highly regulated by the federal government. Part of these regulations require prototype testing prior to putting items on the market. Without testing, a business runs a huge risk of liability, fees and prosecution. 

Assisting in this project would make a huge impact to parents who need babywearing to assist them in doing housework, school work or just nurturing and caring for their little ones of all ages and backgrounds. The purchase of a wrap or ring sling would allow for sustainable support for the collective of women in Guatemala to not only continue their indigenous tradition of weaving but in feeding and supporting their families.  

What We Need

  • At this time, our project is humbly asking for your support in raising $5,000. This funding would go towards the cost of prototype testing and certification as well as the cost of graphic design, photography, and the branding and packaging of our rings slings and wraps.
  • If we do not reach our goal in the time allowed, we will decrease our number of items set to launch and do the best we can with the funds we do receive.

Not only is our project commemorating an amazing woman, mother and artist, this project allows for the traditions of weaving, sewing and babywearing to continue.  

 
  • This project will assist my family in commemorating my mother as well as support an indigenous (Mexica/Izkaloteka) woman owned initiative.
  • There are many companies that use our images and culturally appropriate babywearing as their own, leaving out our indigenous history and traditions. Our goal is to continue educating mothers and families to be able to reaffirm their indigenous history as well as educate fathers and partners in learning how to carry their children like their mothers do.

Our main challenge would be not having the funds needed to launch our line by the end of January 2016. Our family will continue to make sacrifices in order to make this project work.

Can't contribute? It's okay, please share our campaign and help us spread the word. Use the Indiegogo share tools and help us make some noise!!

story:
Breve reseña

Soy Hernando Gaviria, felizmente casado, con 3 hijos, ingeniero de petróleos con amplia experiencia en el sector petrolero. Desde hace muchos años me he dado cuenta de que mi carrera me encanta, pero la cocina y el trabajo social me apasionan. Hace dos meses, a raíz de la crisis petrolera por la caída de los precios, fui despedido sin justa causa de la empresa donde trabajaba hacía ya casi 8 años y más que ver esta situación como preocupante y con pesimismo, creo que se me ha abierto una oportunidad para trabajar en mis pasiones.

  • Adicionalmente, creo que este es el momento para hacer una labor social importante y es brindarle trabajo a las poblaciones desplazadas y a los actores del post-conflicto colombiano. Colombia ha vivido por más de cincuenta años una guerra entre grupos alzados en armas y el Gobierno legítimo democrático, lo que ha causado desolación en el campo, poblaciones enteras desplazadas de sus territorios para llegar a las grandes ciudades a vivir en la miseria, después de haberlo tenido todo en su territorio.
  • Mi amor por los programas de contenido social me impulsaron a trabajar en proyectos como el de la seguridad vial escolar, como consecuencia de una tragedia acontecida en 2004 en Bogotá, en la cual murieron 21 niños y un adulto por falta de legislación vial en mi país.
  • Por otra parte, en mi infancia y posteriormente en mi adolescencia disfruté mucho de las delicias gastronómicas de mi abuelo, especialmente unos pinchos que eran sencillamente deliciosos y unas arepas rellenas espectaculares. Estos platos se convirtieron en necesarios dentro de mi círculo de amigos, los cuales siempre me persuadían para que convenciera a mi abuelo de hacer asados, brindando los pinchos y las arepas como plato central. En honor a él, quiero sacar a la venta estos productos, pues creo que la buena comida no debe ser para unos círculos sociales pequeños, sino que se debe difundir en poblaciones enteras.
  • Mi sueño consiste en poder combinar estas 2 actividades: labor social y comida, para generar trabajo y vender comida deliciosa.
  • He observado que los municipios de Cundinamarca (Colombia) como Cota, Chía, Cajicá, Tabio, Tenjo y Zipaquirá, entre otras, carecen de sitios para comerse un buen pincho, una buena arepa rellena y una buena salchicha alemana. Por lo general, hay muchos establecimientos para comer hamburguesas, chorizos y pizzas, pero no para lo anterior. Con la ayuda que ustedes me puedan brindar, podré, no solamente hacer mi sueño realidad, brindando productos de óptima calidad, fabricados con las mejores carnes de res y de cerdo, maduradas cuidadosamente, sino hacerle un tributo a mi abuelo.
  • Su ayuda es fundamental para poder llevar a cabo una labor social de grandes magnitudes al resocializar poblaciones desplazadas y actores del post-conflicto colombiano.

Requiero financiación para tomar en arriendo locales en las diversas poblaciones mencionadas, así como también para food trucks pequeños que puedan atender las necesidades en festivales escolares, ferias, fiestas, etc. Cada food truck tiene un costo aproximado de 15 millones de pesos (USD 5.000) y estoy pensando en construir 5, más la financiación del arriendo por dos meses de 4 locales en las poblaciones antes mencionadas. Por lo anterior estamos hablando de cien millones de pesos (USD 35.000) aproximadamente. Concretando lo anterior, le estaré dando trabajo aproximadamente a 20 actores del post-conflicto colombiano.

Las personas que financien mi proyecto recibirán una certificación de haber contribuido con brindarle empleo a personal, tanto desmovilizado, como desplazado, del conflicto armado colombiano y descuento especial del 15% durante tres meses en cualquiera de los puntos de venta Don Mele.

Los fondos serán destinados a entidades sin ánimo de lucro que apoyen el post-conflicto y el proceso de paz en Colombia.

El impacto

Mi proyecto es valioso pues contribuye con la solución de una problemática social a mediano plazo debido a que gran cantidad de desmovilizados y desplazados tendrán necesidad de trabajar y la gran mayoría de los ciudadanos prefieren hacerse al margen del problema, queriendo dejar en manos del Gobierno la solución de la generación de empleo. Nosotros debemos ser parte de la solución pues esta población no tendrá muchas oportunidades de trabajo.

A la fecha no he tenido un historial con proyectos como este

Mis dos grandes pasiones siempre han sido la cocina y la labor social y creo que esta es una excelente oportunidad: generación de empleo a personas con una problemática social muy complicada, viendo crecer un negocio que me apasiona.

Riesgos y desafíos

 Los riesgos más relevantes son:

      • Ventas insuficientes que no permitan el punto de equilibrio, como consecuencia de algunos factores, entre ellos:
        • Mala escogencia del punto de venta.
        • Que el producto no le guste a la gente.
        • Competencia desleal.
        • Error en los márgenes que impidan el crecimiento.
        • Error en los precios, de acuerdo con el estrato social de la zona.

Para superar estos obstáculos voy a trabajar en:

      • Análisis de mercado sobre los puntos de venta, estableciendo el flujo de personas que transitan diariamente por el sector.
      • Encuestas para determinar las razones por las cuales el producto no gusta (si eso sucediera)
      • Analizar el medio para establecer acuerdos que nos permitan ganar a todos los competidores del sector
      • Revisión financiera permanente para llevar un control detallado de ventas y del estado de pérdidas y ganancias. Control estricto de los deberes ante los entes gubernamentales.
      • Estudio para determinar un precio justo en la zona donde esté instalado.

El primer trimestre de 2016 me dedicaré a cotizar locales y food trucks para montar los negocios de comidas.

  • En paraleo publicaré avisos para conseguir personal que cumpla con las condiciones sociales descritas anteriormente. Esto lo pienso llevar a cabo a través de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chía y las demás alcaldías vecinas en donde tenga las posibilidades de montar un "Don Mele" 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si tú no me puedes colaborar con fondos, es probable que si te gusta mi sueño, me puedas ayudar con la difusión por las redes sociales. Si tienes un negocio, lo puedas promocionar en él o me puedas ayudar con la elaboración de publicidad que se pueda distribuir en las calles de mi ciudad.
story_txt:
Breve reseña Soy Hernando
Gaviria, felizmente casado, con 3 hijos, ingeniero de petróleos con amplia
experiencia en el sector petrolero. Desde hace muchos años me he dado cuenta de
que mi carrera me encanta, pero la cocina y el trabajo social me apasionan.
Hace dos meses, a raíz de la crisis petrolera por la caída de los precios, fui
despedido sin justa causa de la empresa donde trabajaba hacía ya casi 8 años y
más que ver esta situación como preocupante y con pesimismo, creo que se me ha
abierto una oportunidad para trabajar en mis pasiones. 
Adicionalmente, creo que
este es el momento para hacer una labor social importante y es brindarle
trabajo a las poblaciones desplazadas y a los actores del post-conflicto
colombiano. Colombia ha vivido por más de cincuenta años una guerra entre
grupos alzados en armas y el Gobierno legítimo democrático, lo que ha causado
desolación en el campo, poblaciones enteras desplazadas de sus territorios para
llegar a las grandes ciudades a vivir en la miseria, después de haberlo tenido
todo en su territorio. Mi amor por los
programas de contenido social me impulsaron a trabajar en proyectos como el de
la seguridad vial escolar, como consecuencia de una tragedia acontecida en 2004
en Bogotá, en la cual murieron 21 niños y un adulto por falta de legislación
vial en mi país.
Por otra parte,
en mi infancia y posteriormente en mi adolescencia disfruté mucho de las
delicias gastronómicas de mi abuelo, especialmente unos pinchos que eran
sencillamente deliciosos y unas arepas rellenas espectaculares. Estos platos
se convirtieron en necesarios dentro de mi círculo de amigos, los cuales siempre me
persuadían para que convenciera a mi abuelo de hacer asados, brindando los
pinchos y las arepas como plato central. En honor a él, quiero sacar a la venta estos
productos, pues creo que la buena comida no debe ser para unos círculos sociales
pequeños, sino que se debe difundir en poblaciones enteras.
Mi sueño
consiste en poder combinar estas 2 actividades: labor social y comida, para
generar trabajo y vender comida deliciosa.
He observado
que los municipios de Cundinamarca (Colombia) como Cota, Chía, Cajicá, Tabio, Tenjo y Zipaquirá,
entre otras, carecen de sitios para comerse un buen pincho, una buena arepa rellena y una buena salchicha alemana. Por lo general, hay
muchos establecimientos para comer hamburguesas, chorizos y pizzas, pero no
para lo anterior. Con la ayuda
que ustedes me puedan brindar, podré, no solamente hacer mi sueño realidad, brindando
productos de óptima calidad, fabricados con las mejores carnes de res y de
cerdo, maduradas cuidadosamente, sino hacerle un tributo a mi abuelo. 
Su ayuda
es fundamental para poder llevar a cabo una labor social de grandes magnitudes
al resocializar poblaciones desplazadas y actores del post-conflicto
colombiano. 

 Requiero financiación para tomar en arriendo
locales en las diversas poblaciones mencionadas, así como también para food trucks pequeños que puedan atender
las necesidades en festivales escolares, ferias, fiestas, etc. Cada food truck tiene un costo aproximado de
15 millones de pesos (USD 5.000) y estoy pensando en construir 5, más la
financiación del arriendo por dos meses de 4 locales en las poblaciones antes
mencionadas. Por lo anterior estamos hablando de cien millones de pesos (USD
35.000) aproximadamente. Concretando lo anterior, le estaré dando trabajo
aproximadamente a 20 actores del post-conflicto colombiano.Las personas que financien mi proyecto recibirán
una certificación de haber contribuido con brindarle empleo a personal, tanto 
desmovilizado, como desplazado, del conflicto armado colombiano y descuento especial del 15%
durante tres meses en cualquiera de los puntos de venta Don Mele.Los fondos
serán destinados a entidades sin ánimo de lucro que apoyen el post-conflicto y
el proceso de paz en Colombia.
    El impacto Mi proyecto es
valioso pues contribuye con la solución de una problemática social a mediano
plazo debido a que gran cantidad de desmovilizados y desplazados tendrán
necesidad de trabajar y la gran mayoría de los ciudadanos prefieren hacerse al
margen del problema, queriendo dejar en manos del Gobierno la solución de la
generación de empleo. Nosotros debemos ser parte de la solución pues esta
población no tendrá muchas oportunidades de trabajo.
 A la fecha no he tenido un historial con
proyectos como este
Mis dos grandes pasiones siempre han sido la
cocina y la labor social y creo que esta es una excelente oportunidad:
generación de empleo a personas con una problemática social muy complicada,
viendo crecer un negocio que me apasiona.    Riesgos y desafíos  Los riesgos más
relevantes son: 



Ventas
       insuficientes que no permitan el punto de equilibrio, como consecuencia
       de algunos factores, entre ellos:

Mala escogencia
        del punto de venta.
Que el producto
        no le guste a la gente.
Competencia
        desleal.
Error en los márgenes
        que impidan el crecimiento.
Error en los
        precios, de acuerdo con el estrato social de la zona.




  Para superar
estos obstáculos voy a trabajar en:



Análisis de
       mercado sobre los puntos de venta, estableciendo el flujo de personas
       que transitan diariamente por el sector.
Encuestas para
       determinar las razones por las cuales el producto no gusta (si eso
       sucediera)
Analizar el medio
       para establecer acuerdos que nos permitan ganar a todos los competidores
       del sector
Revisión
       financiera permanente para llevar un control detallado de ventas y del
       estado de pérdidas y ganancias. Control estricto de los deberes ante los
       entes gubernamentales.
Estudio para
       determinar un precio justo en la zona donde esté instalado.



 El primer trimestre de 2016 me dedicaré a cotizar locales y food trucks para montar los negocios de comidas. 
En paraleo publicaré avisos para conseguir personal que cumpla con las condiciones sociales descritas anteriormente. Esto lo pienso llevar a cabo a través de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chía y las demás alcaldías vecinas en donde tenga las posibilidades de montar un "Don Mele"     Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar  Si tú no me puedes colaborar con fondos, es
probable que si te gusta mi sueño, me puedas ayudar con la difusión por las
redes sociales. Si tienes un negocio, lo puedas promocionar en él o me puedas
ayudar con la elaboración de publicidad que se pueda distribuir en las calles
de mi ciudad.

story:
Short Story About My And                 My Company           

  

''My name is Andrey and I’m owner of ‘’AnDi International’’ which is food trading company established in January 2015 in United Arab Emirates.

 When I open the company, my idea was just to get the visa for UAE.

My plan was buying and selling cars, not food ,but I found out this business is too difficult for me , because i have to invest and close a lot of money on cars which i don't have.
By the time I met different people and friends who already have successful business, and they advise me a lot of things which I can do with my activity on this company. So i start searching for products which i can import in UAE, then I found a lot of products, but after all the calculation for transport, custom duty and other charges I get disappointed and I was ready to close this company and go back to my country.  
One day I met a friend who show me the Honey Spoon ,and from that time I'm in love whit this product. It's so nice and practical for the Hotels, Restaurants ,Coffee shops  and  Big Companies  which daily are drinking Coffee, Tea and other hot drinks.            

I'm new in this business and my vision for future development on my company ,to sell my product not only in UAE 

Currently I 'm running crowd funding campaign in ‘’ Indiegogo.com ‘’to sell my product all over the world .

If you want be part of my campaign , and  contribute amount of your choice, for making my dream to become a live and share my link with others . ''

For any questions contact me on :

E-mail : AnDi-Group@hotmail.com

Mob : +971553692393

'

My Mission and Vision

MISSION:
 - To create and develop an environmentally-natural products with less cost with high nutrition.

VISION:
Be a world-class company which will stand out without compromising  the nature is human-friendly in nature.


          What is Beekeeping ?


Beekeeping is one of the most ancient human professions .Bee families are raised in all parts of the World. There is an official information for around 50 Mill. Registered families in the Planet. The various and rich honey-giving vegetation in the Balkan Peninsula and mostly in Bulgaria , gives an excellent conditions for beekeeping. 


   Where The Organic Honey Is                       Produced ?

Bulgaria is one of the EU countries with the highest absorption of funds under the                                           Program for development of beekeeping.

      There are 1700 bee societies now in Bulgaria with around 100 000 organized beekeepers and over 800 000 bee families . In the past years here were produced 11-12 000 T. Honey per year. These achievements of our beekeeping are result from           the traditions in beekeeping during the centuries , due to favorable nature conditions in our country , to the favorable hard work and efforts of beekeepers and                                                                   specialists .


      Be Part Of My Production        

  • We will be the first company to introduce The Honey Spoon in UAE which is to replace the traditional method of bottled honey and sticky hands. The Spoons of honey are small in size with limited quantity which is easy to carry, can be used & throw also affordable too .

story:
ZOE & JO’S MISSION

Our Mission is to teach as many children as possible self-rescue in the water. These specialised skills will aid babies and children to orient themselves in the water and self rescue.

Our intention is to help prevent the tragedy of drowning through education, training and fun, and help those around the world who would otherwise not have the opportunity to learn these skills.

Our training program will also enable other adults to become practitioners and share these skills within their community.

We intend to set up our business, Children Of The Water, in Ibiza. We will then take our skills to remote areas of the world to train adults to set up their own Children Of The Water schools.

SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM

No family should be denied the opportunity to learn The Children Of The Water self rescue skills. Therefore we aim to offer as many scholarships to families who can not afford the program. Will aim to do this through donations & fundraising and wonderful sites such as this.

THE PROBLEM

More than two persons every minute die from drowning every year around the globe. From that more than 50 per cent are children, including children who can swim.

Drowning can occur in as little as 1 inch of water. A child will lose consciousness approximately 2 minutes after submersion. Irreversible brain damage occurs after 4-6 minutes. Watching your children is not enough to protect them from every hazardous water situation. Teaching children survival swimming skills provides an extra layer of protection. Learning to roll onto their backs and float unassisted is crucial for survival. 

HOW CAN CHILDREN OF THE WATER HELP?

Babies and young children from the age of 6 months (crawling) up to 6 years learn to survive through this specialised course when falling in the water unexpectedly. Children will learn how to relax, float and control their breathing even while being in a stressful situation, such as falling in the water without their parents or supervisor present.

What do the children learn?

Infants six months (crawling) to twelve months can learn to:

  * hold their breath in the water
  * float, relax and breathe until rescued by an adult
  * perform these skills fully clothed

Some infants may even learn to propel a short distance through the water between two parents. Learning these skills takes approximately 16-20 lessons, depending on the capabilities of your child.

Children who are walking (starting from 1 years old until as old as 6 years) can learn to:

  * hold their breath in the water
  * swim with their face in the water to a safe place/parent
  * roll over onto their back when they need to breathe
  * flip back onto their tummy to continue to swim until reaching there destination.
  * perform these skills fully clothed

Learning these skills takes approximately 16 to 24 lessons, depending on the capabilities of the child. Lessons are one -on - one and app. 10-15 minutes each

How you teach a baby who cannot talk:

Swimming and floating are motor skills that are taught through repetitive exercise, along with gentle verbal encouragement. We will show them what we want them to do, and over a short period of time, they will learn the skills necessary to survive. Don't worry! We will not throw your baby/toddler into the water! We will use a variety of methods, combining the best ideas from swim schools, infant/toddler programs throughout the world.

Our goal is to make learning fun so that your child will love being in the water!

WHAT WE HAVE

What we have is two very passionate mums who cant wait to get started and teach as many children possible around the world these amazing life saving skills.
We have a waiting list of at least 50 people ready to participate on the course and besides them thousands of children in underpriviliged countries who we can help prevent from possible drowning. 

WHAT WE NEED?

We are looking for 15.000 Euros. The money will be used for teaching children around the world, on the scholarship program. This will give as many children, who cannot afford this course, the opportunity to partake in our Children Of The Water Self Rescue Course. 

OUR OBSTACLE

Our only obstacle is money. Not every family can afford to participate. With your help we can offer spaces on the Scholarship Program.

WHAT WILL YOU RECEIVE?

1    EUR   We will send you lots of smiles and gratitude!!!
30 EUR You will receive a branded Children Of The Water T-shirt
50 EUR  2x Hypnotherapy sessions by Jo on the island worth 180 EUR
100 EUR  5 x private yoga classes on the island by Zoë worth 250 EUR 
1000 2 free Self rescue courses on the island worth & a Children Of The water branded T- Shirt worth  1230 EUR or;
1000 VIP Sponsor website for your business logo for one year & a mention on all our social media outlets
5000 Will allow Zoë & Jo to travel to underprivileged countries to teach as many children as possible these life saving skills. This our dream and you will receive enormous gratitude from all over the world!

THE IMPACT

Anyone that has experienced a family member or friends death through drowning, knows the devastating effect it causes. As adults it is our duty to teach our children safe practice in the water. Being able to swim is of course essential, however to teach our children techniques that could potentially save there life is their right to be taught. Furthermore, children who do not have the opportunity to have swimming lessons or access to these specialised techniques, we will make it our mission to raise the money to offer as many free spaces as possible. We want to make sure that these techniques are accessible to people who may not otherwise have access to them.

Zoë & Jo are two mothers based in Ibiza. We have children who are 3 and 4 years old and we have both experienced near drowning experiences with our children. On both occasions we were supervising our children. Drowning in a pool can happen so fast, so quietly. This is what led Zoe to undertake this course some years ago with her then 2 1/2 son Nui. At 4 years old, he is now a very confident swimmer and has learnt the skills of survival in the water so that if an accident occurred, panic is reduced and the skills would be cognitively put into practice. 

We have complete faith that this business will be a huge success due to its nature and demand from parents to safe guard their children in and near water.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you could help us in anyway you can, by sharing our crowd funding page, to help us realise our dreams of setting up this much needed business, to help save lives, we would be so grateful.

story:
Hi, I'm Laura!

Please help fund my yoga teacher training! 

Yoga is inclusive in philosophy and can be transformative and healing but is often inaccessible or unwelcoming for those with mental health issues and suffering from emotional distress. It is those times that yoga practice can be the most beneficial and helpful in achieving wellness of mind and body. 

  • I've been practicing yoga for 3 years and have been through a lot of life changes during this time. With a mindful practice, I am healing from personal trauma and loss that I've experienced. I would like to help others do the same! 
  • I have worked extensively in supporting women and families through the perinatal year, those suffering from a variety of mental health issues, as well as children and adults seeking accessible space for community. 
  • I want to create inclusive, gentle, safe, LGBTQ inclusive, transfriendly space that is free of racism, ableism, ageism, sexism, and other barriers to inclusion. My classes will provide a focused practice accessible for all and designed for those dealing with stress and anxiety, loss, and grief. Support will be offered for those with emotional pain and trauma that has been opened or unlocked and special care will be given to fluctuation of emotional states during the practice itself. 

What I Need & What You Get

Want to help out? Here are the details...
  • I am looking to raise $1250 to help me pay for my teacher training. The training that I am interested in is from the South Okanagan Yoga Association (SOYA) and is taught by two instructors from Prince George. They also teach at and own Chinook Yoga Studio, so by supporting my training, you'll be supporting four local businesses! 
  • My campaign perks are super fun! Not all are yoga-centric and include handknits, chocolate, tarot card readings, and more! Everyone will get a thank-you card, and a free yoga class! If you don't live in Prince George, your class spot will be donated to a local non profit. 
  • Perks that are purchased before December 22nd can be ready and delivered in time for Christmas! Be sure to include a note that you'd like to give a perk as a gift. 
  • If I don't reach my goal, funds will still go to support my teacher training! It may however delay my training until the SOYA Teacher Training is offered next year. 

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference: 

  • Yoga is community. The personal benefits of yoga practice are undeniable though yoga remains inaccessible to many who live with anxiety, stress, loss, and effects of trauma. Creating safe space in yoga where everyone is supported and can practice freely is vital to the health of a community. 
  • Creating safe space is something that I do everyday in my ongoing work of community development as well as previous work providing support to those dealing with mental health issues, loss, and trauma. I will bring these skills to my teachings and offer an open and inclusive space for everyone to practice. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That's ok, I get it. 

  • Please send along the campaign link and tell your friends to contribute! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word! 
  • Send me a message if you want to contribute to my campaign in another way. 

Thanks friend, 

xo Laura

Hi, I'm Laura! Please help fund my yoga teacher training! 
Yoga is inclusive in philosophy and can be transformative and healing but is often inaccessible or unwelcoming for those with mental health issues and suffering from emotional distress. It is those times that yoga practice can be the most beneficial and helpful in achieving wellness of mind and body.   I've been practicing yoga for 3 years and have been through a lot of life changes during this time. With a mindful practice, I am healing from personal trauma and loss that I've experienced. I would like to help others do the same! 
I have worked extensively in supporting women and families through the perinatal year, those suffering from a variety of mental health issues, as well as children and adults seeking accessible space for community. 
I want to create inclusive, gentle, safe, LGBTQ inclusive, transfriendly space that is free of racism, ableism, ageism, sexism, and other barriers to inclusion. My classes will provide a focused practice accessible for all and designed for those dealing with stress and anxiety, loss, and grief. Support will be offered for those with emotional pain and trauma that has been opened or unlocked and special care will be given to fluctuation of emotional states during the practice itself. 
   What I Need & What You Get
Want to help out? Here are the details...  I am looking to raise $1250 to help me pay for my teacher training. The training that I am interested in is from the South Okanagan Yoga Association (SOYA) and is taught by two instructors from Prince George. They also teach at and own Chinook Yoga Studio, so by supporting my training, you'll be supporting four local businesses!  My campaign perks are super fun! Not all are yoga-centric and include handknits, chocolate, tarot card readings, and more! Everyone will get a thank-you card, and a free yoga class! If you don't live in Prince George, your class spot will be donated to a local non profit. 
Perks that are purchased before December 22nd can be ready and delivered in time for Christmas! Be sure to include a note that you'd like to give a perk as a gift.  If I don't reach my goal, funds will still go to support my teacher training! It may however delay my training until the SOYA Teacher Training is offered next year.     The Impact Your contribution will make a difference:   Yoga is community. The personal benefits of yoga practice are undeniable though yoga remains inaccessible to many who live with anxiety, stress, loss, and effects of trauma. Creating safe space in yoga where everyone is supported and can practice freely is vital to the health of a community.  Creating safe space is something that I do everyday in my ongoing work of community development as well as previous work providing support to those dealing with mental health issues, loss, and trauma. I will bring these skills to my teachings and offer an open and inclusive space for everyone to practice. 


    Other Ways You Can Help Can't contribute? That's ok, I get it.   Please send along the campaign link and tell your friends to contribute!  Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word! 
Send me a message if you want to contribute to my campaign in another way. 

Thanks friend, xo Laura

story:
In a Nutshell

Hey y'all! I'm a west coast gal who now resides in Charlotte, NC. This business idea/dream/goal has been building for years and it's finally the time to make it happen! The last couple of years I've been working for a food truck/catering company, and I've learned a lot about the mobile food industry and operating a small business. 

I plan to convert a 1965 Airstream trailer into a space that is part coffee bar and part boutique space. You may have seen coffee trucks and you may have seen fashion trucks. I basically want to combine the 2 into 1. Because of the confined space, the coffee bar will be more simplistic (think drip, pour overs, cold brew, tea) and the retail side will include both local and global items, such as accessories, artwork, jewelry, candles, and gifts. 

There are so many unique items in this world that you can't find at the chain stores, and I want to be an avenue for amazing designers/artisans to share their creations. Some pieces will be fair trade items made by human trafficking survivors and some from those crafty (yet legit) people we all know and wish were on Etsy.

I don't believe I was made to do all of this on my own and so I'm inviting YOU to be a part of a project that hasn't been done before. Both exciting and scary? Yes. Will I forever regret if I don't try? Yes.

What's Needed

Here's the breakdown of numbers to make Urbean come to life! 

$4,000 - Airstream trailer 

$20,000 - Airstream renovations & outfitting

$2,000 - Initial retail inventory

$3,000 - Coffee equipment & initial inventory of coffee/supplies


The Impact

Being an avenue for artisans to display their talent and a place for quality coffee makes me really excited and I hope you as well since you're a part of the whole operation!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other alternatives if you're not able to give at this time. You can use your influential voice to share with your close buds and people you think would believe in this project. There's even Indiegogo share tools that make it pretty simple.

Lastly...THANK YOU if you've made it this far. It means a lot to know I'm not alone in this!

story:
We are Dash and Chauncey Tudhope-Locklear. Very soon we will push off on our bicycles and start heading east on the greatest adventure of our lives. From the seat of our bicycles, we will be making a two and half month journey across America. We’ll be covering approx. 3,500+ miles following a variation of what is commonly known as the Northern Tier Route. We’ll be nearly hugging the Canadian border until we come to the great lakes, where we will head north and travel through Canada towards New York. From there, we’ll head south to end our trip in Washington D.C. It won’t be easy, but how do you grow as a person in this world if you don’t challenge yourself and live a little dangerously? We both crave the freedom and aliveness that comes from going on an epic trip like this.

Thank you for checking out this video and for considering donating to our trip. We are very excited about this, not only because it's fun but also because we believe in cycling as a powerful tool for social change. Cycling not only gets you to exercise, it helps reduce your carbon footprint by limiting your consumption of fossil fuels. We created this video as a way of connecting people to our adventure and to also ask for your contribution to make our trip happen. Lot's of time and effort has gone into creating this opportunity for ourselves. We have spent thousands of dollars on gear, including revamping our bicycles to have the capacity to go on a 3,500+ mile journey. Your contributions will help us pay for food, lodging, and our return flight home. 

One of the unique challenges of a cross country bike tour is figuring out where to camp. We will be looking to camp for free most nights. Camping for free can save a lot of money. It’s much harder to plan a days ride when you’re limited by places you have to pay to set up a tent. This means we’ll be employing certain tactics for finding a safe and adequate place to sleep every night. We love not knowing exactly where we’re going to sleep. It makes the day so much more interesting because we have to trust that it will work out. Some nights, we’ll knock on doors and ask to camp on lawns. Other nights, we’ll wander onto a piece of land and pitch our tent, hoping we aren’t discovered by ornery landowners. Unlike sleeping in a hotel or hopping from one state park to the next, we’ll have the opportunity to make unlikely connections and to sleep in places that are raw and untapped. This is how we want to do it.

This is a unique opportunity for us to connect with nature, animals, and our fellow human beings along the way. What better adventure than for us to travel this great country together and discover first hand what this place looks like from behind a pair of handlebars? Our community has taught us so much, especially how important is is to stay connected to ourselves, the people in our lives, and the world around us. We are inspired and we feel your support and the knowledge and wisdom so many of you have passed on. We hope you decide to get involved! 

With deep gratitude and love, 

Chauncey and Dash 

2016

Follow Dash:

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/dash_across_the_usa/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dash.tudhopelocklear

story:
BeYouID is an application that creates a safe environment for dating or for anyone that cares about their safety. Our software can be used online or offline allowing members to select their level of privacy and verification. As a member, you will provide information and we will cross reference it with other sources to corroborate its validity, allowing potential matches to know if there is a mutual interest. Your friends can give testimonials, if you choose. You will also need to record a video of yourself. We firmly believe that watching a video of someone will help to determine the potential of a match and avoid an awkward moment. Once you decide to go on a date, you will be able to use our safety features to set an alert that will let someone you trust know where you are going and with whom, in case the alert goes off. Also, there is a panic button that the member can press to send a prewritten message to an emergency contact, including the exact location of the member. 

If you are not dating but going to college or traveling, this app can help you to be safe while you are getting familiar with new places, meeting new friends, or just wanting to make sure you get home safe. Once you fill out the emergency contact information, you will be able to preset times when you need to check back on the app and if you fail to do so, we will send an alert to your designated contact containing your last activity. If you happen to be in a life-threatening situation, you can press the Panic button that will let your emergency contact know exactly where you are. Once the Panic button has been activated, it can’t be disabled by you, only by your contact. 

Basic account that includes: 

  • Comes with a free 1-month trial. 
  • Requires personal information such as: name, location, date of birth, ethnicity, height, religion, education, kids, smoking, drinking, and job title. 
  • Ability to add testimonials. 
  • Option to verify their age with DL/ID. 
  • Ability to record a video for verification purposes. 
  • Tracking system and ability to share a video verification with friends. 
  • Panic Button.

Our app is already built but we decided to present it to this platform so we can have more people looking at our product and see their feedback. Our app is not a dating platform, viewers/members can’t look for people and has no matching capability. This is a safety app for daters and people that are concerned about their safety. 

As the CEO, and someone who has used online dating for the last few years, I felt that I was never in charge of my safety and dating experience. For these reasons, I created BeYouID to give myself control and  piece of mind. I hope with this app we can save women from becoming a victim of a crime or just another statistic. Love questions! if you have any or suggestions, please don’t hesite it to shoot me an email. info@beyouid.com 

Thank you so much!

story:
Hello, fellow earthlings!

I’m Jack.

I’ll bet that a lot of you are unhappy with the condition of our planet, but you might wish that you could do something to help and don’t know where to start. Or, you may believe that even if you could do something, that you couldn’t possibly do enough to warrant the effort.

Well, you can do something that matters, right now, and if we all do this one thing together, we can make a huge difference.

I myself have been thinking about this for a long while, and I, too, once thought that there was nothing that I could do to make a significant difference. Let me tell you what changed.

Earth-Friendly Solutions Are On the Rise - And For Good Reason

My family and I were in a big box store recently and were very impressed with what we saw. They had converted almost half of their cleaning solution department to plant-based solutions. That put a huge smile on my face!

Then, I realized that this was huge. If an entire chain of stores is doing this, then that makes a tremendous impact. I then began researching plant-based, earth-friendly products and services only to find that most of the world is still trying to catch up and do their part in cleaning up the planet and reversing the damages that we’ve caused.

Asking myself, “What can I do?” – I’d come to a conclusion. I built, managed, and consulted for the car wash industry for around 30 years. It is a fact that there are zero real earth-friendly car washes in the U.S. or anywhere else. There are car washes that are labeled as green since they recycle 40% to 70% of their water, but that’s only a small step in the right direction.

What I’ve decided is to do something for the car wash industry that will make a much more significant green impact.

Only a very small percentage of car wash chemicals are even biodegradable. Most are caustic and dangerous to our environment’s health and our own!

So, here’s my plan. I am committing to build truly earth-friendly car washes starting here in my state of Arizona, followed by washes throughout the west coast. I think that’s a great start, and the sky’s the limit. These will be wholly green-built, net zero-energy car washes using all earth-friendly resources that are available to us. These include recycled tunnel water, rainwater reclamation, solar energy from solar panels, as well as passive solar energy, state-of-the art low voltage and low energy-consuming car wash equipment, geothermal heating and air-conditioning, and much more.

Additionally, we are developing new plant-based, earth-friendly car wash solutions alongside environmental science researchers. Once we’ve perfected these wash solutions, we’ll make them available to anyone that wants to make a real difference by using them.

Welcome to Planet Earth Car Wash and Solutions.

Together, we’re going to do our part to save the planet in a big way, one car wash at a time.

So, this is where you come in. In order to make this happen, we need your help. On the road to bringing in interested big-time investors, we need to accomplish a few small feats first. I’m asking you to help Planet Earth Car Wash and Solutions raise money so that we can pay an architect to create a site drawing of our first car wash sitting on the site where it will be built. Then, we’ll need to order investor packets that contain our mission statement, business plan, site drawing, and more.

So, we’re asking for your help in raising this initial money. We’re asking for $5,000, and if you are gracious enough to help us achieve this goal, then we’ll see how much further we can go together.

With the launch of this Indiegogo campaign, you have the opportunity to be one of our very first investors, and we won’t let you leave with just the contentment of knowing that you’re supporting a worthwhile cause. Those who donate to the cause will receive some very nice rewards, including free wash packages & memberships, personal thank-yous, and your name on a plaque dedicated to donors that will hang in our first car wash once it’s up and running.

We’re humbled that you’re here and are considering becoming a part of our Planet Earth family. Thank you for your time and your donations. Together, we can make a big difference.

-Jack 

 

Special thanks to Kellan Doyle for the Planet Earth Car Wash logo.

story:
Overview

Shortstown has come a long way and when our family  moved here we felt such a strong community sense. When our first son was born we began to feel like there was nowhere to meet in town, even though we were able to make so many friends. We felt that community here  strives to meet  through social clubs, but mostly outside or in the village hall and that is not always open and not available for regular meet ups. 

Friendly Nettle Cafe is striving to become a cafe that brings the Shortstown community together. Our dream is to create a social place where people from all walks of life can meet and connect in a variety of activities such as crafts, music events, and book clubs. We are creating something special for kids here as well!

Our Story

Ok, I (Rasa) have been dreaming about a community cafe for a while (over 8 years to be precise), way before moving into Shortstown and marrying Joni. Of course back then it wasn’t really possible to open a cafe, so I started blogging instead. I thought to create a virtual space for crafters of all sorts though only partially successful (not very high tech over here). However I still enjoy writing stories about makes and bakes. So yeah! I love crafting, knitting, crochet, sewing, and more, and trying out new hobbies. Therefore expect the new cafe be very crafty, but not exclusive to crafters (We welcome all).

Joni is a very supportive husband. Very helpful to everyone, hands on sort of guy. He also loves the local community and earlier this year he became a parish councillor to serve Shortstown. Anyways he’s also an aerospace systems engineer by trade and very high tech (very useful for website building and more). His technical knowledge has been very useful in obtaining all the planning permissions for the cafe as well as creating wonderful floor plans and so much more. Basically is a great asset to the company and to our family!

What We Already Have

We have been very lucky to secure medium sized commercial property next to other local shops including Tesco, pharmacy and fish and chip shop. It's large enough for kids corner, local events, gatherings and more! Currently it is in the shell form meaning it does not even have windows, floors, electric wiring and so much more. So you can imagine, it is huge investment for us. Luckily 30% of initial budget has been given to us by family and 70% have been loaned.

What We Need

Sadly as soon as we started works and getting more detailed quotes,  we realised we are 15% short even though we are doing as much of cafe fit out as we can ourselves. Which is why we will need to sacrifice all of the money reserved for stock and initial cashflow, but even after spending all that we will be about 10K short. This is why we need your help. 

What You Get

In addition to supporter rewards, all supporters will be personally recognised and thanked for their contribution to this project. Without you, this wouldn't be possible.

You will also be the first to hear on updates, and invited to give input into shop development through opportunities for feedback.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone will be able to give, but I'd still love your support.

  • Share our campaign on social media 
  • Donate unwanted furniture, toys and equipment suitable for cafe (donations will be selected)
  • Help us out with painting, decorating etc (volunteers will be selected)
  • Come and visit us when we open!

Thank you for reading, sharing, giving and supporting.

His technical knowledge has been very useful in obtaining all the planning permissions for the cafe as well as creating wonderful floor plans and so much more. Basically is a great asset to the company and to our family!
What We Already Have

We have been very lucky to secure medium sized commercial property next to other local shops including Tesco, pharmacy and fish and chip shop. It's large enough for kids corner, local events, gatherings and more! Currently it is in the shell form meaning it does not even have windows, floors, electric wiring and so much more. So you can imagine, it is huge investment for us. Luckily 30% of initial budget has been given to us by family and 70% have been loaned.
What We Need
Sadly as soon as we started works and getting more detailed quotes,  we realised we are 15% short even though we are doing as much of cafe fit out as we can ourselves. Which is why we will need to sacrifice all of the money reserved for stock and initial cashflow, but even after spending all that we will be about 10K short. This is why we need your help. 
What You Get

In addition to supporter rewards, all supporters will be personally recognised and thanked for their contribution to this project. Without you, this wouldn't be possible.
You will also be the first to hear on updates, and invited to give input into shop development through opportunities for feedback.

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that not everyone will be able to give, but I'd still love your support.

Share our campaign on social media 
Donate unwanted furniture, toys and equipment suitable for cafe (donations will be selected)
Help us out with painting, decorating etc (volunteers will be selected)
Come and visit us when we open!

Thank you for reading, sharing, giving and supporting.

story:
Overview

We are opening Fire & Fuel Coffee, a welcoming space focused on creating community via coffee and clay.  Driven by the values that Love Moves and Kindness Scales.  Husband and wife owned and operated, we will feature great house blends and delicious baked goods along with a hands-on pottery studio. This is an opportunity for our friends and neighbors to join us on this journey. Because even though it's our business - it's YOUR community.

Fire & Fuel Coffee - Caffeine, Clay, & Community

A great coffee shop is integral to any community. My family is bringing one to the St. Pete We invite you to become part of this journey.

We have lived in south St. Petersburg for the past five years and fell in love with it so much that we felt we need to serve the community. There are many awesome places to connect with but what we feel is missing is a true community center. A place where you see people of all walks of life come together not just to get a cup of coffee but to truly connect as a community. That is why we are creating Fire & Fuel. It is at the intersection of North and South and East and West. 

While this will be our family business, this is YOUR community. So help us make it special.

We are moving out of the first phase of launching our coffee shop. We have started an LLC, developed a business plan, worked with an architect, identified our contractors, selected our equipment, created our house blend, and are planning on submitting plans for approval by the city. We are now moving into the build-out phase. We have an incredible space and location scoped out. But it was not designed for this purpose. That means we are adding new electrical and plumbing to support the use of power and water that are necessary for a coffee shop. Because we want this place to reflect our community, your sponsorship will give us wider options as we select the final flooring, paint, tile, countertops, etc. Plus, our coffee shop will have a very intentional focus on art and community. Your sponsorship will help us quickly move to incorporate these elements into your experience.

What We Need & What You Get

We're not a big corporate chain opening a franchise. We are a family who loves coffee and loves this community. We live less than 5 miles away. Our focus won't be on the stock portfolio of someone across the country who has never even heard of St. Pete. Our focus will be on the quality of coffee in your cup, the comfort of the chair you choose to sit in, allowing the clay art to be a point of connection but more importantly, creating an environment where all are welcomed and known. When you love your experience or when you have a suggestion for making it better, you will be talking to the owners: US! Since we don't have a big corporate structure behind us, creating our business must come from our own finances...and from our community.

Your sponsorship comes with some cool perks. You can earn free cups of coffee (all the way from one on up to a year's supply!), stickers for your vehicle, mugs, shirts, and even a night with the cafe all to yourself so you can throw a party for your friends.

Any level of support will be appreciated and useful. So if we don't reach our goal, we will prioritize some of the pieces we were hoping to add and make some tough choices.

The Impact

Here's what this will mean to our family: Opening our business means that we will be able to spend more time together. I know that sounds crazy, right? We met over 22 years ago while working in a restaurant together and loved every minute of it. This venture will allow us to do that again. We will be able to work side by side along with creating an amazing workforce that will be focused on not just making great drinks but with connecting with all that walk into our space. 

Here's what this will mean to you: You gain a great local, independent coffee shop!  And while we have some phenomenal small businesses and local restaurants, what we don't have is a place with enough seating to spread out and sit for a while. We want you to pick up a cup on your way to the office or chat with a friend after dropping off your kids at school. Use our free wifi to work remotely or meet with a client. On the weekend, ride your bike over or stop by after a run along Central Avenue or a hike by the Pinellas Trail. Swing by to pick up a unique and meaningful gift for a loved one. Take a cup outside and enjoy the amazing Florida weather. This is YOUR neighborhood coffee shop.

Additionally we will be open late (closing around 10 pm on weekdays and midnight on weekends) to take care of those with late work schedules - including the Uber drivers - as well as the usual night owls. We are meant to be a place of refuge and place of comfort when most places like these are closed at that time of night. 

Risks & Challenges

So where does the money raised through crowdfunding go? So much has already been accomplished but there is a lot left to do. Our plumber will be drilling through concrete to create new drains for the additional sinks and machines. The electrician will be making sure we have enough power to run all of the equipment at peak hours. Through all of this, we are adding in wall paint, flooring, lighting, and furniture that is comfortable and maintain a great sound quality for your conversations and also for live entertainment. Each of these pieces has a value...and a cost. We know the pieces that we can put off, if necessary. But our goal is to have everything 100% just the way that we want it, and the way that you deserve it, on opening day.

So why trust us to make it happen? First, we love coffee. Second, we love the community. But third, we have a track record of making big things happen. Our backgrounds include running many successful restaurants and retail companies as well as our involvement in many outreach ministries. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Let other folks know about our coffee shop. Email us any leads to fireandfuelcoffee@gmail.com and encourage friends and family who grew up here but have moved away to contribute. We will be here when they visit and y'all want to meet and catch up!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools. Share this to your social media accounts. Not only will this help us raise funds but will also advertise and build our business.

story:
Short Summary

I am a native of Gaston County and care deeply for this community, which is experiencing substantial economic growth, however we are lacking growth in the arts and entertainment industry. I feel it is important to bring arts and entertainment to the downtown district. With your help, The Rooster can fill this void. With our proximity to larger cities, our local talent needs a home of their own, and we aim to provide it. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding in order to bring our building up to current building and zoning codes. We have the perfect location, however the investment needed to make the building safe is a little larger than we expected.  We are short on the amount of financing we are able to attain and need a little help getting us over the hump.

In return for your generous support, we will be offering tee shirts, hats and tickets to shows of your choice!  We are offering a tiered perk package in exchange for your support.

If we are unable to reach our goal, we still plan to use every dollar we raise to get The Rooster open.

The Impact

The Rooster is going to be more than just another music hall....we are focused on community. Giving the arts community a safe place to perform helps build confidence and provides opportunity to master their skills. In addition to becoming a "home" for the arts, we firmly believe that this community needs access to entertainment in order to grow. While there are a handful of places that do have a great nightlife atmosphere, we seek to fill that some of the void that currently exists and give people a place to go for a fun night out in town!

We also seek to keep a diverse schedule of events, making The Rooster a place that is inclusive, with an atmosphere that is fun and inviting.   

Risks & Challenges

In order to create the environment we intend to create and be successful, we must keep our establishment safe, and we are committed to doing so.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us by sharing our campaign with your own personal network. Every little bit helps!

story:
Our Story

Let me re-introduce myself. I'm Eilene Shaffer. My three favorite things are desserts, coffee and CATS. We are opening a cat lounge in Buckingham, PA. (It will have a Doylestown address when you look for us - 3617 Old East Road, Doylestown) If you love cats or if you are plain curious, this is your place to hang out as our adoptable cats roam the cat room which we invite you to come and enjoy. We are partnered with Bucks County SPCA and Kitty Junction for our cat residents. Yes, they live here in our barn themed cat room until adopted. We need to make the space purrfect for them and you. With your support, we can make this happen NOW.

What we need

For those you have been with us since we began this journey last July (!@$^$#!), we have gone through 12 leases for an abundant or reasons to unbelievable to believe. It has given me lots of experience. I tend to believe that was the hard part. Now onto the fun part of setting up shop. We have construction and refitting costs. There is a retail part to MeWow to pay for things like lights and staff but the cat room relies on you! There is no cost to our partner adoption agencies, Bucks County SPCA & Kitty Junction, to have their cats live with us. For now, help us get the doors open. The $5000 I'm raising will pay for everything needed for construction furnishing and supplies to open the cat room portion of MeWow. Any money raised will go towards this goal.

Believe you me, it will be one heck of a party when we open and to our loyal followers, thank you for all your patience and incredible support. We were never giving up, just had to take a very, very long road to get here. THANK YOU BUCKINGHAM TOWNSHIP, CROSSKEYS DEVELOPMENT and LARRY PESESKI.

The Impact

  • Our cats have a permanent home in our barn themed cat room until adopted. This satellite location for our partner agencies frees up valuable space in their shelters to house more displaced cats.
  • MeWow intends to offer seminars and events to help support our Central Bucks County Community. Have an idea? We want to hear it.
  • For the humans, it's a place to love and be loved. Our cats will play and snuggle with you. In our fast-paced world, humans need refuge too.

Risks & Challenges

Cat Cafes are not a new idea just new to the United States. They began in Asian countries 30 years ago where people living in densely populated high rise apartments were not allowed to have pets. There are just over 100 in the United States and one is coming right here to Bucks County!

To know me is know that I am outside the box thinker that does not give up. There is always more than one way to overcome an obstacle. Take finding a location. No matter what was thrown at me and as many disappointing outcomes, I kept at it. And now we have the purrfect location. I will bring that same tenacity to assuring MeWow's success. I don't give up, I give it everything I've got. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your monetary support but we also need you to tell everyone you know by shouting it from the rooftops. Or going with our theme, hollering it from the hayloft! Yodel it out on all your social platforms. The links are provided below.

You can also help us by having a fundraiser of your own. All money will be used on the creation of the cat room and care of our resident fur babies. 


Can you feel it? The excitement is CATchy!
