story:
Summer Patio Brews Await!

It has been a wild ride to get to where we are today and are now just a few short months from opening Church St. Taphouse in Comox!  We've seen incredible support from the community and we can't wait to show you the final product.   We strive to to be the gathering place that employees, locals & visitors are all proud to call their own. 

As we make our final push to get the doors open we want to ask your help to put in place some finishing touches to our project that we feel will transform our interior design from good to great. 

We've put together a crowdfunding campaign that we hope piques your interest, gives you great perks, and helps us #paddlehome to the finish line. 

On behalf of the local ownership team of Craig, Ben and Chris: we can't thank you enough for your support to date and we look forward to serving you on the patio this summer! 

What We Need & What You Get (great perks!)

Need is a very subjective word, but I guess technically we do need to get those 20 tap lines and massive keg cooler in place to give this place a proper go:) ...Where we do plan to make use of funds raised in the campaign are various finishing interior design ideas both inside and on the patio. We are working with a very talented interior designer and we would love to put all of her ideas to work to make our it a place you feel cozy, inspired and thirsty. 

In parting with your hard earned cash, we have put together a number of different perks to choose from that we hope will catch you interest.  Whether you are looking for a T-shirt, be the first to get married at the Church, or looking to attend our VIP opening party--we have you covered!

Quick Taphouse Facts

  • Located at 215 Church Street
  • Opening Summer 2019
  • Employee-friendly environment, that focuses on respect, proper training, and fair compensation
  • 20 Taps with your favourite beer, wine & cider + full bar too!
  • Open until Midnight Sun-Thurs // 1 A.M. Fri-Sat
  • We are bringing back live music to Comox...stay tuned.
  • Locally owned & operated
  • We have hired our Chef and she is creating an incredible pub menu with classics and some twists
  •  Family-friendly 
  • Customer service that is second to none on the Island!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can spare a second, please share the campaign with friends and family...hey maybe they will buy you a perk!
  • Follow us on FB , Instragram and our website for project & staffing announcements

story:
Who We Are

We are the Condarco family. We own and operate a small 11 acre ranch in Leonard, Texas called Rancho Condarco that provides animal experiences to the Texoma, East Texas, & Dallas/Fort Worth areas.

Our services include mobile petting zoo, indoor critter zoo, hand-led pony rides, live character animals, real animal models, animal presentations, critter education, live animal exhibits, pony shows, animal entertainment, animal encounters, and portrait sessions. Our products vary from handmade items, plush toys, animal tack, and custom themed party items.

So far, during the COVID-19 pandemic, we have lost over $20,000 of income on over 30 bookings. Since we do not know how long the epidemic will last, we are unable to take normal bookings. We rely on the spring festival season to help us make it through the spring and summer months. We need some help.

We have built our business, and our lives, around caring for and sharing our animals with others. We're struggling to do that effectively without our normal source of income. So, we created this Indiegogo campaign to help earn money to feed the animals during the coronavirus shutdown. Most of the perks are part of our normal products & services offered at the usual price. We aren't a charity organization and it is important to us that you get something of value from your contribution.

What We Need

We can average about $800-$1,200 per month just for feed and necessary medicines for our animals. So we need at least $3,600 to help cover the cost of feed and healthcare supplies for about 3 months or so. Whatever amount we get, even if it's under our goal, will go to feed and care for our animals.

What You Get  

You will get choices of perks from amazing petting zoo themed swag to our most popular services.

Your Impact  

Your contribution will help us keep our animals healthy and happy until we can all return to business as usual.

Other Ways You Can Help  

Share the Indiegogo link to our campaign with everyone you know that loves animals!

Thank you for your help. We appreciate you!

Be Wise. Sanitize.

story:
English version below!!! Already more then 10.000 visits!!

Great project, help us make a dream come true.

Hallo, mijn naam is Bianca,

Ik ben een 34-jarige moeder van 3 kinderen.

Getrouwd met Maurice sinds 20-7-2007.We wonen in  Kerkrade ,Nederland.

Mijn droom is om een bestaande ​​camping  over te nemen.  De camping ligt dus in Utscheid in de Eifel. De camping ligt midden in een beschermd natuur gebied. altijd al eens in vos in het wild tegen willen komen of misschien een Ree, hier kan dat.

De omgeving
camping is gelegen aan de rand van het kleine dorpje Utscheid in een door bossen en  heuvels omgeven klein dal. Utscheid ligt in het natuurpark de Duitse Zuid Eifel tussen Bitburg (15km) en het Luxemburgse Vianden (20km) en op circa 350 km van Utrecht. (GPS: N 49o59.956 E 006o21.191)

Kenmerkend voor dit gebied is het eindeloze netwerk van kleine bochtige wegen door bossen en open hoogtes, langs rivieren, beekjes, stuwmeren en reservoirs. Het afwisselende landschap is geschikt voor zowel gevorderde als beginnende kampeerders. Op de motor rijd u door een glooiend landschap, wat wil je dan nog meer.
Of maak eens een wandeling; op elk moment kun je vossen, hazen of reeen e.d tegenkomen.

We zijn van plan het bestaande concept aan te passen en er een bloeiende camping van te gaan maken.

Nu wordt er voornamelijk ingezet op motorrijders, maar wij zien ook graag de ouderen onder ons, om van hun welverdiende rust te genieten op onze camping.

Ook gezinnen met en zonder kinderen is een doelgroep voor ons, en natuurlijk de wandelaars en fietsers,,ooit al eens willen zweefvliegen ook dat maken we mogelijk.

Maar waarom dan nu een camping zult u denken.

Dit omdat we in 2009 op 5 augustus, voor een korte vakantie verbleven in Bulgariije.Toen een vreselijk ongeluk gebeurde die dag, het maakte van deze vakantie  een drama. Meerdere gezinsleden, waaronder ook ik zelf raakten gewond en mijn vader stierf een dag later, als gevolg van dit ongeval !!

Vanaf die dag, was ik op zoek naar een antwoord, en Camping Little Creek is het antwoord.

Het doel is om deze camping  te kopen en rond de klok als een familiebedrijf te gaan runnen.

Donateurs en investeerders kunnen mij helpen, om  kampeerders, hun welverdiende rust maar ook het juiste vakantie gevoel te  geven, wat iedereen op zijn tijd  verdient. Om natuurlijk te ontspannen en  te genieten, in een veilige natuurlijke omgeving.  Met de keuken die aanwezig is, toveren wij dan diverse menu's op uw bord en kunt u genieten van zowel Eifel producten als Nederlandse en Duitse keuken.

Door te financieren. doneren op mijn crowdfundingsproject, zullen donateurs mede bijdragen, om dit beschermde natuur gebied in vorm te houden. Iedereen krijgt, voor hun donatie zelfs een gratis vakantie korte of lang afhankelijk van de donatie.

Zie verder hieronder, hoe u een gratis vakantie kunt krijgen !!!

Het bedrag van de financiering is in totaal € 220.000, - .. dit is het geld dat we moeten investeren.In totaal moeten we ongeveer € 100,000, - financieren met eigen  middelen.

De financiering wordt verkregen, door een lening van de bank, en eventuele investeerders. Voorbeeld, leveranciers van food  en non food investeren mee.

Een deel van het geld dat we investeren is van eigen spaargeld.

Wij Geven donateurs, korte vakanties, lange vakanties, of een periode van vijf jaar gratis vakantie op onze camping, als tegenprestatie.

doneren € 50, - 1 weekend  gratis verblijf

doneert € 100, - 1 week  gratis verblijf

doneert € 300, - 1 maand gratis verblijf

doneren € 1000, - 1 jaar gratis vaste plek op de camping

doneren € 2500, - 3 jaar gratis vaste plek op de camping

doneren boven € 2500,- tot 5 jaar gratis vaste plek op de camping !!!

Voor alle verblijven geldt, gratis water en stroom, tent en caravan dient u wel zelf mee te brengen. Wij verhuren tevens caravans.

De  grotere beleggers/investeerders, kunnen we  6% rente  geven, voor deze optie kunt u contact met ons opnemen

De uitdaging is , binnen 60 dagen. de benodigde € 100.000,- te werven. Dat is omdat het seizoen op   1 april begint. En we willen , vanaf die dag.alle kampeerders met ons concept gaan verwennen. 

Hoe dan ook, iedereen kan helpen door een bijdrage te leveren, met geld of te vertellen over of mijn crowdfunding project ..

Hard werken is de sleutel tot succes. Dank u voor het lezen van deze Campagne, en ik vraag u te delen met uw vrienden.

Met vriendelijke groet, Bianca Krekels-Heusch


Hello, my name is Bianca,

I am a 34 year old mother of 3 kids. 

Married with Maurice since 20-7-2007.We live in a town called Kerkrade in the Netherlands.

My dream is to start a campingground , the idea became me 2 months ago, when i saw that little creek was for sale. This protected nature area, where you can meet european wildlife.

Area

The  camp is located on the outskirts of the small village Utscheid and is surrounded by woods and hills, small valley. Utscheid lies in the nature of the German South Eifel between Bitburg (15km) and the Luxembourg Vianden (20km) and approximately 350 km from Utrecht . (GPS: N 49o59.956 E 006o21.191)

Characteristic of this area is the endless network of small winding roads through forests and open heights, along rivers, streams, lakes and reservoirs. The varied landscape is suitable for both experienced and novice riders.

Or take a walk;  foxes, hares and deer come across  at any time.
The moment i saw this campground i was in love.
In 2009 on 5 august, we where staying for a short vacation in Bulgaria.Then a terrible accident happend  that day, it made this vacation into a drama. Severall family members where injured and my father died a day later, because of this accident!!
From that day on, i was searching for an answer, and Little creek is the Answer.
The purpose is to buy this ground and work around the clock as a family business.
Contributers can help me, to give  people the vaction/hollidays they deserve, to enjoy the nature..and  increase stress,  in a save natural environment
By funding on my campain, contributers will contribute to keep this valley in shape, and gain for them selves a free vacation, short or long depending, on the donation.
See further below how to gain free vacations!!!


The amount of funding is in total € 100.000,-..this is the money we have to invest as privat money.In total we need about €220.000,-.

Which we gain by getting a loan from the bank, and some investors which provide as suppliers of food and drinks and mobilhomes.

A part of the money we gain of or own savings.

-We  give contributers, short vacations, long vacations, or a five year free vacation on our campground.

donate € 50,- 1 weekend of holliday free

donate € 100,- 1 week  of holliday free

donate € 300,- 1 month free holliday

donate € 1000,- 1 year  free spot on the campground

donate € 2500,- 3 years free spot on the campground

donate more, up to 5 years free spot on the campground!!!

You must bring your own tent or caravan, also we rent caravans/mobilhomes

-Also we can give bigger investors  6% interest, for this option please contact us!

Anyway we will reach our goal, thats for sure!



The challenge is too get the amount of money, within 60 days. Thats because the season starts 1 April. And we want to gain money and customers, from that day on. 


Anyway, everyone can help by contribute, with money or to tell about or campain..


Hard work is the key to succes. Thank you for reading this campain, and sharing it with youre friends.


Best regards, Bianca Krekels-Heusch

story:
Thank you for your service means something special and we created a "special benefit" that everyone can enjoy, including you.  

In conversations with many post 911 veterans, the idea kept emerging of being in a place with the opportunity to exhale, relax and truly unwind from the stress of combat related activities.

A sort of decompression period, learning to have fun again, talking with fellow veterans through difficult shared experiences; having some uninterrupted time to unwind from being on high alert, and adjust instead, to enjoying a return to normalcy again. 

The conviction that most of us prize a vacation precisely for its rejuvenative aspects, made this approach more than just a feel good opportunity. 

From the outset, the Caribbean resonated as precisely the sort of environment, a place of decompression that we all would embrace, civilians and military alike.

After having clearly seen this need, realizing that all the threads of information were aligning with my connection points, accepting the call that I was among the cavalry, I tasked myself with spearheading this particular initiative.

"Veteran’s at the beach"; if it was to be, it had to be me.

Certainly, were we less enthusiastic or driven, we could leave this up to major corporations and layers of bureaucracy or “donors with deep pockets” and have it not see the light of day.

We knew that this could not be the case because it was way too important. We had to do something. 

Now pause and think about the value of "a penny" for a moment as we continue with our story.

 
"Veteran’s at the Beach" is our pilot program, a testable prototype of a "Caribbean safe house" with a Jeep, and we are asking for your support through "unleashing the power of penny". 
 

Through unlocking this special relationship with you and using the power of your penny, You too are the cavalry, you would desperately want to see if “cornered alone on a ridge somewhere far, far from home”. 

"Thank you for your service" means something, it always has, and clearly it means something to you too.   

Together, through Indiegogo and with your support, we found a way to unlock and "unleash the power of a penny" and made it possible so you too could enjoy a Caribbean vacation just as well.
 
With your support we aim to improve access for the physically challenged and to equip the Villa with an Unlimited model Jeep.
 
Your penny paid forward, unleashes the fun for you too.

Thank you for your service means something special and we created a "special benefit" that everyone can enjoy, including you.  In conversations with many post 911 veterans, the idea kept emerging of being in a place with the opportunity to exhale, relax and truly unwind from the stress of combat related activities.A sort of decompression period, learning to have fun again, talking with fellow veterans through difficult shared experiences; having some uninterrupted time to unwind from being on high alert, and adjust instead, to enjoying a return to normalcy again. The conviction that most of us prize a vacation precisely for its rejuvenative aspects, made this approach more than just a feel good opportunity. From the outset, the Caribbean resonated as precisely the sort of environment, a place of decompression that we all would embrace, civilians and military alike.After having clearly seen this need, realizing that all the threads of information were aligning with my connection points, accepting the call that I was among the cavalry, I tasked myself with spearheading this particular initiative."Veteran’s at the beach"; if it was to be, it had to be me.Certainly, were we less enthusiastic or driven, we could leave this up to major corporations and layers of bureaucracy or “donors with deep pockets” and have it not see the light of day.We knew that this could not be the case because it was way too important. We had to do something. Now pause and think about the value of "a penny" for a moment as we continue with our story. 
"Veteran’s at the Beach" is our pilot program, a testable prototype of a "Caribbean safe house" with a Jeep, and we are asking for your support through "unleashing the power of penny".  Through unlocking this special relationship with you and using the power of your penny, You too are the cavalry, you would desperately want to see if “cornered alone on a ridge somewhere far, far from home”. 
"Thank you for your service" means something, it always has, and clearly it means something to you too.   
Together, through Indiegogo and with your support, we found a way to unlock and "unleash the power of a penny" and made it possible so you too could enjoy a Caribbean vacation just as well.
 
With your support we aim to improve access for the physically challenged and to equip the Villa with an Unlimited model Jeep.
 
Your penny paid forward, unleashes the fun for you too.

story:
English Version:

WHAT WE WANT TO CHANGE:

All across the Western World, but in European Capitals in particular, the native inhabitants are being driven out of their own cities by a ruthless housing market that seeks to maximize profits by raising rents and sales prices to ever new dazzling heights. This phenomenon is known in Germany under the phrase "Gentrification".

Gentrification is the buying and renovating of houses and stores in deteriorated urban neighborhoods by wealthier individuals, which in effect increases property values and displaces low-income families and small businesses.This is a common and widespread controversial topic in urban planning. It refers to shifts in an urban community lifestyle and an increasing share of wealthier residents and/or businesses and increasing property values.

Gentrification is typically the result of increased interest in a certain environment. Early "gentrifiers" may belong to low income artists or boheme communities, which increase the attractiveness and flair of a certain quarter. Further steps are increased investments in a community by real estate development businesses, local government, or community activists and more economic development, increased attraction of business and lower crime rates. In addition to these potential benefits, gentrification can lead to population migration.

In a community undergoing gentrification, the average income increases. Poorer "pre-gentrification" residents who are unable to pay increased rents or property taxes may find it necessary to relocate.

It is this problem, which the 1ROOMS project seeks to eliminate, or at least "ease". 

We believe that we CAN make a difference regarding this development by creating affordable housing both for sale and for rent. 

WHO ARE THE CUSTOMERS/Beneficiaries? 

Lower to Medium income singles wishing to live in European inner cities. By building our 1 ROOM RESIDENCY we address multiple problems:A shortage of affordable centrally located housing in major European cities as well as the lack of private home ownership in particular in the Berlin, Germany where the pilot project and first construction shall take place.

"1 Room Residencies" will enable  singles, young professionals, young couples and low income individuals to reside relatively Central in cities such as London, Paris or Berlin, thus sparing them of having to make the eventual financially motivated move to suburbs.

Not only is the 1Room enterprise a social concept, helping to preserve the cities original inhabitants, the very people who made these places what they are, but it also a strong business model, offering high margins to investors.


WHAT IS THE PROJECT IN DETAIL?


The Apartments are split up into two categories:

 1.) 1 ROOM APARTMENTS

2.) MULTI PERSON QUARTERS FOR REFUGEES

There is a mini version of the pilot project-(displayed in the first scetch beneath) built designed for a smaller building of 4-5 floors as well as a full scale version (displayed second beneath). Depending on the funding we are able to secure from this campaign and/or the state bank KfW, we will realize either the full or mini version.

Utilities such as an Ironing Board and kitchen table for dining as well as beds are built in as fold out features, discreetly hidden in the walls and cupboards giving the rooms a relatively spacious appearance despite their limited size. The fold out tables shall have fold out benches attached for seating guests.


. The buildings shall have ceilings made of construction Bamboo (Gauarda Bamboo), which shall sharply reduce costs as well as improve fire safety, due to the bamboos extremely fire resistant nature. This material was used for the ceiling of the Spanish Airport of Madrid, for the same reason.

Due to the project addressing an important social problem we at 1ROOM feel certain that EU funds will be made available for this initial project in Berlin.
Applications are pending:

                       "1ROOM RESIDENCY" -TAKING BACK OUR CITY!


Deutsche Version:

WILLKOMMEN BEI DER CROWDFUNDING KAMPAGNE VON 1ROOM Residency!


                  WAS WIR VERÄNDERN WOLLEN: 

Überall in den Hauptstädten Europas werden die eigentlichen Einwohner an die Ränder der Stadt gedrängt. Auf einem mittlerweile schlicht skrupellosen Immobilienmarkt , dessen Teilnehmer bzw. Anbieter Ihre Gewinne durch "Modernisierungen" ins unermessliche treiben wollen, haben Normalverdiener keine Chance. Dieses Phänomen wird als " Gentrifizierung " bezeichnet, aber wir nennen es lieber "Schweinerei". 

Überall findet man auch in unserer Heimatstadt Berlin, ständig neue Bauprojekte die uns Luxus-Appartements erschaffen wollen . Bloß, für wen sind die Dinger eigentlich? Der Berliner ist allgemein für vieles bekannt, doch für seinen immensen Wohlstand, eher nicht.

Das "1ROOM Residency" ist schlicht und ergreifend ein Projekt welches dem ganzen Luxus Wahn und der Profit Gier entgegen wirken will. 

Das Gebäude, welches wir in Berlin günstig erwerben und renovieren wollen, befindet sich am Berliner Ostkreuz und befindet sich im Eigentum der Deutsche Bahn. Es gibt jedoch auch andere Standorte, dessen Betreiber oder Eigentümer wir angeschrieben haben, bzw. in Kontakt stehen. 

Im Prinzip, kommt aber jedes Gebäude in Frage welches relativ zentral gelegen und mindestens 4 Stockwerke hat. In einigen Stockwerken werden Flüchtlinge untergebracht und in anderen entstehen ein-Zimmer Wohnungen die zwar "klein" sein werden, dafür aber die langfristig an Einheimische vermietet werden. 

Der entscheidende Punkt bei diesem Projekt ist der, dass die, die ganz unten sind, das Miteinander lernen anstatt sich gegenseitig zu verachten und sich die Schuld an allem schlimmen auf dieser Welt zuzuschieben. 

Miteinander, statt Gegeneinander. Bei uns soll und wird das gehen.

Im Detail sehen so unsere ersten Entwürfe für das Projekt aus:
Fuer eine kleinere Version von bis zu 5 Stockwerken, welche wir "MINI Version" nennen, haben wir für die Etagen der Flüchtlinge vor, diesen bzw. einen diesem ähnlichen Entwurf / Floor Plan zu nutzen:

Sollten wir unser Ziel i.H.v. 50.000 Euro erreichen und somit die 10% der von unserer Architektin errechneten benötigten Gesamtsumme von etwa 500.000 Euro für ein zehn Stockwerke hohes Gebäude einnehmen, dann werden wir versuchen mit Hilfe der KfW die "Vollversion", zu bauen. Bei diesem sehe der Entwurf bzw. Floor Plan in etwa so aus:


Die Ein Raum Appartements für Menschen welche in Gefahr laufen von den steigenden Mieten an den Stadtrand gedrängt zu werden, haben wir einen schlichten und einfachen Entwurf, welcher seinen Zweck gut erfüllen wird:


                        -1ROOM RESIDENCY-

          HOLEN WIR UNS DIE STADT ZURÜCK!

----------------------------------UPDATE----------------------------------------------

find it necessary to relocate.


It is this problem, which the 1ROOMS project seeks to eliminate, or at least "ease". 


We believe that we CAN make a difference regarding this development by creating affordable housing both for sale and for rent. 


WHO ARE THE CUSTOMERS/Beneficiaries? 


Lower to Medium income singles wishing to live in European inner cities. By building our 1 ROOM RESIDENCY we address multiple problems:A
 shortage of affordable centrally located housing in major European 
cities as well as the lack of private home ownership in particular in 
the Berlin, Germany where the pilot project and first construction shall
 take place.




"1 Room Residencies" will enable  
singles, young professionals, young couples and low income individuals 
to reside relatively Central in cities such as London, Paris or Berlin, 
thus sparing them of having to make the eventual financially motivated 
move to suburbs.


Not only is the 1Room enterprise a social concept, 
helping to preserve the cities original inhabitants, the very people who 
made these places what they are, but it also a strong business model, 
offering high margins to investors.



WHAT IS THE PROJECT IN DETAIL?





The Apartments are split up into two categories: 1.) 1 ROOM APARTMENTS






2.) MULTI PERSON QUARTERS FOR REFUGEES
There is a mini version of the pilot project-(displayed in the first scetch beneath) built designed for a smaller building of 4-5 floors as well as a full scale version (displayed second beneath). Depending on the funding we are able to secure from this campaign and/or the state bank KfW, we will realize either the full or mini version.




Utilities such as an Ironing Board and kitchen table for dining as well as beds are built in as fold out features, discreetly hidden in the walls and cupboards giving the rooms a relatively spacious appearance despite their limited size. The fold out tables shall have fold out benches attached for seating guests.

. The buildings shall have ceilings made of construction Bamboo (Gauarda Bamboo), which shall sharply reduce costs as well as improve fire safety, due to the bamboos extremely fire resistant nature. This material was used for the ceiling of the Spanish Airport of Madrid, for the same reason.
Due to the project addressing an important social problem we at 1ROOM feel certain that EU funds will be made available for this initial project in Berlin.Applications are pending:
                       "1ROOM RESIDENCY" -TAKING BACK OUR CITY!





Deutsche Version:


WILLKOMMEN BEI DER CROWDFUNDING KAMPAGNE VON 1ROOM Residency!

                  WAS WIR VERÄNDERN WOLLEN: 


Überall in den Hauptstädten Europas werden die eigentlichen Einwohner an die Ränder der Stadt gedrängt. Auf einem mittlerweile schlicht skrupellosen Immobilienmarkt , dessen Teilnehmer bzw. Anbieter Ihre Gewinne durch "Modernisierungen" ins unermessliche treiben wollen, haben Normalverdiener keine Chance. Dieses Phänomen wird als " Gentrifizierung " bezeichnet, aber wir nennen es lieber "Schweinerei". 

Überall findet man auch in unserer Heimatstadt Berlin,
ständig neue Bauprojekte die uns Luxus-Appartements erschaffen wollen .
Bloß, für wen sind die Dinger eigentlich? Der Berliner ist allgemein für vieles
bekannt, doch für seinen immensen Wohlstand, eher nicht.



Das "1ROOM Residency" ist schlicht und ergreifend ein Projekt welches dem ganzen Luxus Wahn und der Profit Gier entgegen wirken will. 
Das Gebäude, welches wir in Berlin günstig erwerben und renovieren wollen, befindet sich am Berliner Ostkreuz und befindet sich im Eigentum der Deutsche Bahn. Es gibt jedoch auch andere Standorte, dessen Betreiber oder Eigentümer wir angeschrieben haben, bzw. in Kontakt stehen.  
Im Prinzip, kommt aber jedes Gebäude in Frage welches relativ zentral gelegen und mindestens 4 Stockwerke hat. In einigen Stockwerken werden Flüchtlinge untergebracht und in anderen entstehen ein-Zimmer Wohnungen die zwar "klein" sein werden, dafür aber die langfristig an Einheimische vermietet werden. 


Der entscheidende Punkt bei diesem Projekt ist der, dass die, die ganz unten sind, das Miteinander lernen anstatt sich gegenseitig zu verachten und sich die Schuld an allem schlimmen auf dieser Welt zuzuschieben. 
Miteinander, statt Gegeneinander. Bei uns soll und wird das gehen.

Im Detail sehen so unsere ersten Entwürfe für das Projekt aus:Fuer eine kleinere Version von bis zu 5 Stockwerken, welche wir "MINI Version" nennen, haben wir für die Etagen der Flüchtlinge vor, diesen bzw. einen diesem ähnlichen Entwurf / Floor Plan zu nutzen:Sollten wir unser Ziel i.H.v. 50.000 Euro erreichen und somit die 10% der von unserer Architektin errechneten benötigten Gesamtsumme von etwa 500.000 Euro für ein zehn Stockwerke hohes Gebäude einnehmen, dann werden wir versuchen mit Hilfe der KfW die "Vollversion", zu bauen. Bei diesem sehe der Entwurf bzw. Floor Plan in etwa so aus:

Die Ein Raum Appartements für Menschen welche in Gefahr laufen von den steigenden Mieten an den Stadtrand gedrängt zu werden, haben wir einen schlichten und einfachen Entwurf, welcher seinen Zweck gut erfüllen wird:

                        -1ROOM RESIDENCY-
          HOLEN WIR UNS DIE STADT ZURÜCK!



----------------------------------UPDATE----------------------------------------------

story:
Team Fillypiñana is a group of students from different schools, getting together to form an arts, crafts, and special events team. The Team was created way back in January 2014, originally to pull off an arts-and-crafts convention for fans of My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic called FillyPiñana. In the year 2014, Team Fillypiñana pulled off two special events, FillyPiñana and Rari-Tea Party, which is an actual tea party originally for the same fans of My Little Pony.

In the year 2015, Team Fillypiñana pulled off the 2nd annual Rari-Tea Party, but it has begun transcending from the pony-fandom community to the mainstream market by means of booth participations in events. Team Fillypiñana first appeared as an exhibitor in the Tamashii Convention last March 2015, wherein they showcased its signature product called Rari-Tea Sugar Drops. But the Team's first real step to the transition was their participation as one of the 49 food vendors in the Ultimate Taste Test last September 2015.

Since the breakthrough, Team Fillypiñana continued to participate as a food vendor in two bazaars during 2015: the Picky Palates Weekend Market and the Maginhawang Pasko.


Café Mayumi is Team Fillypiñana's food-service division headed by Mr. Budz Marata. Created in December 2015 after the success of the Team's appearance in Ultimate Taste Test 2015, Café Mayumi envisions to be the "go-to mobile café for all types of events ranging from big-scale conventions, expos and fairs, to private functions and parties." 

The Café aims to provide coffee and tea beverages that are not only appealing and presentable, but also reasonably affordable. The Café Menu may consist the following:
  • Brewed coffee and tea
  • Café lattés
  • Tea lattés
  • Fruity tea drinks
  • Hot chocolate
  • Chocolate fudge and other desserts
The Café can also offer coffee/tea-and-dessert catering services for private functions, parties, conferences, and other events.
Café Mayumi is set to participate in Komiket 2016 (February 20), and the Entrepreneurs and Franchise Expo 2016 (March 11-13).

We have many reasons why we're putting up this fundraising campaign (and they're probably even mentioned in the video above). But the main reason for this campaign is that we want to be the "on-the-go" café that can serve quality food and beverages to event attendees who want to get the café experience without having to step out of the venue or leave the event hall. 


One of the questions many contributors will ask is: where will the money go? To answer that question, here is a simple breakdown of our expenses for Café Mayumi:

Business Registration (P 10,000.00)
This estimated amount should cover the expenses to register Cafe Mayumi to the Department of Trade and Industry (DTI) and to the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR), as well as the Business Permit, the Barangay Clearance, the Community Tax Certificate, and special permits such as food safety and sanitary.

Virtual-Office Address (P 6,000.00)
We managed to find an office-solutions company that gives an affordable rate for a six-month contract of getting our own business address. It's a virtual office so only the essential features such as correspondence and document pickup, but it's a start - after all, we operate during events anyway.

Initial Working Capital (P 6,500.00)
The remainder of this amount will serve as our costs for providing the perks to contributors, as well as the purchase of cafe ingredients and supplies that we need for future event-participations.

One important note: the initial working capital does not include our salaries. We'll rely on the total sales that we make for every event we participate.


We have a selection of perks for you to choose from, depending on the amount of contribution that you want to place. You can look at the right-hand side of this campaign page for all the details.
A $2 contribution amount will get you a simple thank-you card sent by yours truly, Team Fillypinana. A $3 contribution amount will get you a 10-piece pack of our innovative product: Rari-Tea Sugar Drops. 


A $5 contribution amount will get you a featured perk: a special invitation card to Rari-Tea Party 2016 sent to your mailbox. And yes, you heard right - we'll send you an ACTUAL STATIONERY invitation card, not a digital card. Full details of Rari-Tea Party 2016 will be announced via a later update on Indiegogo, as well as an announcement on Facebook and on the Team Fillypinana website.

A $10 contribution amount will get you a gift called Illuminated Pages, crafted by our very own Team member Macky Reyes.


The succeeding amounts from $25 to $100 will get you one of Café Mayumi's catering services. You can choose from a simple tea party package for 4 people, to a big package for your next birthday party! Just remember to negotiate with us on where and when you want us to deliver and perform our café services. Another important note: if two or more contributors want our services on the same day, we'll prioritize the first caller - the others will have to choose a different date.

f we get to reach our $500 goal, we'll finally be able to build Cafe Mayumi. But we also have milestone goals for Cafe Mayumi, because the more funds we acquire, the better-equipped the cafe! What's better is that if we reach at least $1,000, we will hold our 3rd annual Rari-Tea Party for our loyal guests (who got to attend our tea party in 2014 and/or 2015) as well as curious first-time guests! You can check out our milestone goals in this image:


If we miss our target, we'll still send our paperwork to register Cafe Mayumi, we'll still participate in small-scale events as food concessionaires, and we'll still cater for clients who want to acquire our services. However, we won't be able to participate in Mercato Centrale's weekly markets. We'll also miss out on showing up for large-scale conventions (such as Cosplay Mania) or expos (such as the World Food Expo). The number of events we can participate depend on the amount of funds we acquire, and less funds mean fewer event-participations.

Regardless of the amount of funds we acquire, we can assure our contributors that all perks will be delivered.
With that said, we hope you will support us in making Café Mayumi a reality. If you have any questions, you may contact us thru the following:
E-MAIL: fillypinana@gmail.com
TEXT: +63925-6004300
FACEBOOK: facebook.com/TeamFillypinana

Thank you very much! And we hope you will join us for this year's Rari-Tea Party!

story:
Short Summary

We've been working on the Coleridge in Wales festival project for two years... and hundreds and hundreds of people and organisations are taking part.

It's a great Welsh cultural adventure.

We're bringing the Ship of the Ancient Mariner to Cardiff Bay in May this year, and then making a journey around Wales for 80 days in search of hidden Welsh treasure...

We now need to raise money to:

  • fund a small team to co-ordinate the festival activity all across Wales
  • bring the ship to more Welsh ports
  • make this a great spectacle 

Nothing like this has ever been undertaken in Wales... your immediate donations will contribute in a major way to something unique and very special...

This mini-crowdfunding campaign, for supporters and friends is called: The First Ten Thousand

Please, if you can, help launch this fundraiser

Thank you!

Richard

founder & creative director

What We Need & What You Get

We need the first crowd funded £10,000 now to enable us to accelerate building the festival and the Ancient Mariner's ship to full potential.

  • As soon as the funds start flowing you'll see the Festival office in action. Already there are so many offers of activity and response around all of Wales we urgently need that office support here! Every pound you give helps build the festival. 
  • The ship is coming to Cardiff Bay on Sunday May 15th, this summer, but we need your help to build the spectacle... ensure the Ancient Mariner arrives in style, with a zombie crew of sailors. Some of Wales' leading theatre people are inspired and ready, but it needs funding. 

We'll be launching a big public crowdfunding campaign soon, but this is the starter for friends and supporters. Its not a big fancy campaign... just a simple request for help... with the certainty that some thing special is on the way.  

By helping to fund this now you will be in on the start of the adventure...

The Impact

Raising £10,000 quickly now from crowdfunding

  • allows us to connect more quickly with communities who want to particpate around Wales and internationally
  • secures the ship and the spectacle of the ancient mariner
  • helps us to raise funds from institutions and business

Risks & Challenges

The festival is on its way. It's big. It's unique. It's personal. It's a new venture... it's a vibrant catalyst... and it is serving Wales, the UK and it's communities.

  • We're beginning in May... and what happens exactly, where we go and what we do depends on you.
  • Its unusual... but you build the adventure...

We've got a great team... and we need your help now. It is going to happen, and we want to build up quickly to make it even more exciting.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't help financially today. No problem. We're grateful that  you are reading this campaign material.  

  • make some noise about this
  • let others know about this fundraising campaign for Coleridge in Wales 2016
  • share this appeal using the Indiegogo SHARE tools on this page

Thank you!

story:
Life in the big city is rushy and stressful, you know that time when you deserve a calm down? What’s better than a nice dinner with your friends eating something new, something that will satisfy you, from the cooking process to the last bite.

It depends on your taste but c’mon! Everybody loves Italian food, but it’s so expensive and so hard to get done as good as that one you tried in Firenze or Roma in your Magical Italian Holidays. And here we are, Piece of Italy can provide you all of this. We’ll give you an Italian food experience that you can share with your friends and family. You can become a real Italian Chef with the same semplicity as cooking pasta (Doesn’t seem so easy now, does it!? With us it will be as easy as pie).

We are simple, easy, as Italian people are, but we are also strongly against food waste and sharp on time ( this because of some international influence) and in short words what we bring to you is: 

  • A 2/4 ppl box with the best of italian food inside 
  • 5 different italian mum’s recipes that accommodate all dietary needs.
  • Dosed ingredients to avoid waste and ease preparation
  • Easy-to-get video recipe

 

Piece of Italy is a food delivery service with a mission.

Sharing Italian food culture around the world. Show you the difference between cooking, and cooking with passion and tradition, gain 110% from the simple raw ingredient. The work is done, as you can see we are ready to give you all of this, we need just a little help.

Have you ever thought it was possible to fit a whole country in a single box? We did it! Each Piece of Italy box includes 100% Italian Ingredients needed to make your favourite italalian dish ( or try something new ). They come pre-portioned, with detailed, step-by-step videorecipe instructions easily reachable scanning a QRCode. 




Here you can find a short explanation of what we have to offer, all of these are in different set and composition in order to satisfy your needs as much as we can. This is our way to say thank you:


This is our spending plan, this is used to show you what we are going to do with the money we get, upon reaching the first we will go further and show you a glimpse of what we have in mind for the future of Piece of Italy:


Holidays are coming! - We’ve got the perfect gift! If you don’t know what to gift Food is always appreciated, so what better way to say Happy Holidays then to send your family and friends a delicious Piece of Italy’s box to enjoy?

Get our Xmas Gift Reward and give a small piece of Italy to your friends.    



Now start thinking about four friends, with different experiences around the world, different backgrounds, different skills and one common passion: ITALIAN FOOD! What did you expect? Those Guys would combine their “hunger” and their cleverness to create a service able to bring the real Italian Food to your kitchen. Piece of Italy is born for you, today we are living in a frenetic world, and our mission is to make your meal the right moment to understand, learn and enjoy one of the most amazing vehicle of culture in the world, food.

STEFANO SAITTA (CEO) after getting his high school diploma, Stefano left Italy for a 6 months working experience in Melbourne and now he is riding a bachelor in Computer Science at Statale University, Milan. However, this is not enough; in fact, at the same time he is working as front-end developer in an IT start-up. Focusing on our project, Stefano is the landmark of Piece of Italy and he is responsible for front-end development and web indexing process. 

MAURO BOSONI (CDO) Mauro is a Design Communication student at Politecnico di Milano a scientific-technological University well known around Europe; he represents the creativeness and the visual communication Of Piece of Italy. Everything from boxes Design to Branding image stems from Boso’s mind. 

MARCO NIFRULI (CFO) after his bachelor degree in Economics and Management in the Cattolica University, he is performing Management MSc at Bocconi University, Milan; his competences in corporate strategy and corporate finance make him the person in charge of manage strategy and financial operations in Piece of Italy. Since he was a child, he has been introduced into the wine’s World by his father, made him capable of selecting the finest Italian winegrowers. 

DAVIDE CAPOZZI (CTO) he is carrying out his bachelor in Computer Science at Statale University, Milan; his freelance working experience and passion for computer programming had determined his role in Piece of Italy: back-end development and information technology operations. Although, Davide Is an introvert person (like every genius), he represents the mind behind every single detail that makes Our project unique. 

ANDREA CESATI (COO) he is performing his bachelor in Accounting at Bicocca University, Milan; his family-business work experience and his passion for legal and fiscal matters, dress him as a perfect operation and legal manager. Andrea is a food-lover and boasts a tough network in the restaurant market, that makes him able to identify excellent, niche and traditional suppliers.

STEFANO SAITTA (CEO) after getting his high school diploma, Stefano left Italy for a 6 months working experience in Melbourne and now he is riding a bachelor in Computer Science at Statale University, Milan. However, this is not enough; in fact, at the same time he is working as front-end developer in an IT start-up. Focusing on our project, Stefano is the landmark of Piece of Italy and he is responsible for front-end development and web indexing process. 
MAURO BOSONI (CDO) Mauro is a Design Communication student at Politecnico di Milano a scientific-technological University well known around Europe; he represents the creativeness and the visual communication Of Piece of Italy. Everything from boxes Design to Branding image stems from Boso’s mind. 
MARCO NIFRULI (CFO) after his bachelor degree in Economics and Management in the Cattolica University, he is performing Management MSc at Bocconi University, Milan; his competences in corporate strategy and corporate finance make him the person in charge of manage strategy and financial operations in Piece of Italy. Since he was a child, he has been introduced into the wine’s World by his father, made him capable of selecting the finest Italian winegrowers. 
DAVIDE CAPOZZI (CTO) he is carrying out his bachelor in Computer Science at Statale University, Milan; his freelance working experience and passion for computer programming had determined his role in Piece of Italy: back-end development and information technology operations. Although, Davide Is an introvert person (like every genius), he represents the mind behind every single detail that makes Our project unique. 
ANDREA CESATI (COO) he is performing his bachelor in Accounting at Bicocca University, Milan; his family-business work experience and his passion for legal and fiscal matters, dress him as a perfect operation and legal manager. Andrea is a food-lover and boasts a tough network in the restaurant market, that makes him able to identify excellent, niche and traditional suppliers.

story:
What is The Sound of Sausage? 

The Sound of Sausage is delicious homemade Austrian food available at your local farmers market in the San Francisco Bay Area. I will start out small and simple with two kinds of smoked sausages, spicy and sweet Austrian mustard, regular and curry ketchup and of course homemade Sauerkraut. The Sound of Sausage will be available on farmers markets in the Bay Area and for online orders. As soon as the demand grows I will expand to more markets and hopefully supermarkets as well. 

Why I need your help

I need your help with some of my start-up costs: 

I already have invested a lot into this business and will continue to do so, I just need your help for a few little things that turned out to be a lot more expensive than I thought they would. 

For your help, you can choose from amazing perks like a cute little reusable shopping bag, a private party with Austrian food for everyone, or even better, a two-year supply of smoked sausages. 

What happens to your money?

Your money helps me set up my business professionally. I work hard to make it grow every day and hopefully soon be able to hire help and get into more farmers markets, develop more recipes and create a whole line of Austrian foods available on site and online. 

Why it is worth it

There is no Austrian food in the San Francisco Bay Area. The specialty sausages I make are completely unknown and the Sauerkraut you can get here is not even close to what it could taste like. People love German and Italian food, Austria is right in between those in taste as well as geographically. Everybody I have met so far loves my Austrian dishes. They give me the confidence that this will work. Besides that I have about 10 years of experience in the food and restaurant industry and a group of very close friends supporting me with their professional knowledge about cooking, marketing and business in general. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to donate, you can still help me: Share the link to this campaign on your favorite social media platform and tell your friends about it. Maybe they will get excited too! 

Like, follow and share me on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram! 

Thank you so much for your help!

story:
ABOUT US

Dear Friends,

Century Books of Pasadena opened its doors on December 17, 2011 on beautiful Green Street, just two blocks away from Caltech - one of the world’s top educational institutions.  For four years with the help and support of our community the bookstore and art gallery became a small cultural center.  From the wonderful books that surround us to the art gallery and lecture hall, to the smallest Einstein Museum in the world, we’ve been living our dream.  We have been curating our eclectic selection of books for many years, and from the beginning we had talented local artists and musicians, featuring and selling their artwork, and have great performances.  In about two months after opening our bookshop, we started to have live music on a weekly basis, live jazz every Saturday night, enchanting classical concerts, and many special music events.  We host author events, we are a home for two very lively book clubs, and many great lectures and discussions, on literature, history, science, many by famous scientists,  and lots of unique topics, i.e. "The Train and the Cosmos: Visionary Modernity" by Matilde Marcolli, Mathematical Physicist, or another personal favorite....  “The history of chocolate” (with tasting) by Dr. Lee Theissen, and great group discussions, and as a friend said it, scientists and artists, a unique mix, can come together and exchange ideas in a completely informal and yet very intellectually stimulating environment.  And last, but not least, we became the home of “The Relatively Small Einstein Museum”, the only (mini) museum on the West Coast, near the Einstein Papers Project at Caltech, that celebrates one of the most important scientists of the 20th century, at the time of the 100th Anniversary of Einstein’s Theory of Relativity.  

 Courtesy of Douglas Kirk  ©2015

It’s hasn't been easy… and we have a really big challenge to overcome in order to be able to keep our beautiful location for years to come, where all this great events are part of our community life… and this is where we need your urgent help!

But let me take you back in time for a moment…

I’m Judith Marosvolgyi, the co-owner of Century Books of Pasadena. When my husband Steve and I first planned opening the bookshop, we started to curate all the books, added our own library, worked extremely long hours, and with the help of the nicest friends you can imagine –Isaac, Robert, whose support has been unbelievable, Gabor, Kathy, Marjie – just to name a few, we were able to raise the money we needed.  Steve drew this cartoon of the two of us, which is still my favorite.  Our first business plan started to read like this:

“You know those places in Paris, London, or New York, where you have a street lined with beautiful trees, in effect a picturesque shady lane, filled with charming cafés and shops. It is a place where you want to go and forget about time on a pleasant afternoon, to leisurely walk the street, visiting all its nooks, and enjoying all it has to offer. 

Well, our dream is to open a small bookshop on a beautiful street in Pasadena.  This place has lush trees arching over the lane with charming little restaurants and stores.  This city boasts numerous historic buildings designed by world-renowned architects.  It is just a few blocks away where Albert Einstein roamed the campus at Caltech in the 1930s, and it is a short walk to the famous Pasadena Playhouse.  This is where we would love to have a bookshop, a place where people can enjoy a fine cup of coffee or some tea with delicious pastry and get lost in some of their favorite books”.  

And so it happened… our dream came true…   and we were so excited to start… it didn’t matter to us how much time and energy it would take … we just loved every moment of it, and love it since… If you love to read, and love books, you know that magic surrounds them.  

But we are also aware of the reality of the business.  We are making changes to our model to make sure that we’ll be able to sustain and become profitable with the bookstore for many years to come.  In order to do that one of the steps we made is that we are transforming the Art Gallery and the The Relatively Small Einstein Museum into a non-profit organization.  This way, in addition to all our existing special events, we'll be able to add many new lectures, events, educational programs, including small group tours from our Einstein Museum to the Einstein Papers Project and other parts of the beautiful campus of Caltech, and it will not take resources away from the bookstore.  In the meantime a group of professional friends of our bookstore, generously offered their time and started to help us with business consulting to help us turn the business around, which has been invaluable.  


WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER…

Our lease is up, and the landlord(s) who have been very patient and gracious to us throughout the years, will only renew our lease if we are able to prove that we are a viable business and we have six-months rent in reserve.  In the meantime we are also working on several very exciting new projects for the store… And this is where we need your help. It was under extraordinary circumstances that we were able to lease this space on the first place, where kind friends came and helped us start from nothing.  But this was the perfect place for all the things that we have envisioned from the beginning, so we persevered.  Our close proximity to Caltech has been invaluable to us.  Students, teachers, and everyone have been a great support to our store.  If we would have to relocate, we might not be able to have the unique lectures, which we and our community have been so fortunate to participate in.  Also, in the case of relocation, the cost of the move would be significantly higher, not counting the loss of sales due to relocation and preparation of a new space. 

So we ask for your help to make all this possible… We are grateful for any contribution, so we put together the perks with that in mind.  This was possible with the help of many generous artists, musicians, professors, businesses, individuals, and we hope you’ll love our unique perks as much as we love to put it together for you…

Art opening with live jazz music, Krys Mach, Saxophone, Donn Cunningham, Guitar  

Keith Harrop's great artwork 

Our Children's Books Nook 


THE IMPACT

This campaign and the funds that we raise here will determine the future of Century Books.  If you would like to see the bookstore continue as a creative community space at this beautiful location, please join us and contribute here and spread the word to your family, friends, and colleagues.   We are inviting you to be a part of this next chapter of Century Books and all the projects the shop has created and we are looking forward to more exciting events at the bookstore.  We ask you to join us!  


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't make a donation to the campaign, you can still help Century Books succeed by contributing in other ways.  We would greatly appreciate it if you would:

  • Spread the word!  Please forward this campaign on to all family, friends, and colleagues who may be able to assist us with donation of any amount.   Let them know how important Century Books is to the community and help us get the word out about this campaign and drum up support!

  • If you can volunteer some time, we would love for you to get involved.  Please send us an e-mail for more info.   

We would like you to know how much we appreciate all your support and help, and it is you and the community's support that makes this store special!  Thank you!

story:
HI! my name in Dan Green and I represent a group of people who are passionate about Raw Food and living on the basis of Prior Unity. We want to share this with the People of America in a BIG BUS!


“The eating gorilla is the image of the true man, the true woman. He demonstrates the principle of true politics, of real human existence, in which we are always presently connected to the Food Source in Truth, and are always presuming connection, relationship, ‘I love you’.”
- Adi Da Samraj, “The Eating Gorilla Comes in Peace”  © 2009 ASA

http://www.rawgorilla.org/



We need:
  • $30,000 to purchase a large vehicle to act as a mobile kitchen, living quarters and raw food venue.
  • We will be coming to some of the largest Festivals in the U.S. this year, starting in April on the West Coast of California and Oregon
  • We will be holding retreats, courses and seminars about living on the basis of a regenerative and sustainable relationship to food and to the world in general
  • If we don't receive enough funds for a REALLY BIG BUS, we will get the BIGGEST BUS we can get with the funds available.



This World Needs A New Diet and a New Way of Life!

We intend to help bring about real change in the way folks relate to diet and how the look after their bodies and the planet we live on. Toxic food is having a terrible impact on the ecosystem and the digestive system of people all over the earth. Its time to spread the word, and encourage people to try something new and change their habits by offering them something new, tasty and eco/bio sustainable.

"You can have fun and suffer, or you can enjoy a continuous sense of well-being and enjoy freedom from the negative exaggerations of physical existence. "

- Adi Da Samraj, “The Green Gorilla”  © 2009 ASA


We also want to bring to people an orientation to life in general that puts you in touch with a greater sense of connectedness and awakens a condition of prior unity and happiness that is inherent to all beings. The Truth is that we are already connected and already sustained at a deeper level that merely physical existence. Much of what we suffer in life, and which gets expressed in the way we use and abuse food is an expression of the forgetting of that Truth, that Prior Condition.

To satisfy what human beings truly want and need and to ensure a benign future for life on earth, we have no choice: We must transcend what separates us and build on the deep foundation we all share, which is our prior, or already-existing unity.

To find out more visit: http://www.priorunity.org/

We have been successful in bringing the Message to thousands of people so far through education courses, seminars and festival events such as "Mind, Body, Spirit", "Wanderlust" and "Confest" but it's time to hit the road and do it on a much larger scale.


There Will Be Challenges and Risks!

Folks might get healthy, they might get Happy! they might change the way they relate to non-humans and the eco-system as a whole! It might even change the World! but these are risks we a willing to take..

So come and Join Us!

Get on board the BIG BUS campaign and join us on the Road this year at the Festivals below! SEE YOU THERE!
  • "Lighting In a Bottle"  - May 25 to 30. Bradley, CA
  • "Beloved Festival" - August. Tidewater, OR
  • "Symbiosis Gathering" - September 17 to 20, Oakdale CA

story:
Dear Friends,

Recently, New York City pledged $8.2 billion in public funds to a 15 year affordable housing plan addressing homelessness.  But in this indispensable safety net, there is a  gaping hole and falling through it are teenaged mothers and their children who do not meet the criteria for affordable housing; rather, they are limited to living in shelters.

My social enterprise, PedaCorp, Inc.,  deals directly with this crisis. I am seeking $15,000 for a down payment on a property that will provide affordable housing to young mothers aging out of a foster home or at-risk of homelessness.  Also, PedaCorp will provide a supportive network and a variety of services that will help them transition to an independent life. 

One of the reasons I feel so passionate about this issue is that I am among those who aged out of foster care as a young mother with limited resources.  What I had was resilience and the help of people, like you, along the way.  The kind of help I received is now this kind of help and support I am seeking for young mothers aging out of foster care.

Today, I have a home, two beautiful children, 20 years of professional experience as a child welfare and housing administrator, two Master’s degrees, and the know-how to provide young mothers with some stability and a way to move forward.

In this uncertain economy, the city does not lack for crisis and social services to deal with them.  This particular crisis, however, is being tragically ignored.  That is why I am asking for your donation to help PedaCorp to provide the first opportunity of its kind to young mothers (with one child) who have aged out of the foster care system and into an uncertain future.

Donations of any amount will be appreciated.

Thank you so much,

Katherine Cherry, MSW, MPA

story:
Serving Miami's Local Craft Beer Community!

The vision of Lincoln's Beard Brewing Co. starts and ends with the local community. In 2014, a group of local craft beer heads endeavored to bring more locally brewed craft beer to the woefully underserved neighborhoods across Miami. We actually first sought to open a craft beer bar that would only serve locally brewed craft beer. But we continued to develop more interesting and delicious home brews, and suddenly started winning multiple brewing competitions and awards. Finally we looked around and noticed that although there are some great craft beer breweries already serving up delicious creations in Miami...there simply aren't enough of them. And none of them are located very close to central Dade County.


When you contribute to Lincoln's Beard Brewing Co. you'll be part of helping bring locally brewed craft beer to the heart of the Miami craft beer drinking community. And as Lincoln's Beard Brewing Co. grows...you'll always be part of the foundation that made it all possible.

Your Contribution Gets Us to the Finish Line! (And GetsYou Awesome Perks!)

The co-founders of Lincoln's Beard Brewing Co. not only bring a wealth of varied professional experience to the fight; they also brought their check books (and savings, and retirement funds!) We broke the piggy banks, but need a few more dollars to finish the job.

We need an additional $50,000.00 to complete the renovation of the building that will be the home of Lincoln's Beard Brewing and the craft beer home to the local community. (Check out our progress in the gallery tab and stay tuned for updates!) We count every penny and we spend them ever wisely. We don't cut corners and we don't sacrifice quality, but we find the best deals and when we can, we do the work ourselves. But let us worry about the sweaty construction...let's talk about the perks for you!

When you contribute to Lincoln's Beard Brewing Co. you're not just funding a faceless business; you're getting fantastic, tangible craft beer perks in return. Some of these perks will only be available during this campaign, and some last a lifetime!

Mmmm....Beeeer!

Do you love high quality award winning craft beer? We gotchya covered! Most of the perks are pre-sales of our locally brewed craft beer. We have some exceptional barrel aged, limited release craft beers that are highly sought after at craft beer festivals and tasting events. You can reserve your bottles now before they go on sale to the general public.


We Bought Out AB-InBev! Now You Can Too!

Are you tired of AB-InBev buying out craft brewers? Yeah, so are we. That's why we wrote an open letter to AB-InBev offering to acquire them. Right now we're sinking all our money into our brewery, so that acquisition is on hold. But that offer was more than just having fun at Bud's expense, we're passionate stewards of the craft beer culture. If you share that passion, we have a really cool perk for you. Available only during this campaign, we will be providing our exclusive "I Bought Out AB-InBev" shirt as a perk. You're gonna love the design! Honest Abe crushing ABInBev with his pennyfarthing! And you're gonna love the looks you get from your friends and fellow beer heads!

Be a Railsplitter!

If you're going to be a regular patron of Lincoln's Beard Brewing Co. you're definitely going to want to check out our Railsplitter Society. It's WAY more than a mug club or loyalty program. You not only get lots of very useful craft beer paraphernalia, you get tremendous value on discounted merchandise and, best of all....discounted delicious craft beer! There are only 212 membership slots available so you'll need to secure yours fast! Why 212 you ask? Lincoln's birthday...of course!

Lifetime Perks!

For those of you that want to make a truly lasting impact, we have some perks that will last for generations! When you and your friends tour the brewery, show them which vessel is yours...ya know...the one with your name on it! Are you an aspiring brewer? Come brew with our award winning head brewer and build your brewing credentials. Have you dreamed of creating that perfect craft beer? You can do just that as part of our team. Are you going to be a lifetime regular? How does free beer...for life...sound to you? Check out The Great Emancipator Package!

    Help Spread The Word!

    We hope each and every one of you that shares our passion and vision for craft beer will join us in our endeavor. If you can take advantage of our perks we think you'll really enjoy them and get value for your money. Some of the perks have limits so act now before their gone! But remember...everyone can help regardless of their contribution level by spreading the word about Lincoln's Beard Brewing and what we're trying to accomplish for the craft beer community. IndieGoGo has some great sharing tools to help share with your own personal communities and networks. We're on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, but don't stop there. Spread the word however you can.

    Thank you very much for checking us out. Hope to see you in the Tap Room!

    Important Note: We are prohibited by law to ship beer. Please come by the brewery to pick up any beer perks. You may also designate a representative to pick up beer on your behalf. We will ship t-shirts, glassware and stickers to non-local US addresses only for NO additional charge. We'll reach out to you for a shipping address later. If you're local, please come by and visit the brewery to pick-up your items. See individual perks for more details.
story_txt:
Serving Miami's Local Craft Beer Community!
The vision of Lincoln's Beard Brewing Co. starts and ends with the local community. In 2014, a group of local craft beer heads endeavored to bring more locally brewed craft beer to the woefully underserved neighborhoods across Miami. We actually first sought to open a craft beer bar that would only serve locally brewed craft beer. But we continued to develop more interesting and delicious home brews, and suddenly started winning multiple brewing competitions and awards. Finally we looked around and noticed that although there are some great craft beer breweries already serving up delicious creations in Miami...there simply aren't enough of them. And none of them are located very close to central Dade County.

When you contribute to Lincoln's Beard Brewing Co. you'll be part of helping bring locally brewed craft beer to the heart of the Miami craft beer drinking community. And as Lincoln's Beard Brewing Co. grows...you'll always be part of the foundation that made it all possible.
Your Contribution Gets Us to the Finish Line! (And GetsYou Awesome Perks!)

 The co-founders of Lincoln's Beard Brewing Co. not only bring a wealth of varied professional experience to the fight; they also brought their check books (and savings, and retirement funds!) We broke the piggy banks, but need a few more dollars to finish the job.



We need an additional $50,000.00 to complete the renovation of the building that will be the home of Lincoln's Beard Brewing and the craft beer home to the local community. (Check out our progress in the gallery tab and stay tuned for updates!) We count every penny and we spend them ever wisely. We don't cut corners and we don't sacrifice quality, but we find the best deals and when we can, we do the work ourselves. But let us worry about the sweaty construction...let's talk about the perks for you!
